OmwDkINp4p8P69FWbvm7vQ.text: Went to Kid Cashew for lunch! The experience and food were great. I had the salmon and brussel sprouts - both were delicious! I'm really shocked to see so many negative reviews. I plan to go back one evening for cocktails and dinner.

2b1LnchtsvjXW2t7XIHAbA.text: Just left this place. Can I say.. Delicious!!? My hubby & I arrived about 730 and waited about 10 minutes to be seated out on the patio. Inside was very packed, loud and the wait was half and hour. The sun was just going down so it was perfect and the musician was great! Decor was absolutely adorable and rustic. Loved it! We ordered quite a few items and enjoyed every bit! It was all very flavorful. (I am drooling as I'm typing just thinking about the food!) We ordered Brussel sprouts, roasted beets, hummus, forbidden rice, eggplant casserole & half a chicken. It was all very delicious but I must say the chicken was the best I've had! Moist & packed with flavor! We knew what we wanted & the food came out pretty quick, surprisingly on how packed it was.. No complaints though! Wish we had saved room for dessert! Our server was nice and attentive. We will be back, soon. Mmm mm GOOD!

UMptw8odiOWSs6A565ADoA.text: Been here multiple times and have never been disappointed! Food is amazing, drinks are great, and the service is wonderful.

y_eJ39NN75Qp7d0rh9OdZg.text: Not sure when this restaurant opened, but what an addition to East Blvd! My wife and I stopped in for dinner Sunday and were not disappointed. The interior atmosphere is warm and inviting, and the bar/kitchen area is fun and relaxed. Food portions were excellent and well made with fresh ingredients. We ordered the grilled octopus, small plate of hummus, spiced feta, and tzatziki, pulled pork panini, and the super grain salad - all fantastic! Will absolutely be back soon to sit at the bar or revisit the outdoor patio!

pMpDyN3QissPGB5Rx6wbbw.text: Great place and the outside patio makes it worth a sit outside. Lamb burger is great and the grilled beets are really good. There are comments that the service was poor but this is changed (from my experience) since they beefed up the staff. You'll enjoy it here. Again lamb burger is worth a try!!!

CpC0d5q9eW6cGpML1jWZrw.text: Great decor and patio out front.  Overall the food was very good.  It is a limited menu but everything was cooked well.  We had great service and the food was presented very well. We went with the Brussels as a side and they were great with a good lemon finish.  I had the pork sandwich and it was full of flavor and the pickled onions were perfect.

QfgHR9FK85QcZYMko2VAOw.text: Excellent food excellent service excellent atmosphere.  The specialty margaritas with cucumbers and jalapenos are amazing. We had the pork shoulder, the shrimp and the brussels sprouts. Best brussels sprouts of ever had. It was a little loud but I think it was just due to the excitement in the restaurant. Very nice patio outside overlooking East Boulevard.

Tt3P-FaKZEnBtMAGn5QnUQ.text: Best salmon ever.  I loved lightly smoked fish and the chicken was moist, tender and had a nice smokiness.  Locally sourced food. The forbidden rice is a must!  Friendly well-trained servers and great interior design.  Loved it!  Will make this a regular dining spot for sure

I_ezvcUcGSMWSqzT9-MxFg.text: Atmosphere is cool and good for dates, family dinners, etc. Great food but small menu. Good for splitting with other people! I would suggest buying a couple of dishes and passing them around. Outdoor seating area is beautiful and staff is really friendly!

W-apCxn66xZNSpY4As0_GA.text: Went here for dinner on a Saturday to catch up with a friend, and I had high hopes, but was overall unimpressed. We came in around 5:45 and were seated immediately, which was a pleasant surprise, but the first impression I got was that it was all very sanitized and cold (as in unfriendly). Like the sort of place old white people go when they want to say nice things to each other's faces, then be snide behind each other's backs. Not a great atmosphere.  The waitress made a few recommendations, but the menu was quite limited. I appreciate that they rotate the menu seasonally, but that's no excuse for 6 appetizers, 4 salads, 4 sandwiches, and 5 entrees. They need a few signature staples that they can run on the menu. I did the classic "scope out everyone else's order to see what I should get," but nothing really caught my eye. I decided that, being advertised as a Mediterranean restaurant, you can't go wrong with the lamb gyro. The lamb was very tender, but not very flavorful. Most of the flavor seemed to come from the oddly sour tzatziki it was drenched in. I was pleasantly surprised that it did come with a side of fingerling potatoes, which were seasoned to high heaven. It's like they couldn't decide what flavor they should be. My friend got the cilantro chicken salad, which was also drenched in dressing. Both plates were a normal human-sized serving (which is great for people who need help limiting portions on a diet), but at $10 for a chicken salad, I feel like there should be some leftovers to take home.  On the whole, it's a great concept behind their restaurant, but a rather cold atmosphere and meh food made it the sort of place we didn't want to stick around. Even though we were catching up on life, we stayed maybe an hour, tops. Ended up going somewhere else where we could enjoy dessert and each other's company. I'd say it's alright, but not worth your time.

za9QiOs7mlQhUO5Cx8c9RA.text: Went to Kid Cashew a few weeks back and the food as very good. Everyone in our party of 4 really enjoyed everything especially the lamb burger and Brussels sprouts. What really put everything over the top was the cilantro yogurt sauce, which is a must try. The service was a bit slow even for a Friday night. Will definitely be back

8x4eWoOT_SfK0UuRz0bGIg.text: To start the food at KC is both enjoyable and creative. Choices are varied yet as an overall menu works in a very pleasing way. I've order and enjoyed the Trout entree, lamb and also shared an evening of small plates with a group of four. Loved the roasted octopus which is hard to find here in Charlotte. Now for the downside. Three visits to the restaurant each one effected to the negative by the staff.  The front end staff and waiter/waitresses are not on par with the level or price of the food. Case in point, the last trip included; told my wait time would be 30-40 min at 6:30, went to the bar ordered a drink and they came to tell us the table is ready, great but each time I have gone to CK they can't seem to provide a correct wait time, how can you be off by 30 min at 6:30. Second we had an inside table and could not hear each other speak because it was so loud from all the parties of 6-12 (they only take resv for parties of 6 or more). It took our waiter almost 15 min to get back to our table to order because he had to explain the whole menu to a table of 12, maybe 2 waiters would help at large tables. Lastly our waiter did not return 2 credit cards to our table, lucky we had not gone far before we noticed, returned for the cards and received no apology for the last inconvenience. Sorry for the run on review but I hope owners/managers seriously look at the quality of the staff they are placing front and center to their guests. Food brings people in but bad service will keep them away

NOxzIg6mCOb80sC0IPwBtQ.text: I had their lamb burger and it was outstanding!! Nothing is fried or frozen and what a difference it makes!!

0RO-_kJdVFwc8aVeVeqE1g.text: Omg! Such a great restaurant and perfect for sharing! Will K. was our server and was so knowledgeable and gave great recommendations!!!! Seriously a great place to go. Loved it!

M-UrDUwa08AnlOkiyEWGsA.text: This really sucks that I have to leave two stars because the food is awesome.  It's hard to find perfectly cooked octopus, but they got it here. Trout with quinoa tomato salad was amazeballs. Brussel sprouts, beet and arugula salad, lamb gyro (we ordered a lot) are all on the list of things I would definitely order again.  But I probably won't order again soon until they figure out how to run a restaurant... 15-20 minutes average time waiting for a drink.  To the point where you just go ahead and order another one as soon as you get one... AC broken which I know isn't there fault, but at least bring us water when we've asked four times?  Server messed up orders, bringing the completely wrong dishes on two different occasions.  When the right dishes arrived we had no silverware or plates for days. Had to beg the hostess (she was the only one trying to do anything) twice to please help us because no one was paying attention to any customer ever.  The manager happened to come by to deliver our salad and we alerted him to the trauma that was ensuing across most patrons that night.  He literally looked at us like we were reading him a manual on how to operate a vacuum cleaner.  Bizarre.  A massive thunderstorm blew in.  Customers were moving their own tables, food, babies, while this manager was doing nothing but looking at the sky in wonderment.  I'm so sad because i recommended that we come here to my friends because I believe in the food but that became a blip on the radar after dealing with what we went through.

r7g4zX9rDd3I7J-MF1nLlA.text: Came in around 7:30pm during the Super bowl. The space is very tasteful as was the food and drinks. Will be back many times. Very friendly staff

QRIIovYeHZsySPeErPfFZQ.text: Great find in Dilworth.  Lots of fresh & organic items.  The chicken and Brussel sprouts were delicious.  A little pricey but generous portions and I ended up taking stuff home.  Impeccable service and nice environment.  I'd highly recommend it.

f7ToWaI72mLRbwx9Urw5nw.text: Hands down the absolute best Mediterranean Restaurant in Charlotte. Refreshing to see Mediterranean food done the right way with fresh ingredients and none of that frozen crap. The ambiance is warm, inviting and non-pretentious. The service is non-stuffy but top notch. The food here is hands down the stand out!!! I'm one who likes to try everything possible and I love KC because of the small plates variety and half pound proteins to order. The must try is the octopus, mac and five cheese gratin, smoked nc mountain trout, beat & arugula salad, super green salad, forbidden rice & wild mushroom paella and slow cooked pork panini. The absolute to DIE FOR are the natural ground lamb burger (which I think is the best "burger" in all of Charlotte), leg of lamb and pork shoulder. I've eaten here 3 times already and I will be back again very soon. Definitely a True gem of a restaurant. By the way, forgot to mention if you want a cocktail, please do yourself a favor and order the Breast Milk. You can thank me later. Hats off to the wizards of Kid Cashew, Giorgios Bakatsias, Martin Sprock and Azam Mehdi. You guys did an incredible job with this place! Lastly, if you guys decided you want to go, I suggest going before peak hours. This place get's packed with a line out the door and a few people deep at the bar every time I've come to dine.

IDZUi4k_swoON5DsTo6x2g.text: I was hoping for more vegetarian options based on the name. The place smelled great, I just don't have a desire to eat rotisserie anymore, but if you are carnivorous, then this place would be amazing. I ended up having the mac and cheese with shallots and it was quite tasty and filling for only a small price tag of $5. Good location, nice decor and friendly staff.

NybayxW3Hu6ofYRabgfEcg.text: If you like salt then you'll love this place. They said keep everything as fresh as possible and i guess they're using salt to do so. The environment is  super cute but the food was so salty we didn't even finish our meals. Basically like drinking ocean water. Not what we expected at all because of the hype.

ompgqFu-j9GMtSZWNxmw6w.text: Good atmosphere and service but the food was mediocre. We did like the starter of baked spinach and feta dip though.

yDuU_xQPoYyQvhyI7UFEGA.text: This restaurant has fantastic food and very southern chic atmosphere.  This is my second time here, and I enjoyed the lamb burger and crab cakes - both delicious. The tzatziki sauce on the burger was perfect - great Mediterranean seasoning as well. We came with two toddlers and enjoyed the child friendly atmosphere as well. Unfortunately the waitress seemed off, disappeared often when she was needed, and forgot our drink orders twice - after waiting an extended period of time and awkwardly making eye contact across the restaurant she seemed to remember us and ran back to the bar to put in the orders. I'm looking forward to coming back & checking out the patio now that the weather is warming up.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb burger

-eQPKBVYgJJXEByrFXxwWg.text: Had a great experience here.   Went with friends so we sampled a lot   the half chicken and Mac and Cheese were on point  The Big Mac...don't hate...seriously good.   My wife got the chicken sandwich. So good.   Friend got the lamb burger. I'm not a fan, but she said it was greats   The spreads for an app were solid.   Felt homey like I was eating in someone's kitchen.  We'll be going back.

U3ExYUs5YlRhHvdUe1JUFg.text: MEH.  Ok, so its farm to table. No heat lamp or microwave. Big deal  ... not.  Arrived on a Saturday night @ 6:30 with a reservation for 6. Place was crowded and VERY noisy. Too noisy for my taste. Waiter was just OK. If there were specials, we were not told. Food took a while to reach the table and not at the same time. We waited until all meals were delivered before we ate.  Everything is ala cart. The lamb burgers were chewy. The gyros use real lamb meat (not what I expected) and not much of it. Fairly expensive per meal. Drinks too. No commercial soda or ice tea. Hey, the water was free.  Meanwhile, our waiter got lost. By the time we wanted to leave, we had to wait for the check. I will not go back. There are numerous restaurants in Charlotte that are better.

r5inU8eaJhOQQBXBVk4GBQ.text: Great food great atmosphere. The meatballs were amazing appetizers. The burgers were great. Love the music and the cozy atmosphere. The service was very good.

tYroAxx7W1S4zTFgZdcS6w.text: I joined my friend here for lunch. They weren't busy, but it was more of a late lunch. The ingredients were all fresh, and the sandwich was delicious. The service was friendly, and I really like how the place is decorated. I'd be interested in checking out their dinner menu.

A1Pm1ggjlkXmOVkxvnzEQA.text: Question: Who the *bleep* is Kid Cashew anyway?  Answer: I don't care because I love his food.  Apparently this location has been reincarnated many times. Most recently a Tijuana Flats. What they've done with this place is nothing short of amazing. I liken it to eating in a Pottery Barn with European cafe flair. Whoever designed this place and chose the decor should please come remodel my house.  The menu follows the KISS principle, is one page and neither tries to shotgun foodie palates nor overwhelm you with a drudgery of fanciful selections. The items are well chosen featuring fresh ingredients while still managing to cover a broad enough spectrum to have a little something for everyone.  The Oregano Chicken sandwich was an artfully presented dish that was more reminiscent of a chicken salad on flatbread. The best part was that it tasted great.  I liked my side dish even more than my main course; chunks of roasted red and golden beets with pistachios, whipped goat cheese and fresh orange sections. Simply fantastic with incredible depth of flavors!!  Our waiter was very good and not only took our joking around but joined in!  Great atmosphere all around - bustling with great energy! Local drafts= yay! Awesome place to come with a dinner club and share your dishes!!  Saving my fifth star to see if they can repeat this performance...

DRaFIB9vk8lMFxKLKkfO3A.text: Went for lunch a couple of weeks ago with a group.  Eclectic decor and a good place to bring someone from out of town.....which I was!  Had the lamb gyro which was solid.   We also had a few appetizers which were good.  I would recommend this place.

5_6Aa_hsELx3VuRTBtrUIQ.text: Stopped in here after an event with a few of my Yelp friends. This is in one of those restaurant spaces that has seen a high turnover in recent years but I think Kid Cashew is going to be very successful here.  There are a few different seating options here. On the left side of the restaurant are a few 4 seater bar tables. Across the aisle from those is a large family style table of at least 20 seats. To the right of that table are a few round tables and against the right wall are smaller tables with bench seating against the wall. There is also seating at the bar in the back and a large patio out front so there are plenty of seating options.  The menu consists of small plates and items to be shared with a few sandwiches and salads mixed in. They also have a craft cocktail selection, local craft beer and a decent wine selection.  We had a group of 6 and we all ordered something different so we could sample each others meals. My selections were the portobello mushroom sandwich and the brussels sprouts.  The mushroom burger was really good with a good mixture of flavors. I'd put it in my top 2 of local portabello sandwiches. The brussel sprouts were good but some of them were a little undercooked. I was able to sample some of the other plates at our table. The lemon-oregano chicken sandwich is an open faced sandwich with great flavors. The wood-fired beets were the real winner in my book.    Despite being advertised as small plates and sharable items, the portion sizes were decent and actually on the large side of small, if that makes any sense.    I thought the service was great despite the fact they were busy. Our server, Joshua, was amazing and everyone else helped out where they could.   I definitely plan to visit this place more often, especially since I live so close.

G7xMROzTOFG7p2ozlClPiw.text: One of my top favorite places in Charlotte!  I can't recommend this place enough.  This spot has indoor or outdoor seating. It's great for couples, friends, and family.  The decor is beautiful and so unique.  The owner was is from Greece, so no wonder the food was delicious!  We ordered their winning beef mac & cheese for appetizer.  We also ordered the trout, lamb burger, and Brussels sprouts to share for dinner...all which were nothing short of AMAZING!  I have to say the lamb burger is out of this world and won my heart.  We absolutely cannot wait to bring family & friends to try this spot.

LSm3Ia9PhAXwlAJo1h8BKw.text: Decided to come here for my birthday dinner with my best friend. Perfect decision. The food was great, the price was perfect. The wine was good. Decor was beautiful.   Okay. Let's dig deeper. 20 min wait which was absolutely fine, actually seated us quicker. First thing we notice was the awesome decor of this place! We take a look at the menu and then had the waitress explain what to do. Basically you can add a protein from their list to any salad or sandwich or you can share a protein and sides. We decided to share a leg of lamb, eggplant casserole and potato gratin as the waitress said it was plenty food for two. I enjoyed a glass of Cabernet while the wait. Great, flavorful wine. Our meal came and it was plenty for both. Although I'm pretty sure I could have killed it alone. Lol! Just make sure you order more sides if you have a large appetite. Everything was cooked perfectly. and tasted great!   They have two options for dessert. Bakalava and a sundae. We got both! And they were worth every calorie! So delicious. The sundae is pretty big so I would share if i were with a date that wanted it. Since we shared the food, we split the bill down the middle putting us at 27 a piece. Not bad at all!   My only complaint and I mean only, is that there were moments I was literally sweating everywhere! I don't know if it's because it has an open kitchen concept or the air wasn't working. I was so uncomfortable. Even my cold natured, always freezing, company was sweating....This resulted in the four outta five stars. If they could improve this air conditioning situation, this place would be perfect!

SDGNNYxawzE-HMl8xhhQIw.text: I absolutely loved the lamb! It was well seasoned and so tender. They don't cook the lamb to temperature because it's roasted over the wood fire. It was so full of flavor and it's paired with a dipping sauce. The sandwiches do come paired with potatoes although it's not indicated on the menu. The mac and cheese was okay but nothing special to write home about. I did like the Goat's Breastmilk, it can have a strong licorice bite to it, but I thought it was tasty.  I will definitely be back because I want to try the two patty lamb burger and some other dishes.

pAfl7YZ4Hd0cGpTGk1FviQ.text: I live in the area and have watched this location change owners several times, but after visiting Kid Cashew this past weekend, I have a feeling we may have found the right owner.  We had a group of six and were seated at a round table, a little small for six, but we made it work.  The place was packed, with a variety of customers, from friends to couples to even families enjoying Sunday dinner.   After taking a look the menu, it is what they advertised, a variety of small plates, definitely a little larger than tapas, but allows you to order multiple to share.  Out of the six of we are all ordered different items which was great. I went with the pork sandwich. Sliced pork on toast with arugula and spicy mustard.  Loved it. I also tasted the chicken and brussel sprouts and enjoyed them both as well.  There were a few items at the table I didn't get to try, but the others enjoyed, and all the reason to get me back to try those items.  I know it was a Sunday night and it was crowded, but I do wish the service was a little better.  Our server seemed a little overwhelmed and forgot my sandwich so I had to beg the others to go ahead and start, yet I had to ask our waiter twice for my dinner.   Overall, I really enjoyed Kid Cashew and am so happy they have come to the neighborhood. Count me in for being back soon!

SR3n4zrjcoxyHCv_xbKvgg.text: Stopped in Kid Cashew for the first time for lunch the other day. Was able to take advantage of the adorable patio and sit outside on a beautiful day. I did take a peek inside the restaurant which was equally as quaint and adorable. This place is very unique in comparison to other spots to stop in for lunch or brunch on east Blvd. I was blown away when I saw the menu, on top of all the healthy options... there were atleast ten vegan options that were not all salads. I ordered the vegan portobello gyro with lettuce, tomatoes, and chipotle sauce. It was delicious! My friend did the chicken salad sandwich with avocado which she enjoyed as well. We had excellent service despite the outdoor patio being packed. This is a great restaurant in Charlotte  with awesome vegan and healthy options! I will def be back next time I'm in town.

5PTarhpN1iBp342AFtYzGw.text: While I don't claim to be a prophet on my LinkedIn, I will make a prediction: this somewhat recent revolving door spot has finally found a permanent resident.  This used to be Tijuana Flats. Before that, Italian Pie. For all you True Charlotteans out there, you'll always remember it as the legendary Wad's Soda Shop that had a nearly 40 year run here.   My friend and I got two cocktails from the living libations section of the menu: the Cilantro (tequila, cucumber, jalapeno) and the Thyme (bourbon, peach, honey, bitters). Both were delicious. You've probably figured out by now from my reviews that I always go for any drink with some spice. I like that the wine is served as four ounce pours (don't worry, the price reflects that).   Food wise we decided on the octopus (perfectly cooked), mac & cheese gratin  (leeks, shallots, 5 cheeses, awesomeness), forbidden rice & mushroom paella, NC Mountain trout, and baklava. An absolutely fantastic meal, but I would have to say the biggest surprise was how delicious the quinoa was that came with the fish. It had a citrusy flavor twist to it. I could eat an entire bowl by itself. We split all the food, including the fish. It was a good sized piece. Next time, I want to try the gelato and the beet salad. Both sound pretty amazing.   The decor is rustic and beautiful, even the background music was great. There's a long community table in the middle. It was packed when we walked in, but we only had to wait a few minutes for a table. Service was top notch. Our server Matt was amazing. On top of that, the manager stopped by to check on all the tables as well. The parking lot is kind of small. If it's full, check the side street off East. It's ja short walk.   This kind of feels like a place Dilworth has been waiting for and needing. Congrats to Kid Cashew, I look forward to coming back.

iABY9G3BNeEfU1BhPIlB8Q.text: The smoked trout starter was good but I believe it missed a few toppings that were listed on the menu.   The eggplant isn't babaganoush and I'm not sure what it was...It lacked the smoky flavor I thought it would have like a babaganoush!  The octopus (FYI not local! Despite the "everything local" them the restaurant goes for) was chewy and didn't have any flavor. It was hard to get through it all (sorry for being harsh!)   The place has a cute feel to it so I'll give it that!

As5INm81u_5C6p2f5LEiQQ.text: Octopus starter, lamb burger, and pistachio sundae dessert. Excellent meal.

q4kCvQ-FkF_7EO9_0BSo4w.text: Came here for the first time for lunch today and it was delicious!  The atmosphere is so eclectic and cute, and the menu has a ton of great options. I got the Big Mac daddy and it was the best burger I've ever had. I love McDonald's (yes I know) and Kid Cashews variation of the Big Mac did not disappoint. Really great place

TFk9OvxBVXDAg68J0oEB1g.text: Very solid 4, maybe even a 4.5.   Service - very attentive and even handled our indecisiveness and at times obnoxious humor well with our party of 7  Also, very accommodating. We were the tough table with a million requests, everyone talking loud and over each other, and complaints about the temperature. They moved us and handled all the nuances of our party exceptionally well.  Atmosphere - A little cold if you're under the vent and hot if you're not, but the servers and manager acknowledges and tried to adjust.   Really cool looking place. Noisy, but semi-casual yet comfortable too.  Food - What really matters and they were solid across the board. We started with pork shoulder and meatballs. The meatballs were hard enough on the outside with an absolutely amazing sauce. The wild rice was also delicious. Everyone in the crew liked their dishes: trout, salmon, portobello burger, chicken, and lamb. The lamb and trout went without anyone else getting a bite. Chicken was a little dry outside the wings, but still tasty.  Brussels sprouts, asparagus, and coleslaw were also on par with expectations.  Drinks - very different, but everyone went for second rounds. Beers and cocktails $5 drafts Thursday.   Will be coming back. Fo sho.

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. The white sauce is better than their cilantro. Go with tzatziki sauce
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mmmmmm meatballs. The best dish here

O0m-23c4-N06zeqi0GDdBA.text: I arrived at Kid Cashew around 6:30  p.m. on a Tuesday night.  The parking lot was full - not an anomaly in Dilworth - but we were able to find street parking.    Fortunately, the weather was nice this late-June night, so we were able to request a seat on the patio.  There was no wait - we were escorted to a table immediately.  Tuesdays at Kid Cashew are 1/2 price bottle of wine night - this means you can grab a bottle for as little as $15 -- woot!    My partner opted for a gin/cilantro drink prior to dipping into the bottle of wine.  The cilantro drink was quite tasty, though very sweet.  Our server explained that all dishes come out as they are ready - so be prepared for a staggered serving.  Soon after our drinks arrived, we received the smoked trout dip and chargrilled octopus.  The smoked trout dip was the highlight of the evening - served with grilled multigrain bread and creme fraiche - it was delightful and definitely a repeat order. The chargrilled octopus was not overly chewy - rather, it was cooked perfectly, though i i didn't love how much char was actually on the meat.    Next, we received the eggplant casserole and brussels sprouts.  The eggplant was very tasty, though it didn't just blow me away.  I had very high expectations for the brussels sprouts - first, i love roasted brussels sprouts and it's not hard to prepare them really well, and second, I had read a lot of amazing reviews on these sprouts.  Now, they were good and I would likely order them again....except, I would ask them to use less salt. If they had used a quarter of the salt originally used, these sprouts could have been amazing.  As served, they were just tooooo salty.    Finally, the atmosphere.  The venue is really nice.  There are beautiful chandeliers and a cool bar inside.  The patio outside is surrounded by potted plants and great tables. What was odd, however, was the live music. They had an acoustic guitar player on the patio that was very good...except he was amped up and way too loud.  It was hard to carry on a conversation when he was playing...which was during most of the meal.  Now, don't get me wrong, I really love live music, but this was out of control.  Given the opportunity, I'll definitely go back to Kid Cashew -- but, I'll avoid the patio if there's live music and I'll ask for less salt on my brussels sprouts.

mjfRDdm55WOwrWQhY9ZYdg.text: Delicious food, but so very loud. It was restaurant week when we visited, but that menu was small, so we ordered from the regular menu which has a wide variety of cuisine and price points. Their sandwiches are around $9 while entrees are closer to $18. The pork belly panini was out of this world as was the spicy feta dip. Other members of our party ordered the gyro, salmon, and trout. All were pleased. Sandwiches come with a side of fingerling potatoes, which were lacking a bit of flavor but were cooked well.   I tried the goat's breast milk. It was described as creamy, but tasted like a spritzy mojito. I was disappointed, so I opted for a glass of Chardonnay instead. Their drink menu had plenty of options to suit all tastes. It took awhile for our drinks to come out throughout the meal, but service at the bar seemed fairly quick.   There are no acoustics inside. So although the atmosphere is chic and inviting, I would not return unless we could sit on the patio.

9WIPvIBDqqoeJXKKXZNUWQ.text: Had the trio of dips and the Greek salad. It was delicious. The atmosphere is fun and they have a great selection of wine and local brews.

P_4X2x1POstadPME2Ts7ag.text: I guess we'll never know how the food was. We arrived at 5:45pm tonight and were seated by the hostess. There were at least 6 servers standing around, and maybe 4-5 tables dining. After fifteen minutes no one had come to our table, filled our water or even acknowledged our presence. At that point I asked the hostess how we got service. 5 minutes later, we called it quits and left. Hostess couldn't even stand up from leaning on the counter to apologize. Horrible. We won't be back!

aY5bWjOONix0OGq-Cam4Xw.text: Went to Kid Cashew for lunch today.  Absolutely loved the place and the food.  The table orders were for a lamb gyro, chicken and avocado sandwich and gold/red beet salad and loved it all.  Everyone at the table had a great experience and the service was spot on!  Will definitely return to try other items on the menu.  Parking was good!

sj65wXh0AOc6i0VwRiQfyA.text: Excellent service; did not have to wait for them to see you.  We were there at 130pm and I can tell they can get busy.  Food ideas good...taste was awesome!  I had chicken sandwich.  Loved the decor.  Overall...will be coming back even though it was a 30 minute drive!

aWB154ob0HxGl4GC9SfjXQ.text: I first came for a yelp elite event and was so impressed I went back within a week or two with my boyfriend.  It was simply amazing. Everything we ordered we both exclaimed "Oh my god" and made noises while eating. Every single dish is just to die for. I regret not getting the brussel sprouts. I never even liked brussel sprouts before having them here at the event, but now I am craving them. I've seen that some people have had service issues, but our service couldn't have been better even though we were on the patio. Kid Cashew is definitely a new favorite for the both of us. I can't wait to bring my sister when she comes to visit!

7AJ2qIkiwUTWg4yTC2Q6fA.text: Delicious and creative food. Excellent service. Great ambiance  - we sat outside and it was delightful

WFci1VnMM2kuxIuGsSWPyQ.text: Not sure about the negative Nancy's below there but food is awesome! Did we have to wait? Yes. Um, hello the place just opened. Our server  Joesaphe was on point. Although I think the restaurant it self is trying to figure out the "team work" - there was some confusion about who took the order, he bounced back and made sure the order was put in. We got Cilantro and Thyme drinks. (I favored Cilantro better - very refreshing and good am for summer). Spinach & fera dip - YUM! We followed by what seems to be family style meals: Leg of lamb, Mac and cheese, and brussels sprouts - delish! Tzaziki and cilantro sauce paired up amazingly.   Two downfalls to the atmosphere (none that cannot be fixed): 1) bathrooms felt like a sauna.  2) tables that are close to the bar had overwhelming crowd. Neither servers or guests could easily pass through. Had to wait out the traffic.   Overall, I'll be back for some more! Bring back the lamb chop on the bone Kid Cashew!

QLoGEgpW_jzg7cwCxKeKnw.text: Kid Cashew is worth a visit! The menu is small but has a good variety of choices for omnivores and vegetarians alike. We went for lunch and shared the lemon-oregano chicken sandwich and the pulled pork panini. Both were super tasty and filling. We also ordered the beet salad and Brussels sprouts but were too full from the sandwiches to finish. They made perfect afternoon snacks. Looking forward to trying some more menu items on a future visit. In addition, the servers (and manager) were wonderfully helpful, kind, and professional.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

5j1SDou3cDsFGFEYUWs3hQ.text: The Brussel sprouts and beet salad are some of my favorites. The mac and cheese is also to die for, served in an iron skillet. This place is one of my favorites in Charlotte for date nights, lunch dates or when friends/family are stopping through town. The cocktails are impressive as well! Definitely recommend!

tTKmoBwUecy2hRXZH1ZAMw.text: Apparently I don't need to wait for the third time's charm cause the second trip here was vastly improved. The service is much better than before being able to describe menu items in a way that doesn't leave me wondering why I don't just google it. I'm also very happy that seasoning issues have been fixed and the octopus we ordered did not taste like a salt block this time! Unfortunately the lamb was so overcooked and dry that I could not recommend it. I did finally get to try the cocktails here though they are now updated. The strawberry basil is kind of like a summerfied moscow mule. Delicious! I have to admit they are now much more likely to be a repeat destination for me.

e02ptKSwJB1MvGlGJDXytQ.text: Great food, and the kids eat free sundays are fantastic. Solid bloody Mary's from Bruce Julian as well. Always a go to place when done with freedom park.

rDtCxJi9SjkjTif1dWEz0A.text: The food was okay but the service was awful. We were celebrating a birthday in a group of 20 people. The whole place was far from crowded so one would think that it wouldn't take too long to take our order let alone our food. Half of our group received their order while the other have waited to for the staff to take our order. Also, one from our group didn't receive his lamb burger until an hour he made his order and after everyone finished their meals. To make matters worse, one from our group complained of the lackluster service and the manager from the night (the one with the Captain America tattoo on his left elbow), appeared to not want to hear of a legitimate complaint of slow service. He responded to a customer by rolling his eyes which was both rude and an inappropriate response to listening to a customers complaint. He did not seem to care which was baffling. I do not like giving a negative review but when a restaurant's staff is indifferent to providing good and attentive customer service, it's difficult to turn a blind eye to it.

hyyalSimMyHur5yWqWIT-g.text: First time in this past Tuesday.  This place is excellent!  My brother and I sat up at the bar area where you can view the Chef preparing dishes- cool atmosphere.  The manager, bartender and the chef were EXTREMELY friendly and accommodating. The chef even came over and mentioned some recommendations and checked on us after we got our food.  One of the best meals that I've had in a while.  Ordered the spicy feta cheese appetizer, 1/2 chicken as an entree with the sides of mac'n cheese and the brussel sprouts.  My taste buds were definitely satisfied!  In addition, on Tuesdays it is half off bottles of wine which we took advantage of.  When you combine such great personalities and friendliness with excellent food it is a recipe for a successful place.  Keep up the great work ladies and gents!!

x4MV2EsL4eq7VEEGA-vRlg.text: I really like Kid Cashew.  The food here is very good. They have amazing Mac & Cheese which I find difficult for most restaurants to pull off.  Their gyro sandwich is delicious.  The best beet and arugula salad I've ever had was here.  They have amazing Brussels sprouts and the salmon was cooked perfectly.  I would definitely eat here often.  It was a great vibe.  The only thing keeping it from a 5 star is that you can't do any substitutions. For example, if a dish comes with brussels sprouts and you don't like them, you can't switch it for a different side like green beans or chips.  You have to order it as it comes on the menu which doesn't seem fair to the individual purchasing the food.  I definitely plan to go back as they have a lot of healthy choices on the menu.  It's definitely the type of menu that makes you want to try more than one item.  I suggest going with friends who like to share! They also have nice outdoor seating for those who like to be outside.

2c3Pdwsc-yxpzMjIX2Xd6g.text: One of our favorites in the Queen City! We love the trio of dips, Brussels, and octopus. So many good options for carnivores, pescatarians, and vegans alike!! The open kitchen is fun to watch and all the food is really high quality. Definitely get the octopus. And don't miss the cilantro sauce if you order grilled meats! Their brunch is good too!!

HrKlbRYVAI_SqSkQO2F36Q.text: Went on a Saturday night and it was packed for dinner at 9:30pm. Waiter was amazing, Food was delicious! They were out of lamb so waiter suggested lamb burger and my husband loved it. I had chicken avocado sandwish and it was awesome. We also had the brussel sprouts which are flavored perfectly. Will defiantly go again and recommend to others. Was pretty noisy so if night was nice i would have sat outside on their pretty patio.

gSUjmkt9ornU6UavUdg4kg.text: I shared the Leg of Lamb (both the tzatziki and yogurt? sauces were excellent), Hummus and Brussel sprouts were a little better than average. Salted Carmel sundae was a great dessert option. Wife had the lamb gyro. She thought it was good- (not greasy) but needed more stuff in it.

tZV3o6HyrdyBbRasr0ELtQ.text: This is my first time here, and I'd heard great things. It was good but I probably won't come back. The atmosphere and decor was amazing - it's a really cool place, almost like an old school, very classy bar. They had wait staff and food delivery people everywhere, but the whole experience room us over two hours since our actual waiter only stopped by rarely. One member of our party didn't get her food (salmon and fingerling potatoes) until everyone else had completely finished. Here is what we got: -Spinach feta dip, which was good - more spinach than cheese.  -Fingerling potatoes, boring. No real flavor. -Brussels sprouts, also yummy but not a lot of flavor -Portabello mushroom sandwich - this was really good! I'm not vegetation but enjoyed all the flavors going on! Yum. -Lamb sandwich - also very good and rich, perfectly cooked. -Octopus starter - this is lying eat time trying octopus and I didn't love it, but I think it was well made. I just didn't like the texture of the meat. -Goats Breast Milk carafe - my favorite! This almost made up for the wait and the bland starters/sides. Delicious! Licorice under taste but mellowed out with the amaretto and mint/lemon.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Octopus appetizer

DzlbH3W9lD9NoWnsIXenyA.text: Came here with some girlfriends and tried a couple small plates to share. The mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts, spinach dip and a chicken sandwich were all great choices. Drinks are a little pricey but the food and atmosphere are great.

qc5M9UsgEsGDqjK4b5AFxg.text: Kid Cashew is an amazing and welcomed addition to an area that desperately needed refreshing.  Parking can be an issue due to the area, so plan ahead.  Kid Cashew has awesome seating capacity and heater overhead outside to allow you to enjoy sounds of the bustling city as you eat.  We have lucked up to have the same waitress twice and she has been stellar.  I ordered a Bloody Mary and it was delish, made without being overpowered by vodka. It was so good I had to order a second one.  This is the second time I ordered the half avocado quinoa salad and yummy!!  I can't get enough of the spicy chipotle sauce and avocado combo.  I tried the Mac and Cheese this time and WOWZA!  Worth the carbs!!   I'm thoroughly impressed by their menu option as well as cocktail selection.  I have yet to be disappointed.  Kid Cashew will be around for a long time because they are setting the standard for service in the area.  Great job and I can't wait to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac and Cheese with half avocado quinoa salad (chipotle dressing).

LnJ4jgONCTCA9lKYbEnbrg.text: I had a previous wonderful experience here, but after trying something different on the menu last night, I'm not so sure that EVERYTHING on the menu is a hit.   We started with the spinach and feta dip. It was good (how can it not be?) but a bit greasy. I then went with the chicken gyro. It wasn't well-balanced. The sauce was all over the lettuce, but not the chicken itself, making it really dry. On top of that, it just wasn't good-quality chicken. I figured they'd use the rotisserie chicken in it, but it tasted really cheap. I didn't end up finishing it because it really wasn't that great. My wife also had something different from last time (the lamb gyro), and didn't love hers either.   I think we're a bit more cautious now. Maybe it just depends on what you order.

nECJFP85nFhplhf9U7ypNw.text: Can't wait to come back! The outdoor patio is perfect (never went inside, so I can't speak to it). The menu isn't gigantic, but why add stuff when what you have works. Happy hour is until 6pm-small plates/appetizers are $6. Yay! I was torn between multiple small plates and ultimately chose the spinach and feta dip. It was delicious! It came in a hot little cast iron dish, was heavy on the spinach and also had some cream cheese in it. The pits that came with it was perfect and warm. And the ratio of pita to dip was spot on. My husband got the Big Mac Daddy Burger which came with chips. The chips were more kettle cooked style, spicy with a hint of dill. I could literally eat them all day. The burger was really good-and I'm not a huge burger person, but I did steal 3 bites before my husband could take it away from me. Friends with us also said they really enjoy their lamb burgers, squid small plate, brussel sprouts, and wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

azS3-WT3Evj1YK9t7qrrRg.text: The cocktail selection at Kid Cashew bumped this from four to five stars! We really enjoy the Cilantro and the Celery (just try them).  The food here was also pretty delicious. I'm obsessed with their cauliflower mash because it's sooo creamy and delicious. You would never know it wasn't potatoes unless someone told you!  Goose said their lamb gyro is the real deal, and I admit it looked pretty legit.  I was surprised to find the restaurant half full at 5:30pm on a weeknight, and it was jam packed and rolling by 6:30/7:00pm. Definitely try to get here early or for lunch!

HT6ypoNAaUeep_Gir8587g.text: Kid Cashew is a neat place if you like Vegan food and Gluten free. :) I had a great salad. The deserts were great. The wine was delicious also. Check it if your in the Charlotte, NC area

ksytjtuvXTAqnhKOVD38EQ.text: Amazing place! My new favorite restaurant in Charlotte! I can't recommend enough! We all didn't get anything that we didn't just love. The quinoa stuffed avocado was a great small plate to start with the I had a small plate of shrimp polenta for my dinner. It was OUT OF THIS WORLD good! And don't get me started on my friends dreamy white beans. Why are you still reading this & not running to kid cashew???

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quinoa stuffed avocado
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Polenta

Q7iAwEo8_42LoLlLNmJpIg.text: After having this place booked for a year I finally made it over today after checking out the Discovery Place nature facility. I Love the look of this place from the patio to the interior with the lovely chandeliers hanging. We arrived at about 4pm on a Saturday and was quickly greeted and shortly thereafter taken to a half booth half seat table and our server Adam came by with water and to say Hello.  We quickly ordered as we were starving, our toddler had the grilled cheese from the kids menu with chips and I asked Adam what was the best item from the Vegan menu and he was all inside my head as I was thinking of getting the Gyro and he promptly responded that his Fav item was the Portobello Hummus Gyro which I happily ordered and I also asked for a quinoa stuff avocado for a started. My husband ordered the beef skewers as an app and a Lamb Burger for his meal.  It was great to have a server to ask how we wanted the food to come out as we prefer our son food to always come out 1st or with apps and he put it in just that way and that's how it came out hot and fresh. My husband is a huge non-alcoholic Ginger beer fan so we inquired and Adam suggested a MockTail that included fresh cucumber, mint and ginger beer in a Moscow mule (non alcoholic) mug. We agreed and when I tell you it was amazing I mean it.  We all enjoyed our meal, my husband says the beef skewers is a must (Im Vegan so I wouldn't have any input but he is a foodie so I trust his opinion). The avocado stuffed with quinoa is a Must for me.  I look forward to working my way through the Vegan menu before the year ends as we will Be Back.

mRSS0wSaTpek3Qr85zjw2A.text: Kid Cashew is a favorite of mine.   I was recently impressed with a brunch I reserved for 15 people after my graduation from my Master's program. I was very nervous to take 15 people to a small restaurant, but they did a fantastic job!!   Service was quick, mimosas were fabulous, and everyone talked about the food!!   For their brunch, I recommend the Madame Croque & caraffe mimosas.   Lunch / Dinner - I am a huge fan on their Gyro and stuffed avocado.   THE STUFFED AVOCADO is so amazing! Very different, yumm!!

vGI-0ODv-KHcQrcbzlzfzA.text: Three colleagues and I came to Kid Cashew on a beautifu day, in which we enjoyed sitting at the outside dining area of Kid Cashew.  If at all possible, I would highly recommend enjoying your meal outside.  Our waitress, though I forgot her name, was a little scary.  She did not give a good vibe and the 4 of us felt a little put off by her.  She had a slight attitude and it was really hard to get her (or anyone else's) attention for long periods of time.  Apparently we were told it was very busy that evening.    Drinks - excellent, unique cocktails that were delicious - would highly recommend.  While the place gets rave reviews by my fellow Yelpers, I thought this place was just decent food-wise.  We started with the duo of spreads - pass on the hummus, but the tzatziki was so, so good!!  Worth a try as an appetizer.  The mac and 5-cheese side dish was also very good - cheesy for sure, but very good.  The brussel sprouts were just okay for me - I've had much better elsewhere and these didn't have the crisp I like.  For my main dish, I debated a long while and finally went for the lamb burger.  See, I LOVE lamb burgers, especially with feta cheese, but this just wasn't memorable for me.  I didn't end up finishing it.  Not sure what it was exactly - maybe a lack of seasoning?  It came with potato chips.  I guess it just didn't have as much of that gamey lamb flavor I love also.  Dessert was a huge fail for us.  They don't have an actual dessert menu - just ice cream and baklava.  We wanted ice cream and our ice cream came in the form of soft serve, half melted.  Who serves half-melted soft serve in a glass and calls it ice cream?  The baklava was also mediocre for us, unfortunately.  Food was okay, service could be improved, and dessert was a pass for us, but nevertheless I don't regret trying the place!

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baklava and really melty soft serve

wW3KAp48dEbR9UKuSy8nVA.text: Food and service were good but they sold my mother in law 3 $20 gift cards and only two worked.  I'll never buy a gift card from there and won't ever go back - doesn't matter to me whether the mistake was intentional or not. Actually I won't ever buy a gift card from anywhere; there's no protection for you if the card doesn't work.

lH2NxDmFgGTBZ-8gygL1cA.text: I've been wanting to go to Kid Cashew for a while. We tried to go a couple of times but the wait time was longer than we wanted to wait. That made it that much more desirable. Finally, we were able to go right before the dinner rush. I have mixed feelings about this place.   We started with the hummus as an appetizer and I wasn't a fan. It was a bit hard and lacked a bit of flavor, however, it wasn't bland. For dinner I had the Wood Fire Grilled Portobello Hummus Gyro. Although the hummus was just okay on its own, it was good in this gyro. The side was just chips.

flB_6yeQPeHmLKJw7Fy7Og.text: Great Diner after a long day on a plane from LA. Got up early in Brentwood/LA and caught a early flight from LAX. 5 hours later and we arrive at Charlotte Douglas and I was in no mood to tackle I-77 traffic between the airport and Cornelius so decided to have dinner down in Charlotte. Thought of a couple places but they were either closed or a drive in so ended up at Kid Cashew which oddly enough had been on list of restaurant to try anyway. Walked in and was promptly seated and presented with a menu and the took my order for Sweet Tea right away. One item on the menu piqued my interest and that was the Knocks Your Socks Off BBQ. I love Eastern NC Style BBQ and the Pulled Pork with Cole Slaw and a dressing that was described as a mixture of vinegar and peppers on Brioche translated to me a dressed up Eastern NC BBQ so I went with it. I was not disappointed. It was delicious. Nice and meaty with a moist smoky taste. I don;t normally like Cole Slaw unless I make it myself but this was delicious with a hint of Citrus. Chips were great. Don't normally eat desert but the talked me into a Gelato with Caramel Sauce and nuts. Overwhelming.in size with great taste. Excellent somewhat upscale atmosphere in a tastefully styled restaurant. Staff and manager are very friendly and will do anything they can to make your visit pleasurable.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sign on East Blvd
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor Dining
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Management and Staff

y6CzEHms9tN2dXwlOrm1Vg.text: The food was great. I had the salmon with quinoa. Small portion bit that is expected from some places. My friend had the gyro which was a normal size. She enjoyed her meal as well. The air conditioning system was not adequate for the temperature outside. We waved ours menus as fans whew. Server down played desserts like they were not that great so I did not try them.

kwhqExcZEixHhEdoQDCmZQ.text: I really can't see this as Mediterranean cuisine, but aside from that...underwhelming. Party of five and each persons order came out at different times. Mountain trout was salty, roasted chicken was meh, arugula beet salad...maybe 10 leaves of arugula. Won't be returning or recommending.

pcEYdkahZdO_8V6JPYulig.text: I went for my first time this past weekend and I was so pleased with finally deciding to check this place out! I don't know why I haven't went here sooner!?!The service was fantastic, the food was delicious (the mimosas as well), they have a dog friendly patio (major plus), and the manager was very attentive! Great atmosphere too! I will definitely be returning very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rotisserie Lamb Gyro and Quinoa Stuffed Avocado

nCnbh9CSnEBlcT0ikgT98g.text: We had driven by this place a few times so finally we decided to stop and have some dinner. I am really glad we did! The place was busy but our server did not act like it, she was completely in control of her tables as well as the bar! great staff and the foods is awesome!

VvLyyldkVYfil3UG1emwzg.text: The space is beautiful. Nice patio, pretty chandeliers inside.   Service was a little slow, food was good but nothing amazing.   They have some gluten-free or gluten-free option dishes. We started with hummus and it was yummy with pots bread. I had the Scottish salmon with salsa and quinoa. It was good. I also ordered a side of the kettle potato chips, which were well-seasoned. I was disappointed in the dessert options-- only baklava and a gelato flavor, however they did make it a sundae with chocolate sauce and Heath topping.   My friends got the brussel sprouts and shrimp. The Brussels had a lot of oil at the bottom. The shrimp was good, but it was a lot of sauce with nothing to soak it up, so we asked for a side of pita bread.   Sparkling rose was perfect for the summer!

VvnCau2LSFH-VKd5Vy4lFg.text: We went for my friends birthday the service was really slow glasses stayed empty for a long time. The bathroom are NASTY, I have never been in a restaurant that claims to be chic and charges these prices with a smelly dirty restroom. I had the wood fired grilled chicken and avocado sandwich $10.99 for fancy very spicy chicken salad and potato chips. I personally wouldn't go back.

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wood fired chicken and avocado sandwich

-FZ8WBlKpVbt_HA8mVXrIA.text: Kid Cashew never disappoints. My favorite is the salmon with Brussels spout side. Located in one of the best neighborhoods in Charlotte.

hYQLnQkQN1S_vRq5H8vGVA.text: On a particularly warm February, a friend and I decided to hit up Kid Cashew and enjoy lunch on the front patio. This was my first visit. The service was great and when I asked what I should order, drink wise, our server recommended the Goats Breastmilk I think it was called. It was an original combo of Ouzo and Amaretto and I think lemon and basil. It hit the spot. Looks like they have five dollar craft cocktails on Thursdays too along with other daily drink specials every other day of the week.  For food we started with the regular hummus. It comes with warm, fresh pita and you can add carrots and celery for two dollars. I got a Greek salad and didn't see the roasted red peppers on the menu when I ordered. I don't care for those and would prefer just regular, crisp red pepper but it was a generous size and had good flavor. I paired that with the beef skewers which were very flavorful and cooked just to my liking. Two skewers come in and order so it was a nice sized lunch.

crk1NqLBVJeiUjm1gbRzhg.text: The dreaded location at 1608 East Blvd.  Easily one of the best restaurant locations in Charlotte, and doomed for any brave entrepreneur attempting to tame the price of rent and make a splash, just ask the folks at Sole, that Pizza place, and wasn't there one other one that was there for like a month before JJ's went in too?  Nothing more can be said about a terrific spot on East Blvd. that affords you dozens of options to walk too once you've finished with a meal and mercilessly punishes any restaurant that doesn't consistently deliver the best experiences.  They've pretty much gutted the old pizza place (wasn't that what it was before this one most recently?) and made it look and feel a whole lot like "Good Food on Montford".  While the trendiness is certainly appreciated, it feels cramped inside and does not make me feel like it would be a decent place to bring a hot date due to the loud chatter, and close proximity of other patrons.  Outside, the patio area has also been revamped and opened up, which is nice, and actually a tolerable place to sit if it's not the middle of summer.  Our waiter was a nice young guy I think was named Joe or Chad or Beau who, while I'm pretty sure didn't make the football team in high school, sure did party with that crew.  He didn't quite know much about the beers other than the Bud Light, surprisingly, so when we ordered what we thought was one beer and wound up with it's seasonal variety instead, should have taken more initiative to take away the erroneous brew.  Sorry bro, but your bad if you say its Kronenbourg "kinda like a bud light, or Heineken, yea" and then Kronenbourg Blanc comes out which is definitely a fruity, cloudy, wheat beer, and not much at all like those other lagers.    My lamb burger was decent.  Burger was cooked properly, and the meat was seasoned well.  The bun was weak, and didn't hold up, so the burger wound up a mess in my hand.  They have the chef's version of "Mediterranean fries" is what Joe the waiter with the look like he just crushed the whippet hits from the whipped cream cans back in the walk-in freezer, informed us, which were basically super salty and super seasoned fingerlings that were roasted in an oven that wasn't hot enough to get that little crispy brownness you have to have to get those right.  My wife however ordered a barbeque panini or something like that.  Described basically as southern BBQ style pork on a panini.  So she was surprised when a club sandwhich on store-bought wheat bread came out with sliced (not pulled) pork shoulder.  Not a panini, not pulled pork BBQ.    It was a total miss for her and I felt bad my date night had so many blunders given the fact I was looking forward to trying the Mediterranean... wait it's a Mediterranean BBQ place called... hang on, what's it called?  I didn't see any nuts on the menu, meh whatever - it's a miss for us - Kid Cashew.

83Phd3hQ0RUw0VXjro3sfw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the Charlotte area. The food was excellent. Their mac and cheese is some of the best I've had. The burger was excellent. The place looked like a cross between hipster and up scale.

mmtH1MSJ9paRcX4aDRtxQw.text: I've been here 6x since it opened and I can state without a doubt that the quality of the food has been steadily declining over the past 6-8 months. It's sad that this place came out of the gate crushing it and now the food is either over seasoned or under. There is no longer any type of consistency in any dish. The Octopus is rubbery - the Brussels sprouts seasoning is so bitter they're inedible - the lamb is bland and overall the entire experience makes you wonder if the owner's supplier is getting all of their ingredients as it's about to expire at a massive discount. They've officially lost my business for good. Such a shame for a great space and concept.

h-sBrQfg3IwWOgXS_pVnSg.text: This place is awesome and I will definitely be coming back over and over again.  I was in the area for work and wanted something good, unique, and healthy.  I'm usually a Pio Pio guy but I had Peruvian days before so needed something different so took my chances here.    The smiling faces at the entrance helped the experience but the service topped it off.  I sat at the bar and was served by a bartender named Pickles.  He was definitely a talker, but he gave some great advise on making sure my lunch was divine.  I enjoyed an incredible salad with quinoa, chicken, and avocado.  But the menu looked so good, honestly I couldn't decide what to get.  I do want to come back for the lamb and the all natural chicken.    This place is definitely one of those places you want to bring over for a date, a professional luncheon, or even a group of friends to enjoy some drinks and good food.  I will come back again!

5kATVH9erBM6ix04FIgkLw.text: Great food. Had the chicken avocado sandwich and chicken gyro. Both were really good. We also ordered a side of mac and cheese and that too was really good. Great service as well. Only waited about 20 minutes on Saturday night at 7:00.

tc2J98LddTRDFSi5hUxO-w.text: A pleasant farm-to-table restaurant. Friendly service. Cozy atmosphere. Ordered the lamb and it was just okay. Really enjoyed the brussels sprouts though.

p2RWdhHmr1JnvaeJuv7VMA.text: NOTE: If you chose this restaurant for Charlotte Burger Week 2018, you are getting a junior size burger, not what's on the menu. I ordered both burgers and the Manager explained to me that in order to get a FULL SIZED burger I had to pay $5 more. I guess Kid Cashew thought it was a Slider contest. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant due to deceitful marketing.

eN8OpbVC0dCkmUquN50uRw.text: I absolutely love this place I could literally eat the whole menu. But can you please bring back the cauliflower mash. It's perfect ! It was disappointing my last visit that it was taken off the menu.

JAAhzA5el_3sNJBNQEF8gA.text: I visited Kid Cashew with my girlfriend yesterday evening and left very impressed. The service was great, and the food was excellent! I really like their concept of taking things straight from the garden/butcher to the kitchen. My girlfriend and I decided to enjoy our meal tapas style and share everything, although you can of course order entrees separate and not share. We tried the spicy feta dip, octopus, and lamb burger. The spicy feta dip was pretty good, especially with the toasted bread, and it was surprisingly spicy. The octopus was cooked perfectly, just charred on the outside but still very tender. The lamb burger was definitely the highlight of the meal! It came out medium and super juicy. The tzatziki sauce and onions added some great flavor, and it was simply superb overall. We left extremely satisfied with the taste of the food, the prices, and the service. We will be back!

9bdg0nYdeofR8FOPVwrvWg.text: The stuffed avocado was very good. I had the lamb burger it was really good. The lamb plate was very very good. They were very accommodating to diet modification. The service was also very good! Will definitely be coming back.

6FAdaNyavKQaBK36YjWvUA.text: Had brunch here yesterday, and overall it was great. They allow dogs on their outside patio, which was awesome for us since brought our pup with us. My wife had the stuffed French toast, it was good, but super filling super fast. I had the lamb burger, probably the best I have had in Charlotte, the lamb patties were juicy, flavorful, and the herbs in the patty added so much fresh flavor, it cut out that fatty feeling you get when you eat lamb! We also tried the side of beets, which I loved, and the Mac and cheese which was also really good. All in all, I'd definitely recommend this place, we for sure will come back to try for dinner or lunch again!

VJiFHfQXVUw-JZ8nPAPzqQ.text: First the good:  My salad with quinoa, pistachios and avocado was really good if not hard to eat.  The tall bowl was packed to the rim with gigantic lettuce leaves.  Luckily, I had a spare plate that I could use to chop it up.  I still ended up getting quite a bit sprinkled in my lap and on the floor.  As someone who doesn't eat meat or dairy, this was really the only meal option I had.  It was tasty but still salad.  The restaurant is fairly nice but relies on those features all new restaurants share: exposed wood beams, open floor plan and Edison lights.  This makes for one noisy restaurant once the place was full.  My dining partner and I had to yell at each other to have a conversation.  We would have sat outside but there was a singing guitarist out there.  Of course he had the speakers turned waaayyy up.  It's like the management decided that if it was quiet outside, people might realize how not-quiet it was inside.  Why not maybe the patio really, really loud too? On a Tuesday night?    I asked my friend if she would go back considering she had a lot more menu options than I did and her husband hadn't been there.  She had really enjoyed her dinner but given a night out, she would probably look for somewhere quieter.

LFys5JQnORM2rVikzeklcg.text: Kid Cashew is fantastic for a girls night out, apps and drinks or date night. I always order the trio of dips for a starter. That spicy feta is bangin'.  Service is always good. Seems a little fancier inside than out but nothing too dressy. It can be a little hot on the patio. At times so try to grab a shaded seat!

Dt9mpxxz8k-Bu6u5sPWc8A.text: Again, this time, a visit to the bar and a couple of small plates. Our bartender was charming - how nice to have eye contact and smiles in Charlotte.  My friend had a glass of Rose, nice. Dry as it should be, not the faux-Rose that's really white zinfandel in diguise. I had a Tito's and soda- can't go wrong with that.  We ordered the octopus. My first try was not an anomaly - again, it was flavorful and tender. So, so good. We also got the spinach and feta dip. Sometimes such concoctions lose the flavor definitions and turn into junk food- this was quite good. Spinach tasted like spinach. Perhaps a crispy pita vs the soft would add some texture variance, but I'm just being provocative- we enjoyed as it was served.  I happen to like KC. Look forward to many more visits and experimenting with the menu.

PYVvgmkLE1o6L1Y075z5vA.text: Incredible food here. Pick a main course meat from the "butcher" section and pair it with a couple sharing sides. Or, pick a sandwich. I had the leg of lamb - plenty for two people. Fiance had the chicken avocado sandwich. Both had amazing flavor. The food is definitely worth this price you pay and the portions aren't skimpy. A lot of places that fall just above casual dining but are not quite "fine dining" charge prices for food that just don't feel justified. This is not that kind of place. The atmosphere makes for a great date night and the cocktails/drinks are fantastic. Food quality and service are wonderful. We will be back!

ho-3ZgnjhYX3s2bjM83Nsw.text: Updated Review: After my first experience here, the manager contacted me promptly and offered his apologies and let me know that our server had been let go. He invited my friend and I to come back and try Kid Cashew again. I am so glad we did! The food and service were great. The manager and waiter continued to check on us and couldn't have been nicer.  I recommend trying the spinach and cheese dip, the chicken, the potatoes au gratin and the beet salad. We finished the meal with Baklava-yum!!  I will definitely be going back. The outdoor seating was lovely.

7ysucCB221w8ZqE6eCyP1Q.text: Love, love, love.  I had never heard of this place before when a friend suggested we go for lunch.  We were celebrating Mother's Day, my mom's birthday, and my sister saying "yes" to the dress.  Our waiter was so wonderful, kept our bubbly flowing, and made great recommendations.  The feta dip was delightful, salads were the perfect size, and I encountered the first quiche I've ever enjoyed!  Can't wait to go back!

sBte6wobUqIbwKb0k8Bcww.text: I had a nice experience here.  With some attention to detail, this would be a five star review.    The pricing was reasonable and fair.  Brussel Sprouts were good if not a bit plain.  The slow cooked pork panini was fantastic.  The spicy mustard on the multigrain bread was a great texture and flavor combo.  The portion of the sandwich was perfect.  The trout was also good and a nice portion.  The drinks were creative and destination worthy.  The vanilla gelato was not worth ordering.  The gelato portion was huge, it just wasn't very good (tasted and felt like average vanilla ice cream)      We didn't have any issues with the food coming out at different times, but I can understand how this would aggravate certain diners.  Be prepared to have the food come to your table in random intervals.  They don't use heat lamps or microwaves, so if something is ready before another part of the meal, it's showing up before the rest.  Kid cashew may lean a little too heavily on this and should probably strive to execute better timing.   Decor and Ambiance are five star.  I dined on the sizeable patio next to some angry ants that thought our table was really theirs.  They understood better after I squashed some of their relatives.  The inside looks really nice.    They have a very upscale casual vibe going, but you get the sense that there's a disconnect between the quality of the service and what customers expect the service to be.  Based on the formal server attire, I expected a more attentive experience even though the menu pricing didn't signify fine dining.  Just some details.

s_5mYp-VADPLISPBvSLssQ.text: Below was my first experience at this restaurant I went back to give it a second try and it was much better. We again had the shrimp appetizer because it was so good the first time. We went with another couple this time and had the octopus which was very very tasty the hummus Trio which was very good as well and then the black rice dish I can't remember the name of it it was Bland it was just ok. The service was good the drink pours were great and the atmosphere was Lively.   Im torn here on this place. I'll start from the beginning. I was sitting at the bar waiting on my wife for dinner, as we always sit at the bar to eat. Its usually great people watching and better service. I started off with a guy bartender very friendly then he left his shift at 5 p.m. and then a black woman bartender took over. She was ok, not overly friendly but did a good job orher than not clearing our app plates till then end of dinner.  So I start exploring the menu before my wife arrives and I see an entree North Carolina mountain trout. Now I am a trout fisherman for 10 years and there is no such species as a North Carolina mountain trout. So I asked the bartender which the bar and Kitchen almost share the same space he turns around and asks the executive chef, what is a nc mountain trout. In the executive chef very arrogantly tells him it's North Carolina mountain trout. Again that is not a species I asked if it was a rainbow or brown trout and he said it's a North Carolina mountain trout. That tells me he does not know what kind of fish he is  buying. The appetizer of shrimp with the sauce was incredible my wife's beet salad with salmon was really good the eggplant side dish was Bland and just ok. I used the sauce from our appetizer was the plate was still there to pull over my trout the trout was perfectly cooked and very tasty. I don't know if I'll be back or not with so many other options in Charlotte we have to be wowed right out of the gate and we just weren't.

1yAMFW1RlnM-I2uuEcDlUQ.text: Amazing flavor! Love their revolving menu, gives us to try new foods!! Our favorite is the grilled octopus.

lT-2dJXARKRP3CV4LBCs6w.text: Super cute location and food to match! Tried the salmon entree, squash and grain salad on the side. The squash salad was very unique and great presentation. Grain salad was delicious and healthy and the salmon hit the right notes too. The hubs tried the jalapeno cocktail which was okay - he complained of not tasting the rye whiskey, so we got him a shot on the side. Minor disappointments - service was kinda off but not too bad and they didn't have baba ghanoush!

F-Ey13NfaIYYdlnoAE6SDw.text: What a cute spot this is! We ended up here after trying to find a patio to dine at for girls night on a Wednesday night. This was our third attempt and we were seated right away. This patio is amazing and the vibes and atmosphere are adorable. We all ordered different Moscow mules. I had the fig mule and it was very sweet. My friend ordered the cucumber mule and it was exceptional. All of their cocktails look awesome and I definitely want to come back to try more. Service was so so. Our waitress did what was needed to be done but was not over the top efficient, friendly, or knowledgeable. Most of us ordered salmon and we got a cheese dip for the table and mac n cheese and brussel sprouts. The dip was exceptional and their salmon is spot on. Everyone loved their food and we very much enjoyed the evening. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu, great concept and wonderful decorations!
