l7QjNDVPYFCu1zZY1HrHlw.text: I LOVE Kid Cashew, and I am sure the staff knows it. There chicken avocado sandwich is AMAZING. It is my go-to dish, and I go there far too often. The staff is extremely friendly, and the food is delicious. I highly recommend trying it out. You cannot go wrong with this place.

KZS1WJH6sJO7YHDLsEHxsw.text: No need for a long post.  Lamb burger, and for dessert the Pistachio sundae!  To die for!!!

N3fkzsHa47en580S1ZXZmg.text: I've never had a bad meal here. Their Mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts are amazing.

nEhbLIB8z6umfKVMTA0nbg.text: Horrible! Our server actually wiped his nose with his finger as he carried our drinks to the table. When we mentioned it, he snickered and said he didn't think so. Then, if that wasn't gross enough, someone from kitchen went to men's room and (you know what is coming ...) and he didn't wash his hands. I'm in the restaurant business and this place is run by novices. Don't waste your time or money here.

cfxzQ92hV8KueVU0_DcbWA.text: Perfect Valentines Date! Amazing menu and excellent service. Hidden gem of Southend. We were a walk in at 7:15pm on Valentine's Day and were seated within minutes. Our waitress (Anonya? I am probably spelling it wrong) greeted us promptly. Immediately we noticed how loud the table was next to us and we asked to move. Even though the restaurant was busy, they kindly moved us to a much quieter table! We enjoyed the trout and Big Mac daddy burger, butternut hummus and Mac and cheese. Everything was delicious and unique! 5 stars for food and service. Definitely recommend Kid Cashew.

ri_D7Q2xZwRt0XUuk-Am_A.text: We had a great meal here. It's a really fun place to have lunch or dinner. Great outdoor space during warmer days, but plenty of indoor seating. They have an open kitchen too, which is always a sign that you're going to have fresh and clean food!

Ui9xn1s2ceOde09-fmvbZA.text: I love tapa type restaurants because you get to try a little of everything. My party literally tried everything on the menu. I can't speak for my friends, but this is what I tried and recommend (btw I'm a pescetarian so I apologize to all you carnivores):   -Beet salad- Amazing -Grain salad- LOVED the dressing, very filling -Black rice- very filling, so don't eat too much of it.  -Brussel sprouts- if you love brussel sprouts, MUST ORDER!  -Mac and Cheese- Heaven, can't go wrong there.  -Octopus- Melts in your mouth. It's that good. -Gelato: It's legit. But not out of the ordinary.   Until next time, Charlotte!

-h3HiGIQRLNOGvSkUUnt5w.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! Perfect patio for warmer days, and the food is amazing. I recommend the dip trio (they are all too good to pass up so why not try a little of each?!), and the quinoa stuffed avocado. I also recommend sharing dishes, tapas style, with your group so that you can try more dishes.  Their moscow mules are tasty as well! Will definitely be back.

-o9AQA8PAeGLzimMtRJYrw.text: Adam took very good care of us!! We had the meat balls, steak, Mac and cheese and burger. All items were AMAZING!!! Drinks were great, atmosphere is great, definitely will be back (:

KSfp0T--kSoGtWAqYc8Mcg.text: A good friend from the area took me here--we feasted on the beef mac' n cheese, grilled octopus, mushrooms with wild rice and chicken. Every dish was amazing. Kid Cashew is a Charlotte favorite of mine.

U3i_81i-fyf6BwcOe62QeA.text: Banging around downtown Charlotte on a Saturday when the wife and I stumbled upon this gem!  Place was packed inside and outdoors as it was a sunny day so we found a spot at the bar.  Bartender Jaime took excellent care of us with delicious $5 Bloody Marys to start. Wife had a beet & arugula salad, portobello sandwich and I had a pulled chicken with avocado sandwich.  Food was outstanding-great flavors and nice size portions.  From our barstools we had a great view of the food coming up for service.  Watching the kitchen crew finalize plates was like watching a choreographed show.  No fryers or freezer in this restaurant and you could taste it in the freshness of the food.  The GM chatted us up as he was going about his duties.  You could tell by the attitudes of everyone working here that they live what they do and it shows .  Highly recommend this place for great food and service!  And a show!

90e71fXRL5m-K12gFkCIsA.text: Lamb burger was phenomenal but my boyfriend didn't like the lamb gyro so much and wished he had gotten the burger also. Environment is super chic meets causal for the perfect modern taste and the staff was exceptionally pleasant. Recommend to friends

cTs9ES3w_ge4naEBDshlHA.text: Ate lunch there today - decor was fine.  Nice patio outside.  I had the chicken and avocado sandwich which was quite good, but I didn't care for the fingerling potatoes.

6vUflWMxu2N1aCc5_bAdSQ.text: Vacationing in Charlotte for the first time and was recommended Kid Cashew by a friend.  The service was excellent. Nate our server was prompt and attentive.  He stopped by and checked on us several times. The food was 10/10 very fresh and came out quickly. Definitely will be back in the future.

9AmILQ27ZYF1B86ixcobLw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Had a great meal the other night. I ordered the portobello mushroom which was divine. When eating out, I usually try to order something that I would never cook at home and Portobello is definitely something I would not prepare at home,only because I don't grill much. My friend ordered the lamb burger and he definitely enjoyed it,  although he did say he's had better. I'm not much of a drinker,  but they had some dark aged rum that I couldn't resist and the drink was great. My friends beer was a tad bit warm, the waiter apologized and the hostess/manager came over with a complementary hummus dip. Pleasantly surprised!  Nice atmosphere, good food and great service.

cnv_sopu0eDGLrZZcwE-RA.text: We have been here 4 times now and the food quality has been different every time  They have changed the menu every time we have been there  The location and atmosphere is awesome but the food is so inconsistent that we have trouble choosing this place to dine. What's going on with your menu?

bCobYxYsiwwmRL2Sxj8MLA.text: This little gem way surprise me everytime, with they amazing food and excellent customer service! Went there for my anniversary,  bubby ,I  and brother in law, we had the lamb burger  and hubby had the big daddy mac and meat ball . It was so good.  Hightly recommend  and alsi its a kid friendly  atmosphere.  The staff are ver nice the manager came over to our table to ask if everything was ok. Prise is alao reasonable. Seating both indoors and outdoors.

xp2MoQMwh1DTEw8d-mVu5g.text: This place is great! The food was immensely satisfying and prepared well. I regret not getting our waiter's name because he gave us excellent service- super nice and had drink refills on deck before it had even occurred to me to ask for one. I loved the cold brew coffee this place served. As a heavy coffee drinker, I am often disappointed when breakfast places do not have a cold brew coffee or even just normally brewed coffee that is already cold on standby. At Kid Cashew however, our server offered up a delicious cold brew in the afternoon that I very much enjoyed. On top of the great service and food is a warm atmosphere and entertaining decor. Definitely will be going back to this place!

ibcw7nPmGeFor8k1vkoSNw.text: Finally made it here! And boy, like many have mentioned, their  grilled octopus on a quinoa-kale-cilantro salad is super yummy! Unlike most places that filet the fish, they cut it into bite-size pieces that reminded me of sausage. Just solid meat. Also had lamb shank, which was very tasty but could have been more tender. Freshly made, spicy chips are a must! Overall, delicious flavors!

1gd4ggBk5uv7W7F12jhnxg.text: Sorry for the delay in the review I just have to give this restaurant 100 stars We had an engagement party for our son a couple weekends ago it was Saturday night there is 23 of us and the service was amazing the food was amazing and everything was perfect. Our server was Jesse and she was incredible  Thank you to everyone at kid cashew for making this a great night everyone was happy happy happy

NDBRsJZIqJz_R-WyWKZI9w.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. If I ever have visitors in town, I always bring them here. There's a lot of seating inside, including bar seating as well as plenty of outdoor seating. They have some great Mediterranean dishes--some of my favorites are the grilled octopus, lamb, and chicken avocado sandwich. They do take out as well!

fbInLSU1Uld3Qfxs1Ym_9Q.text: Took a party of five he and it was delicious , the grill ed octopus is fantastic I ordered it twice, lamb burger, Portabella mushroom burger, avocado toast with poached egg,all excellentThe drinks looks really good as well, perhaps next time will come in the evening and try them. we will be back.

ySpsenlqiC5m4MYAqP0dLg.text: I fluctuate between vegetarian and carnivore through out the year and Kid Cashew covers them both. The vegan portobello gyro is amazing. Also the house made hummus with pita points are really good. This is a great brunch option on a nice day the patio is a great place to hang out and drink mimosas

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Portobello gyro and quinoa kale salad

LmuqVNRKqnpJY1e6m7svZA.text: Wow! Wish I would've taken a photo but I demolished the food to quickly. Ordered the portabella gyro off the vegan menu! Had chips and a half sized quinoa stuffed avo on the side!

mkBAcNPIXxZnXATnMRgI0g.text: Have been here multiple times and every time is a like a new wonderful experience. The menu is constantly changing, the flavors are always delicious, the atmosphere warm and welcoming, and the service friendly and attentive. They do not have a freezer, so everything is fresh (sorry no ice cream desserts). Their cocktail menu and beer selection are both strong. Summer time, they have an excellent patio.   This space has been cursed by so many restaurants failing, but this one has done well and I can only assume that as long as it stays managed well, it will  be here for a long time because they always have a great crowd wa successful concept.   Update: We came back recently with a group of 5 adult men and were placed at a small table surrounded by 2 tables filled with a 1:1 ratio of fathers to daughters (presumably a Daddy/daughter dance), 3 tables from the door after specifically asking to be placed away from the door. There was a 6 top table available away from the children and the door, but the hostess (dressed in yoga pants and a sweatshirt) would not move us because of reservations. We took advantage of the tasting that they offered that evening, which meant LOTS of plates, and given the small table and adult men, there was just not enough room. By the time we finished our meal and were paying out checks, the 6 top was still empty. I pulled the manager aside and explained that 1. Our food was absolutely delicious and that part never disappoints. 2. The server did an excellent job and very happy with him. 3. Due to the table placement and the hostess response, it was a huge detraction. He listened, agreed, apologized and even helped out with the bill a bit. I didn't say anything to get a discount, but rather offer feedback, but it was a greatly appreciated gesture. Plus, I had the feeling he really listened to the feedback and was not just appeasing me. For this and everything else I love about this place, we'll continue to go back.

TyW3_3vmaVStlGdYUm_8hw.text: The looks of the dish (shrimp and grits) was amazing (sorry i forgot a picture!), however, the dish was barely lukewarm.  I liked the fact that it had andouille sausage.  The bloody mary was good until the ice melted.  It had way too much ice.  The waiter was really nice though.  I'm not sure why my food was cold since it came out pretty quickly after I ordered it AND my friend and I were one of the first ones there for brunch.

4vWnrwvHRCmkk_kDR-sCNg.text: First time here at Kid Cashew. For lunch, we were seated quickly and service was speedy. We started with the spinach cheese dip served with pita bread. This was really good and made fresh. I ordered the chicken avocado sandwich and the 5-cheese mac. This was on a "pick two" lunch menu. The portions are perfect for lunch. My Mac n cheese was almost too hot. It was sizzling and bubbling so I had to wait until I finished my sandwich to eat any. There was onions in the Mac, which took me by a surprise. Thankfully I like onions so it was a pleasant taste!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

epkToSn0NZWtAaLi6keskg.text: I'm really glad that we tried this place!  The Food was absolutely amazing!  We shared 4 small plates (Brussels Spouts, Shrimp and Polenta, Chicken Skewers, and the grilled Octopus)!  I got the Vegan Avocado and Quinoa dish, it was delicious!  I will definitely go back and bring Friends!

Ni8IVoxyuuVAWHQEdrNmRw.text: Today I got to check off this restaurant off my restaurant bucket list with some great friends ! As soon as we got there we were immediately seated , the waiters and waitress were attentive and let us know that even though brunch would be over in 8 mins that they would still see to it that if we want brunch still they will fix brunch for us . The French toast was cook to perfection , not to much but not to little . The Mac & Cheese was not "dusty" but cheesy and definitely homemade . The rotisserie chicken was perfectly seasoned , juicy and very filling . The steak and eggs was yummy , the steak was medium well and cooked just the way I want it and asked. The eggs was great as well. I would definitely go back to try the rest of the menu out and this restaurant gets 5 stars from me. The ambience and outside seating of this place is fabulous.

ACtCIwjD4hWh7L0n_BSL5g.text: I've been to Kid Cashew for dinner and for brunch. On the brunch menu, I ordered the avocado toast. The portion was decent, and the bread was hearty and sturdy enough to hold the thick layer of avocado and chopped veggies layered on top. The flavors were fresh and vibrant, with the tomato/onion mix providing a nice acidic touch to the creamy avocado.   For dinner, I began with the tzatziki and pita, which was very good. The pita was soft and warm, while the tzatziki sauce was refreshingly crisp. I then ordered the salmon and the vegan brussels sprouts, both of which were excellent. The meal ended up being more expensive than I would have expected, but the flavors were solid and the service was fantastic both times.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Avocado toast and brussels sprouts

uRCK7FI1YbFtBwB4Cbkcjg.text: 2 words..... GO NOW!!  We found KC last night and after a delectable meal of stuffed avocado (oh my!!), Greek Salad and Salmon I have had the meal on my mind all day today.  Creamiest avocado ever!! Salmon and salad were spot-on and the service top shelf.  GO!! FULL STOP.  Just go (and bring me leftovers)

9Jtet_pyKIGTR6uS_i-fdQ.text: We called on Sunday to double check if we needed reservation for a party of two and it was 4 PM and staff said no RSVP come now for it will get busy later on. We got there. Most of the people were sitting out in the patio and it was just too hot and we decided to stay inside.   The lamb burger is very good. Moist and chewy and they stacked two lamb burger pieces which was really nice. Did not care for the chips. My friend ordered the same item and replaced it with a salad for a separate charge. He really enjoyed the salad. Will try that the next time that I am in the neighborhood.

sn76sfIJYWeMkBIVrjrFXw.text: CILANTRO. YOGURT. SAUCE. Regardless of what you order, you could probably drizzle this on top of your food and it would take it up a notch. Kid Cashew has become a regular spot for me, and I have yet to try something I really didn't like. The chicken avocado sandwich and power grain salad really hit the spot when you're looking for a nice lunch (again, extra green sauce on the side!). But if you're seeking some delicious small plates for dinner, I recommend the quinoa stuffed avocado, Spanish octopus, and the mushroom risotto.  Plus, great drink deals! My coworkers and I are a big fan of the 1/2 wine bottle night, but there's something pretty much every night of the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spanish Octopus
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio: Hummus, Tzatziki, &amp; Spicy Feta

ijouutQjR_pHuNBKgxejrA.text: Weekend lunch hour at Kid Cashew! One of many restaurants I've bookmarked on my Yelp list. Rumor has it, Kid Cashew offers great happy hour specials.   Sunday afternoon, I came here with a friend. We choose to sit on the patio since the weather was nice. Our waitress wasn't the most informative when we asked questions about the menu. However, we still enjoyed our visit.   I purchased three small plate items:  The Spicy Feta was my favorite! I love anything with jalapeno! This dish comes with a side of pita bread to dip. I was excited to try the Mac & 5-Cheese, this dish arrived piping hot.  I liked this Mac & Cheese because the ingredients included leeks and shallots, so DELISH!!! My final order was the Avacado Halve with Quinoa, which speaks for itself! This came on a bed of lettuce with chipotle sauce. I should've asked for more sauce! The items I selected were a great portion size, I left full and happy!   I look forward to coming back for happy hour! This review will be updated soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Feta, Mac &amp; 5-Cheese, Avocado Halve with Quinoa

J6VdZU1ToDIH_1mSux1w4A.text: I  come here at least twice a week. They have no freezers!!! That should make everyone want to drop what they're doing and come eat this fresh food! They always have a drink special, the half price small plates and the 2 for $9.95 at lunch are what keeps me coming back. Marie at the bar always greets me with a smile and handles the bar like no one i have ever seen. They also welcome and love my dog when he comes to the patio. I can't say enough great things about Kid Cashew.

RobxPNoHpSgAKSr4MzXcVA.text: I have never been disappointed at Kid Cashew! Never! This visit was during Charlotte Burger Week, it was a busy Thursday night but there was great service and now wait. The service was great, y'all...the lamb burger is AMAZING and the macaroni and cheese was DELICIOUS! Get it. Seriously.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

LjdQ5tD-DLE5ZitchfuccA.text: Came during Clt Burger week. The lamb burger consisted of two perfectly medium cooked patties. The seasoned kettle chips were a great complimentary sides. Also ordered the mac-5cheese. It came out pipping hot and bubbling, AWESOME!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whiskey&#39;n Honey

UFCD_ol_axa4qYoSprFnlQ.text: Another long-time player in Dilworth that might leave you scratching your head.  Somewhere between Mediterranean and American fare, lies Kid Cashew. The atmosphere is pretty cool. It's got a rustic-industrious vibe with great outdoor seating. There's plenty of space for larger parties and sitting at the bar is a great experience.   The service is pretty average, but the staff is very friendly and accommodating. Where Kid Cashew falls short is the food. The menu is simplistic, which is a great thing, but that doesn't mean the flavors should be too. I've yet to be really wowed by anything on the menu. It's cooked well, but it's not REALLY tasty food.   The signature cocktails are a bit of a rip off. If you're a fan of lots of simple syrup and mint, you'll probably enjoy them, but at $10-12 per drink, it'll make you have buyer's remorse. Stick with beer, wine, and vodka-soda.   I like this place and you will too, but curb your expectations when it comes to the food and flavors. A firm 3/5.

4OV9K1PNOyWZLuOzqGDqKA.text: Kid Cashew has been my favorite restaurant since they opened; however, I have had some bad experiences recently and will not be returning until things change.  The menu has been really inconsistent. I'm all for seasonal changes, but the price increased for one item even though the dish was the exact same. For another item, the portion was smaller than usual. When I asked for extra, I was charged for extra. Some of my favorite items were taken off the menu. My appetizer and entre were served almost at the same time. I understand things are sent out as soon as they are ready, but I told the server I wanted the appetizer first. One server (who wasn't even my server) was extremely rude to me.  It's also frustrating you can't even see the current menu. Even if the menu is changing and not finalized, it really wouldn't be that hard to post the current menu on facebook. Bring back the black rice!

A9qxfbvoSYXDDr8yFPXo1Q.text: This place came highly recommended for their basil tequila drink.  I tried this drink and my hubby tried one of their tequila & jalapeno drinks they just put on the drink menu yesterday.  The bartender did a phenomenal job!   He is a True mixologist.  We shared a few of the 'small plates': the octopus was great, the shrimp was too, and the spinach, fennel, feta dip with pita bread was delightful.  We enjoyed every delicious morsel!!  Today was our first visit to Kid Cashew.   Everything was above expectations and we will be back soon.

K67UZYfkNfIxU1Rpf_PPGg.text: Been following this place on instagram for months, salivating and anticipating coming here. Finally made it. I sooooooooooooooooo wanted to love it and crown it one of my new go-to spots here in Charlotte.  I came here for brunch on Sunday after church. I ordered shrimp and grits and a salad. Others in my party had the big Mac style burger, a regular burger, and shrimp and grits.  Pros-kids eat free at brunch, my coconut libation, husbands Manhattan, presentation of the dishes, decor  Cons- the shrimp and grits had no depth. It lacked richness and seemingly seasoning that even the most basic foodies or cooks would expect from this classic dish. It was presented beautifully with large shrimp, but it was disappointing everywhere else. Mine was one of 3 orders at my table, and no one was pleased with the dish. The burgers seemed to go over better with the others at the table.  I will maybe give it another try during happy hour and try some other offerings.

5KFXWXUtn_kl3pcJUmG31Q.text: We went on a Sunday during lunch and it was the perfect atmosphere! I got the lamb burger which was cooked to perfection. We also ordered hummus which was different than what I'm used.   I'm definitely coming here again. Btw- the Goat's Breastmilk is worth a try :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Leg of lamb. Cilantro sauce was perfect with it.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. The lamb burger! Really good!

jK0wBZF0Yn1Eutj16abb0g.text: This is a place Dilworth has been waiting for.   Great food, atmosphere, and service. This is not another TGIChilis--the menu is both adventurous and accessible, with something for anyone without reducing to the lowest common denominator.   It is a significant sign that a restaurant just a week into its life operates like one which has been in business for years--great tribute to both management and staff.   Can't wait until the weather gets warmer, when it will be possible to sit on the terrace in front--there are heaters on the terrace but I wanted the greater comfort of being inside.   There is always a time and place for Showmar's, Moe's, etc. But it is important to support restaurants like this. They have earned mine.

-8w7r32gpIYGQLC9b_PHZw.text: We found this place while driving around the new neighborhood one day and the description "Mediterranean, Barbeque" was very intriguing.  We showed up, around 5:30, and entered a very fun looking place; seriously, you need to see this one!  At 5:30 on a Friday, it was hopping, but not too full.  (By the time we finished our meal, there were people waiting for a table).   The food options are broken down into Small Plates, Sandwiches, Salads, Plates, and Sides.  Everything is served a la carte, so if you get a sandwich or plate, you should consider getting a side or two for the table (they're basically two-person servings).    I had the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich and my companion had the lamb burger.  Both of these were great!  The sandwiches were both on the messy side, so be prepared for that, but I tend to find a direct correlation between messiness and great taste.   For sides, we opted for the beets and the forbidden rice & wild mushroom paella.  The beets were fantastic--seriously, we fought over them! Of note, the beets are served room temperature, which was strange at first, but works well for the dish.  We picked the rice because it has gotten very high reviews, but it honestly did not totally blow us away. It was good, and tasted exactly like what you would expect black rice and mushrooms to taste like, but just didn't blow us out of the water (to be fair, we're pretty judgemental about rice in my family).  Next time we visit, we'll get two orders of beets, skip the rice, and try a different side.  Probably our favorite thing was the tzatziki sauce, which comes on some of the sandwiches and you can get an extra side of (which you totally should) or get as an appetizer with pita bread (comes by itself or on a plate with hummus and eggplant spread).  The lamb burger comes with the tzatziki on it and, being sauce people, we ordered an extra. We ended up putting it on everything! It's super creamy (one of the thickest yogurt based sauce I've seen in the States) and heavy on the garlic in a great way!    One thing of note is that they do not have a heat lamp, so items come to the table as they are prepared, rather than waiting for everything to be ready and getting it all at once.  We ended up getting our beets first (the point at which we realized we should have gotten two orders), then our sandwiches, then the forbidden rice.  This can be kind of strange at first but our waitress explained it to us when we ordered, so it wasn't a concern.  The only real reason that this got 4 stars, instead of 5, was the price.  For two sandwiches, two sides, and no extra drinks, we paid almost $40 before tip--not totally unreasonable, but more than we prefer to spend. That being said, it was a great meal, and we'll definitely go there again!

xyBCyoGd-ND1x42OuAbK3Q.text: Sat there for 23 mins and our order hadn't been taken nor the side of lemons bought out that we had requested when we first sat down did notice employees sitting along side of the bar eating everyone was still smiling tho definitely will not return

wbE9YqpiaDH5qzg0EMAdcQ.text: I had hoped I would have enjoyed the food more!  I tasted the great grains salad with the salmon. It was okay but nothing that wowed me. My dinner partner had the mushroom sandwich and he enjoyed it. It came with small new potatoes that were yummy. It is very noisy on the patio. I really like the concept of this restaurant but I just had hoped for more taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Located in the heart of East Blvd

4yHPifcB5fL_xYXaPDNlWA.text: Its a feeling of country mediterranean with the vintage floorboards straight from the 80s. The open kitchen and a variety of vintage items hanging from the walls give it a diner feel. Yet sophisticated with chandaliers and plate settings. It was great! They really suggested sharing plates, almost like a family feel to it. I didnt know what to expect. We came on around 330 so in between lunch and dinner  The food! So we ordered the Super Grains salad which was THE BOMB DOT COM! It was romaine lettuce topped with a nice ripe avacado. It was bedazzled with quinoa raisins and a citrus with just the right amount of a lemon vineagarette type dressing. It had a sweet yet nutty taste with the quinoa. It was gone in about 5 minutes. Smh  We also ordered the lemon oregano chicken sandwhich. A complete misnomer because it was like an open salad over a miltigrain toast with a basil pesto mayo and mint leaves.  The chicken was roasted well and pulled perfectly. It was very succulent and juicy. It also blended well with the salad as the leaves werent too cold or crunchy. The tomatoes cucumbers and onions gave it a fresh taste. It was hard to tell the dressing but it was great.   Overall it was awesome! Highly recommend the above items mentioned. You wont be disappointed. The other foods on the menu also look great, will def be back. They also have a variety of wine and beers available.

o_pU4EKaz2twyhPy7GU8CQ.text: Excellent service, very good food! The trout was very good along with the Mac and cheese, the beets and the lamb burger! Well worth the money, this is the second time we've been there and I would return again! Try it! A very interesting menu!

JRcqWPzA0LxzZEv47CO0Xw.text: Great place and the service was excellent. I got the pork panini and the meat was very well cooked and the spicy mustard made the sandwich. The mac and cheese was great, but it lacked serious flavor but the presentation was awesome. The restaurant is very well decorated and you really get the vibe that they have a passion for food. Check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork panini
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac-n-cheese

K2Jpzco6KdrznseuCFYXZw.text: I went here with my mom for a late lunch and sat on the patio. We ordered the lamb, Brussels sprouts, Mac and cheese, And mountain trout. I liked everything besides the trout, I think it was just a personal preference though. it is more like a chicken salad. I really enjoyed the Brussel sprouts and i don't like them normally. Also got the goats milk and the ouzo took me back to Greece.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. We already started eating

GHi42YNJjjZW_3CZC43LOw.text: I'm impressed. Everything my friends and I ordered was fresh and tasty. Salmon was so so good. If it's your first time, you gotta try the forbidden rice.  Also, the Goat's Breast Milk might be the best mixed drink I've ever had -- their outdoor area on a warm day + cold Goat's Beast Milk = perfection.

KvHUSTQmZz4vQyjLlmfeVw.text: I've been there twice now and both times have been very good.  It's not crazy expensive or fancy.  It's the perfect middle of the road with great food!

rB5vtf7WGzuWYIdE_AMv7g.text: A disappointing experience based on the reviews. Most of the cocktails were very good, however, I did have a bad experience with the old fashioned. The food was served quickly, but the lamb came out dry and flavorless, the brussel sprouts came out burnt, and the avocado was plain. I took my girlfriend for her birthday, and it was a very subpar meal. Definitely not going back and would not recommend it.

_wy7TO4UE_p_XQ0kzzk3OA.text: We ate here on the company dime, and we loved it but I'd have a hard time justifying it if I was picking up the check. It's not crazy expensive or anything, it's just a little more than it's worth. Long way of saying there is just better places in town for the price point. That being said, if you try it out, we loved the Brussels, the white beans, and the lamb burger. I've had friends say the quality of the drinks has dropped off since it opened. Two biggest downsides, our server was super unkind. I'd call it frigid. Also, the gelato is NOT gelato. If I was 6 I would be obsessed with their version. But it is sickly sweet, gargantuan, and tastes like marshmallow fluff. Gelato is supposed to be a small quantity because it has a higher milk fat content than ice cream. This was milkshake sized. Anywho. We liked the meal overall.

LYaVFc0p7ms_XepJdANEmw.text: I was in Charlotte for a friend's bday and we came here for a casual bite to eat. I was with a group of 4 people and we literally ordered every one of the small plates and a couple of bottles of wine. EVERYTHING was delicious. The highlights were the Mac-and-cheese, Brussels sprouts, beet salad, and the wild shrimp were Aaaamazing! We actually almost ordered a second order but were too full. The weather was chilly but warm enough to sit outside and they have an awesome patio with great atmosphere. Casual and the lighting was really nice. Best of all, when the check came we all split it equally and it was less than $25 per person. I'd definitely recommend for a group dinner on the patio! Share everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

8Tkak-2GWaEZ5l7OH-ACdA.text: This place has a nice casual vibe.  The restaurant is located in the Dilworth section of Charlotte.  The menu does not have large selection but, the food was savory and good.  I would recommend and I would come again.

anWltk0eRimgrZoIhpf-mQ.text: Great vegetarian option. Decent beer list. Sat outside with our pup and enjoyed the great atmosphere. Wait staff super friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beau had chicken sandwich of which is sang its praises
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grain salad was tasty

wE89h1-HiW0h9EcDXOkkYQ.text: First I want to say that our server was super friendly, attentive without being obtrusive and knowledgeable about the menu. The atmosphere was not as good as it could have been.    Maybe some music and some fans on the patio would have been nice.

qD9LywpFlJ__eaUiTRqOhg.text: My friends and I popped into Kid Cashew for a quick lunch today (the day after Thanksgiving) and I couldn't have been more pleased. We were immediately greeted with a smiling face and a table for 3 during lunch rush which was a nice surprise. We sat and within minutes, our server (Summer) brought over cold waters and was ready to take our drink order. We ordered a bottle of wine and 3 apps.   The chicken wings, spinach and feta dip and Brussell sprouts were all amazing. Hot, full of flavor and the perfect start to our meal. We then each order from the pick 2 lunch option (great deal!). They both had the burger with Mac and cheese and I had the rotisserie chicken with grilled asparagus. I can't say enough about how flavorful and well presented the food is! Every bite was like my first! The burgers were tender and packed with unique flavor. There are no words for how delicious the Mac and cheese was!   All in all, I would recommend this to any and everyone! The restaurant aesthetic, the tasty food and the wonderful service are all reasons to eat here! Can't wait to come back for dinner!

WrQmAwu7wWDtcMbFXBCTvA.text: I have been to kid cashew twice and each time I left very happy. The first time I went for dinner and got a dish with fish .... I forgot the name, but it was delicious. The only issue I had was that it did not have enough food to leave me full at the end and I needed a snack soon after. My second time was my favorite...I went for lunch and did the pick 2 deal. I am gluten free dairy free so I got the chicken sandwich on a gluten-free bun with a side of stuffed avocado ....it was absolutely delicious. my waiter hooked me up, he was awesome. I had more than enough food and the price was absolutely amazing and well worth it. It is so difficult to find food to eat out that is gluten-free and dairy-free... so thank you so much for opening this spot!!!!! This place will definitely become one of the top spots in the area no doubt about it.

mhjKVv7qsXjl1HXDAbKn7g.text: We sat out on the patio and ordered the octopus tapas and a couple chardonnays to kick off a lazy lunch together.   Perfect start.  Lori ordered the Greek salad sans lettuce for her entree.  I went for the protein ordering the lamb burger and up-charged the side from fingerling potatoes to brussel sprouts.  All excellent.  Thanks Nate and Ashley for rounding out our visit to Kid Cashew.  Wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 oz of grilled heaven on a plate.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily special.  I think it&#39;s called Spata.  Think of a decadent, creamy frittata.  Very rich.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb burger.  Excellent.

TPullVyPf7ZzrpfEh-TtMQ.text: What can I say about this place!!?Loved everything about it,from the decor,ambiance..New to the city, from Boston (so we are foodies ),hubby and I decided to check this place out,but this place was so good!!!food was yummy!!!ordered off the small plates which arrived so quickly. Brussel Sprouts,Mac n Cheese, Grilled Octopus, Shrimp and Polenta...Yum!!!Will be back!'

1sJufw8dqgI_g-UR4YPW9w.text: Creative and delicious menu. Excellent choice for lunch. Staff is friendly and attentive. Will visit again.

lXLooabigWnNqHvGzk5fOg.text: The food is great; avocado chicken sandwich & rotisserie chicken are my favorites. Spinach artichoke is great as well. Lamb gyro is over hyped. The food is over priced but the lunch deal is a great way to try this place.

xLN0UnlgpZ7E4otoBQR8Hg.text: Had the Mac Daddy burger, chicken gyro, And Mac and cheese. Burger was run of the mill, nothing special. Chicken gyro was dry as as a bone. The chicken was severely over cooked and there was a lack of tzatziki sauce. Mac cheese was pretty good. Overall ambience of the place is very pretentious.

HXLyU-bA1M-Aa7Y0Ve0_Fg.text: Kid Cashew has a separate vegan menu! The Portobello gyro is excellent and we also love the Brussels sprouts and beets. I have equally enjoyed the patio area and the ambiance inside. We ordered the portobello risotto once but found it a touch bland. I think it's off the menu now. I liked the concept and hope they can add more flavor sometime and get it back on the menu. Creamy dreamy risotto is tough to find in the vegan world.   They have a great wine list and cocktail menu. My husband was happy with his beer and I enjoyed a cocktail with rosemary in it. I can't recall the name but it was tasty and went down fast!

PMBaYZWy85dLGSz57wS-Jg.text: The lunch special is WORTH IT! The food is incredibly delicious and affordable. I love coming here and sitting on the patio on a beautiful afternoon. One of my favorite restaurants since moving to Charlotte.

Vp7zgTjPFKniZZro9m6ZLg.text: Slower than normal service lowered this to 4 stars.  Late review - in Charlotte over Mother's Day weekend, stopped in here after arriving late Friday.  We had a 2 year old granddaughter that needed to get to sleep, so maybe that made me a little grouchy about the slowness. ;)  Food was wonderful.  We had a couple different salads, Big MacDaddy, chicken avocado, salmon, leg of lamb, and brussels sprouts.  Lamb and sprouts were the table winners.

I6BTK5cK-AU47mEX38tngQ.text: I have to go with the full five stars.  I've been several times for drinks after work.  Bartenders are always engaging and prompt.  It's so interesting to watch all the prep being done by the Chefs at the front and how engaged and focused everyone is.  Great energy in that kitchen!  The dining room is intimate seating and great decor.  Patio is partly covered and a little more space between tables.  No fryer in this kitchen. No freezer.  You are eating fresh, no doubt!  Finally went for dinner!  Since a nice, cooling train had come thru we sat on the patio. Steve was our server and explained our options for the evening efficiently.  1/2 Chicken, 1/2 lamb, potatoes gratin, and the Corn dish of the day.  No complaints about anything for any time I've been there.  I can't wait to go again.

mN9XlDsSkYZm1hiriIdYPw.text: This food was so. Bland. I've tasted bread with more spice than their meatballs, which were served cold. Maybe they were frozen or maybe it was just the slow service that allowed them to sit for so long. I ended up waiting 45 minutes for my cold, tasteless meatballs. I would have been better off waiting for it to hail in September. Actually, the hail might have tasted better. All my waiter did was gossip endlessly with the hostess. I'm glad at least one of us was having a good time   Other than the horrible service and bad food, the atmosphere was sub-par. There were so few people in the restaurant that I've actually seen more people at a homeless man's funeral. I felt like I was walking into a strangers house rather than a restaurant. None of that would matter if the food tasted more complex than cardboard, but it didn't. After seeing the service and ambiance, once I tasted the food I asked for the check.   I then went next door to a lively restaurant called Bad Daddys where I had prompt service, delicious food and a great time.  Moral of the story: if you want to go to a real restaurant and have a good time, head next door to Bad Daddy's!

rUo2u8DfIoJ-4IBWiinIsA.text: Need to try a new spot Kid Cashews where it's at! They have a great atmosphere and everything is fresh

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was so good...light and refreshing

gg9MZ6WXlBeqJBcVa89kPw.text: Great place with a creative menu, pleasant staff and nice vibe. Have been there only once but looking forward to our next visit.

v1zJ8FsecyQCn31ZtPVrDg.text: This place is pretty good. I've been a few times. Think farm to table, casual but trendy. It's like a new little hot spot on east Blvd. they don't take reservations and it's always busy at dinner.   They have spent a lot of money on the building, hope this one lasts, it's been like 4 restaurants in 5 years!  The wait staff is super friendly, the hostess not so much! And Who ever decorated could have cut down on the light selection. There are way too many different light fixtures  less is always more.   They have great Mac and cheese and a super greens or super food salad that is . I have a nut allergy and don't eat meat so I had less options. But everyone I've been there with loves their chicken and thinks this place is pretty great.  Sit on the patio, it's always lively.  Also they have a great virgin mojito  super fresh ingredients.  And I hear there adult beverages are pretty great too

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fresh kale and rosemary

zSEJyscz2oRqqPY0ZlRIYg.text: Went for an Elite event last summer and when I returned it was not as good as I remembered. Love the ambiance inside, and they have a great patio as well (unfortunately it was raining the night we went so all of the covered tables were full). Started with the duo of dips. Both of the dips were really good, but we ran out of chips and asked for warm pita bread. Tastes so much better with the warm pita. I missed the spicy feta, which was no longer on the menu. The Goat's breast milk cocktail is really different and refreshing.   I ordered a couple sides because I wanted to try everything. Didn't think the brussel sprouts or quinoa stuffed avocado had much flavor, and I was not a fan of the leeks in the mac and cheese. My boyfriend got the pulled pork panini and it was amazing!! The mustard on the sandwich really makes it and it is one of the more affordable options on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brussels Sprouts and quinoa stuffed avocado.

0eMMxoaqVjkSTg-OJBrpbQ.text: Ambience and environment is nice, especially on the 80 degree day that we had brunch (in February!). We ordered the beef hash and Mac Burger (?). The beef hash was super tasty, a bit greasy, but loved that it came out sizzling in a cast iron pan. The burger was definitely nothing special, reminded me of a Burger King Whopper with its iceberg lettuce and mayo sauce oozing out. With so much hype around Kid Cashew, I would've expected more but price wise, it wasn't crazy so I wasn't too bummed. Will be back but we'll focus on other dishes!

eoIgzErdI-32iIcIo300sw.text: This was my first time trying kid cashew. We decided to eat outside. It was a pleasant experience outside with the fans going. Even though this place is a walk away, I'm not sure how many times I'll be back. I do like the concept that it is all fresh food and made to order.   Dinner:  The macaroni and cheese was excellent.  I got the scalloped potatoes. They were little fingerlings with a little bit of cheese and oil. They were a little dry and not too flavorful. I would not recommend these.   My friend got the trout. She absolutely loved it . The salad couscous that was underneath the trout was absolutely amazing.   Desert:  We got the baklava and the gelato. The baklava was way too sweet. The vanilla gelato was really strange and had a grainy texture. It was nice that it was a huge quantity, but since it wasn't good that didn't matter much.
