UOhx1Eta2DNHc6RnoefE_Q.text: Used a coupon from the Yelp event. hubs and I shared the beet and arugula salad and lamb gyro. wonderful meal. first time but hopefully not the last.

nCu5NVAaL4vUbybn6hrjeQ.text: Had a great lunch here on a Friday. Pretty busy and service was not the fastest but the server was very friendly and was clearly stretched thin. All of the food I saw come out looked delicious. I ordered the 2 for $9 meal. I got an quinoa stuffed avocado and a garden salad. My buddy got a wrap. Mine was delicious, and the salad came tossed in a spicy and very tasty cilantro dressing. Looking at the menu, I cannot wait to come back and try something else.

KEf0hkZqKq4OcQHQilhQIA.text: Plates are for sharing and we got the chicken, beef short ribs, Brussels sprouts and cannellini beans.  We might pass on the beans next time but everything else was really good!!  We'll be back for sure.  Great new addition to East Blvd.

BkxeCN5f9h8k8z7G9R824w.text: I'm a big fan of Kid Cashew! The first time I went I wasn't totally convinced, but it seems they have worked out the kinks.  I highly recommend the Brussels, the octopus (tastes pretty authentically Greek) and the roasted chicken is outstanding.  This is a really nicely done fusion of Greek and more traditional American foods without being campy or cheesy.  And despite the questionable name, the Goat's Breastmilk is hands down one of the best summer drinks I've ever had. It's perfect for sharing, go ahead and get yourself a pitcher.  The atmosphere is so charming and the patio is perfect for relaxing and people watching.  You'll feel like you've gone on vacation. Go check it out!

aDY0ttYMG7syZxedRgKJ-g.text: Service and atmosphere great.  The food was not good.  I usually have an iron clad stomach, but lunch made me green around the gills.  The chicken sandwich had a fish taste.

2E8BLzGNQ6AMcGNDD8mATw.text: Bachelorette weekend dinner!   Ambiance is cool with wood tables and chandeliers.   We had a great server who totally spoiled our Bride-to-Be with apps and a dessert with a candle.    I thoroughly enjoyed  my Pulled Chicken, Lime (I think, or lemon) Cilantro Sandwich- on toasted sourdough bread.   So.  Good.   Pricing was good.     Can't wait to get back to Charlotte to go again!

flDbXQoWKlkfRp3ZlwZJHQ.text: It was nice, but nothing exceptional.  I was expecting more Mediterranean influences.  We ordered hummus to start and it was supposed to come with pita chips and instead came with dry multigrain toast and no explanation.  We enjoyed the environment and the service was good.

7juccV-c1YQ53_ixaAYoaA.text: This is my second time here in a week, and with all the great restaurant options in Charlotte, that's a big deal! I would absolutely recommend Kid Cashew. The handcrafted cocktails are delicious! I've tried both the Rosemary and Cilantro. I still can't decide which one I like better. The hummus, tzatziki, and spicy feta were amazing! Also loved the half chicken. Lastly, the homemade gelato sundae was to die for! I jokingly asked the waiter if it would be rude if I licked the dish! The patio is great as well!

VZkky2nKU3pLatnrW6UNtQ.text: Cool little place, love the vibe. Cocktails are pretty good, and at $10 felt like a good value. Sat at the bar and could see the really cool rotisserie and wood grill. The bartender was great, down to earth and genuinely nice. I ordered the grilled octopus. It was excellent, although a little sea salt would have set it off. Per the bartenders recommendation, ordered the lamb burger. By far the juiciest most tasty lamb burger I have ever had. The food here is super fresh, not over thought, and prepared very well. Next time I'm i town I will be back for sure. Can't wait to try more of the food.

BGYf1zrnts5JhgMiJXxfUg.text: Get your name on the list early because they don't take reservations but the food was great, we had a big party so we got to try a little of everything. The tzatziki dip was phenomenal and so was the mac and cheese- there was also a basil cocktail (like a mohito) that was great. We would definitely go back! It is very loud in there as some of the other reviewers mentioned- it's a small restaurant and the decor is very neat.

AbCgwdCqIE3bTtWEC7gc-A.text: Im probably not the best to write the review purely that I just visited this place for a quick drink with a friend. I loved the atmosphere , beer was cold as crisp and the bartender was wonderful. I only gave it 4 stars because there wasn't much of a food selection however I'm sure If I would have tried something it would have been delicious

flQzsz9HpV30OZVJ6Dg2IA.text: 3 of us wanted to try for lunch... The Rotisserie Chicken is excellent and very juicy! The pork sandwich is dry and overpowered by mustard. Brussels Sprouts were raw... The server was nonexistent with only 2 tables... We live nearby I will give another chance in a couple months.

qGZ_9R_xC3vp_-c2KESgnw.text: Hostess tells me there is a hour wait, crazy the place is half full, I see a table near the bar ask if we can seat at the table, of course but forgot to tell us the whole table wobbled, (new restaurant really)even the water boy was laughing at the table and ask if we would like to move, we moved, it took 20 minutes for the waiter to appear, the place is really really loud, it is definitely a girls night out place,  that does not make it great for other people, the food, trying really hard to do new things, but just not hitting it, all four dishes were subpar, it's new, so it will wear off soon!!!! Decor is pretty cool

X0HffRP4p0YWdUNJbrJAow.text: What a great dinner experience all around!  We were a party of four, mixed ages, mixed food tastes, and everyone came out extremely happy and impressed.  The ambience is lively, warm, and welcoming, with a range of indoor and outdoor seating.  The service was spectacular -- our waiter was among the best I've ever had, and the kitchen pace was right on.  We had a couple of signature cocktails, the trout appetizer, octopus, beet salad, Greek salad, salmon, and eggplant dish.  All were excellent.  One commented "this is the best octopus I've ever had."    Another observation from those with a view of the kitchen: "that's the sign of a well-run kitchen."  The total bill was extremely fair.  We will be back again, many times!  Note: they seem to be able to accommodate large parties well.

jyD5BMvhBbMYKvAv5lzBOw.text: One of my favorite restaurans!!! I enjoy every single one of my visits to kid cashew. They have a good combination of food and i love that they dont have anything deep fried..I love the family style and Mediterranean food. For the quality that we receive, the pricing is great! I heard that they have brunch now on the weekends, so I have to go one day. Cheers to the Chef:) Ill be back to taste the brunch menu

rorMH-_6_TtVV1B6ZHiPvQ.text: Sounded good with all the high ratings. My wife and I stopped in for lunch on a Saturday. We started with octopus for a starter. No taste of the ocean here, over dressed. I had the lamb burger but it was flooded with tzaki sauce and the lamb was over seasoned. My wife had the beet and goat cheese salad, again over dressed and not enough greens. We were asked several times how everything is during the starter but when I set my lamb burger to the side nobody came around to see how the food is. The bus boy came and moved all the left over plates and then the waitress finally came to bring the bill and didn't ask if everything was good. Seemed well planned out. Won't be coming back.

ZgEeBDr5aj9LWdqQ8yDWpw.text: Fun new place that you need to try! Food is served family style and the portions are pretty accurate for feeding a group. Recommend 2 starters, 2 sides, and a pound of meat to feed 4 people. My favorite starter was the octopus although I'm told the Mac n Cheese is amazing. Cocktails are fun, try the Cilantro if you like a bit spicy. Our server, Joshua, was amazing! Funny, informative and very attentive. Overall I give it a thumbs up!

svgfSIFmv-vPWxP2B4TvXQ.text: We were looking for something new to try and decided Kid Cashew for our Saturday night. We sat outside the patio which was surrounded with brick walls and lighting decor with wooded dining tables. The decor inside was nice and simple as I only got a glimpse while using the bathroom. We were waited on when we arrived and got drinks for the moment until we looked over the menu. I got a cocktail drink they have called Goats Milk. It had a pleasant aroma, minty and lemony with a hint of alcohol. However, service didn't go too well. After we received our drinks our waitress never came back to check up on us or ask if everything was all good. We wanted to eat as well and waited patiently for our server to come. While our waitress served the other guests in front of us we had a feeling we weren't going to get served since the other guest after us had already gotten their food. After awhile waiting we decided not to eat and leave. But then the server never came around to give us our check so being hungry and aggravated already, I pulled out my credit card and started tapping the table in order for them to notice us. We left for the night and was disappointed by the bad service given. Most likely, we will not return to this restaurant.

9WRjGtOecVL-KxYwax52Uw.text: Kid cashew for a girls dinner tonight.  The look of the restaurant reminded me a lot of the mayo bird across the street. Very rustic. Seating can be rather close. We arrived right before the crowd came which was a good thing. Once the restaurant picked up a bit it got very loud. I realized I was yelling across the table.  Aside from all that... I thought the service was great. Very polite, knowledgeable, and professional.  The drinks are made from fresh ingredients which we so refreshing. I had the strawberry basil (a strawberry mule) which is now one of my all time favorite drinks. We decided to do a few small plates to share. We started off with the hummus. It came with pita slices and some sort of bread. The hummus was so full of flavor. You get a good bit of hummus for the amount of pita and bread you are given. Next was the octopus and the shrimps. Both very rich in flavors and very delicious. The octopus was a decent amount of food. The shrimp come only four shrimp to an order so the are a bit of a tease.  I will be coming back to have more drinks and try out different food options. I will make an effort to come before the crowds so I can actually hear the people in my party.

F0_ixTgQWqyK6upQpYh7-w.text: This was my third time and I had a delicious lunch with family. I gave some feedback after my last trip and feel that management is really serious about continuing to improve and delight their customers. Hope that they continue on this path because there is much to love here. The lamb burger, trio of dips, octopus and grains salad are my favorites, and the cocktails are delicious. I also like that their wine list has good, moderately priced options. I'll be back again!

_nIbUQb_7SULyvJkGLtBzA.text: Yes. Yes. Yes. Everything is fresh and super good. I'll be back! The Gyro with brussels sprouts is fantastic. Great job.

WirT3CMzmfIsjhv5pvr7VA.text: Everything on our table from the cocktails to the hummus to the incredible paella was outstanding. Great patio and inside ambience as well. The only drawback is that it is a bit pricey.

G9I8QFqLcZZKLx4P3uAE3w.text: So delicious! I tried the lamb burger for Burger week and was thoroughly happy. And the 1/2 off Martini was clutch. Definitely going back!

ZeDw2GZfQLKgYtehT2p5dA.text: I LOVE the mountain trout and the avocado-quinoa thing - I'm sorry I don't remember the actual name. It's filling and delicious. I also visited during Charlotte Burger Week and the MacDaddy Burger was DELICIOUS. My 9yo ate one all by herself - with chips - and she's not normally a big meat eater.

i_Z3hehYEU3NuM16OuDwcw.text: Food for four. So, three of my friends have been here before and they really, really liked it. I suggested I might try it some time and they decided no time like the present. It was raining when we got there, so that must have dampened the crowd. We were able to be seated right away. Once we were seated and we had our drinks, one of the cons of this place was immediately evident, the table for four is really better suited for two. With our food arriving, and the drinks, it soon became too crowded. The menu set up encourages what they call small plates to accompany the main plate. Think of it as sides. I got the lamb gyro plate. It was the best gyro I've had in some time. I came with some potato chips. As a small plate, I ordered the macaroni and cheese. Now I'm not a fan of baked macaroni and I do like the smaller elbow macaroni, but they tried. It's not the best I've had but it certainly isn't the worst. Two of my friends also ordered their own macaroni- they love it. I think I'm a little more discriminating in my macaroni tastes, so, good but not the best. Also sampled were the meatballs, they had garlic and cumin, it seemed and were pretty good. My friends loved the meal and I really enjoyed mine as well. Service was excellent, couldn't have asked be better service, excellent and quick and efficient as well as very pleasant. Sorry, I don't know her name, I'm almost deaf and didn't look for a name tag. There is an option of inside dining or out on the veranda overlooking East Blvd. Being a bit rainy and humid, we opted for inside dining. Very clean, and a different feel than most restaurants. Hard to define, but I liked it, but not the teeny, tiny tables. Maybe be more concerned with customers being more comfortable than worrying about your bottom line. That said, it was a positive experience and I'd go back again. The price is not out of line. We got there a little early, so the small plates were reduced a bit. My meal ran around 21 dollars including my sweet tea, with refill. I was completely satisfied and enjoyed both the meal and the new experience. Didn't notice any of the bothersome music that most restaurants think they have to play these days and with the rain outside, it was almost cozy. Yes, I'd go back and have no reservations or recommending this place to someone that wants a good meal, in a casual surrounding, and not breaking the bank. Clean and excellent service. I understand this place is new and if they keep up the good food and service, I think they'll do very well indeed. I do hope they get larger tables though, kinda tight for four. That's why I gave only four stars instead of five, really didn't like the tight fit.

RrJ7UcmpisXMlg76sA6ufw.text: I have visited here two times, first time was great, we ordered a couple of small plates and they were great and service was okay. Went back yesterday for lunch and order 4 small plates, the server didn't write our order down and it came out wrong. Our server Louisa had no personality towards us and again, she got the order wrong and didn't apologize when we asked for it to be fixed. The cilantro chicken skewers are great and the Mac and cheese is also great but service really needs work

8VCKbrLlvYiQXp1k7sfvjg.text: Great salads. Ordered the Greek, which comes sans lettuce European style and it was perfect given the stifling heat. We took a table outside because it was just as warm inside and much, much noisier. Staff accommodated our request to sit under a fan. Were seated within 20 minutes as forecast, which was much appreciated. They only take reservations for parties of 6 or more, at least on weekends. Very busy and well staffed. Very reasonably priced. Was my wife's third visit and my first and as Arnold would say we'll be baahhhk!.

--XcSSHP7mppwHP1Am07PA.text: This is probably one of my favorite little places in town. The food is great and moderately priced. The atmosphere is quaint and feels very comfortable, however on busy nights the noise level is very high. The only drawback for it's location is very little parking.

Y0qubHpig_q6x8t1eybDBw.text: Came back here today with some visitors and my experience was much better this time! Service was excellent, the decor is fun and unique and the food was delicious. The 2-pick lunch is a great deal and gives you a lot of food. Glad I gave this place another shot. Also-- the bread the sandwich was made with was incredible. Would love to use at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch 2-pick with Mac and cheese and half avocado sandwich.

if82TT30Vb0A_EGb9ZPqjQ.text: Wondering who gave this place permission to serve SUCH GREAT FOOD!? Oh my gosh. We kept hearing such great things and finally got the chance to try this place out last night. The lavender Prosecco drink was delicious. The crazy feta dip was a home run and I couldn't get enough of my chicken skewers and mac and cheese. My husband had the burger, which was also delicious. We traveled to Greece on our honeymoon in May and felt like we were back in Santorini at a local restaurant we ended up eating at twice because it was so delicious. Totally recommend Kid Cashew to anyone!

kwrG50bUXjVlm1e3e7Ls0w.text: Great brunch! So I went to brunch here with friends and it was a grea choice! Their Shrimp and grits are amazing! I will be honest I am normal hesitant to order macaroni and cheese at a restaurant but I highly suggest you try theirs. The flavor was excellent and made me wish I ordered more then one! We sat on the patio and the weather was great. For mimosa loves we ordered a pineapple mimosa carafe which is available during brunch hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

YZyxH1GfiIP93i0XhklpEQ.text: Excellent food and service. Tapas plates are delicious! Chicken skewers, sausage and beans, roasted asparagus and Brussel sprouts all were fantastic! Homemade cheesecake is very creamy and good. Definitely will go back and I recommend you give this place a visit.

hPnEsmuyVrTT1asfO5RM8A.text: I was really looking forward to Yelp Restaurant week and had picked out all the places I was going to go.  Instead I got stick that week and really didn't move from the couch too much. I still wasn't feeling 100% at the end of the week, but I'd felt so cooped up we decided to hit up one of the Yelp restaurants on the list: Kid Cashew.  Some of our friends live near the restaurant so we met up with them at an off time: 3 pm. I didn't want to deal with crowds or craziness while I wasn't feeling my best and this time was perfect. There were a decent amount of people there, but by no means was it packed.  We ordered the butternut squash hummus to start. You know that drooling emoji? Yeah. Go ahead and insert that here. I've been thinking about that hummus a decent amount since then. I highly recommend it. I ordered the chicken gyro, my boyfriend ordered the lamb gyro, my friends ordered the veggie gyro and the avocado. All looked amazing. Mine - the chicken gyro - was insanely messy to eat, but still yummy. I didn't love the couple of bones I found in it, but I did know it was pulled chicken so I'm honestly not sure what I expected. The chips were also delightful. We ordered brussel sprouts which were also pretty delicious. Honestly though, with an appetizer and the meal, we didn't need the side. I was super full and my boyfriend and I had split the appetizer and side, but it honestly was just too full to finish them.  I can't wait to go back and sit on their patio! The weather was gross when we went, but I have high hopes for when the weather turns I want to go back. Plus, since their menu is seasonal I'll be interested in going back - even at full price. I've actually been thinking about that hummus since I went so....you know I'll be back to try more.

U9x6IBaADMJvz165xqksaQ.text: $3 mimosas?! I'M IN! The staff is super friendly and their food is uncommon than most restaurants but it is not shy of greatness. It was delicious and my plan is actually to go there tomorrow! :) I can't get enough!! I had a quinoa avocado and it was really good with just the right amount of chipotle sauce! My friend got their Mac n cheese and it was soo good!

-GIQC6xmQZQs7utaQcTGrg.text: Stumbled upon kid cashew when a date recommended we have dinner and drinks. This quaint restaurant was perfect for chatting, eating, and drinking (check out the weekday specials online before you go). On the rainy Wednesday night we ate here, it was pretty empty inside, besides the several servers waiting by the bar to take orders. I got the rotisserie chicken sandwich and my tastebuds were not disappointed! Downside to thos restaurant is that it is very crowded with tables and booths pushed very close to one another. We sat on the far wall booth/table line and after dinner the hostess sat couples on both sides of us. When I say my attention span shrank, I am not exaggerating. I would definately check it out again, but ask to be sat in another area of the restaurant.   Pro Tip- parking is located in a small lot next to the restaurant, on the other side of Shomars. Be sure to check the signs in the lot to ensure you are in the right lot and won't risk getting towed.

K0mx9CYRC8DoTSvEun3ZJA.text: Came here for CLT burger week. Burgers were pretty good. But the real reason for this review is the frozen rose!!!! So delicious! Will be returning- next time trying something other than their burger! Very cute place!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

BcM9zYYB2BWspobDRqeC1w.text: I went on a Saturday night. It was busy, but we were able to get a seat. I had the quinoa stuffed avocado. It was served cold. I thought that quinoa would be warm, but it wasn't. It was decent, but I dont think that I would order it again. I also ordered the marinated chicken skewers. They were delicious, and made me want more. The brussels sprouts were o.k. My favorite was the marinated chicken skewers. The service was great.

jQTNVFCYuQ4HjvJd5o5IVg.text: I went for Charlotte Burger Week and got the Big Mac. I've been thinking about how good that burger was ever since! I can't wait to go back. The only thing I wish is that they had French fries!

E8TKQESWZGGMn8ATNXEMjg.text: In my opinion, best brunch in Charlotte! They're lunch specials are fantastic and reasonable. Its my go-to spot to bring guests for delicious food and charming atmosphere!

WgctumksGwkvZRjeNzX4XQ.text: I was lucky enough to be invited to the soft opening and have been a customer ever since. A lot of times restaurants open with great food and slowly start to cut corners once the notoriety wears off but Kid Cashew has consistently delivered great food with affordable prices for several years now and their full dining room during dinner time every evening is a testament to their popularity among their customers. The lamb burger is excellent and their sides are always fresh. Their serving portions are also good. Enough to be filling and you feel as if you got a great deal for your money every time. There is parking but the lot fills quickly. A great place to grab lunch or dinner.

qbk2OwN9HA3PiBo9hXujtQ.text: Kids eat free during weekend brunch. I ordered the shrimp and grits. While it looked tasty, it was a brunch portion meant to eat with something else so I ended up getting the Burger. Was very good, juicy and flavorful. Filling too. Wife had the lamb burger and seriously will get that next time. I tasted it near the end of her meal and it was soo great.  My kids  loved the burger but the kids chicken pizza had way too much cheese. Will definitely be back!

Sy9stQ2qVqZ5YbideL1UFg.text: Went to Kid Cashew for Burger Week on a weekday around 8pm.  The restaurant wasn't packed at all, but the bar area was filled up.  On Mondays, they have $6 martinis (3 to choose from), which is a great deal and very tasty. I ordered the MacDaddy burger which was very flavorful, juicy, and definitely a great deal for Burger Week.  I was disappointed with the amount of chips I received as a side...I think I counted a total of less than 10 kettle chips on my plate.  Also, the Burger Week website advertised a special $6 bourbon cocktail at Kid Cashew.  When we asked the bartender and manager about this, they said they weren't initially aware of this and would have it available later in the week.  I think it would have been nice to have been offered some kind of substitute for this oversight.  All in all, the burger was really good, so I will go back to Kid Cashew to give it another try in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. $6 martinis on Monday
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dinner Menu

sKOdcx3kmG34HmblPlNIDg.text: Service was great!  Had the leg of lamb make sure to ask for a side of cilantro yogurt sauce to go with it, much needed. Love the exterior and interior decor very very unique!

xR9Y8-9LnixB4LD8UlUyYg.text: Served by Nate, even with an injured Left hand..he was terrific and attentive.   Delicious period. Hubby had trout, I had the lamb burger...omg...made our Charolette visit memorable!  Lovely restaurant.

OIq9LCssxaITniwbBQFL7Q.text: I had been wanting to check out Kid Cashew for a while and I had the opportunity to attend Brunch this past Saturday. Loved the decor and the look of the outside patio. I was there for a Bachelorette Brunch and we had a group of 9. The restaurant was busy but it wasn't slammed. I ordered a Bloody Mary which was great. Everyone else at the table ordered Carafes of Mimosas which i was told were delish. I wasn't super hungry so I just ordered the Crab Cake Benedict after asking for a recommendation b/t that and the Shrimp and Grits. Food came out in a somewhat reasonable time for a large table.   My Crab Cake Benedict was just OK...I really hate to say that b/c I am usually ok with whatever, and maybe I had built up the experience in my head a little, but it wasn't anything special. It lacked seasoning. I asked for salt and pepper (and was given a look) and that helped some. Also the yoke had cooked a little more that I would have liked but that probably had more to do with we were being proper and waiting for everyone's food to arrive and one took a few mins longer than the rest of the table. The Bachelorette ordered the French toast and it was pretty close to burnt.   My biggest disappointment with my experience at Kid Cashew was the service. Our server was not very friendly and almost seemed annoyed to be there or maybe it was that she had a party of nine...I don't know. She got snippy with a few of us, gave me a look when I asked for salt and pepper and I don't think she smiled the entire time. Everyone at the table but myself shared the mimosa carafe's, they brought out wine glasses for the rest of the table but forgot one. She was asked for another glass. Someone else asked not realizing it had already been mentioned. Her response was "I KNOW!" As we walked out everyone had a comment about how unpleasant she was. I don't know that being a server is this particular person's calling.   Overall I left feeling Meh. At some point I will give it another try but I won't be running back.

P4ye2g8JMEsHgZMrEVvxMQ.text: Absolute must try. I have gone several times for Brunch, Lunch, and Dinner. It is always delicious. The waitstaff is always great. The patio is a fantastic place to sit.   Go here and go here often.

xZilgReTuRZq9bKSXXXpMA.text: This place has an easy parking and a great ambiance. We went there for lunch on a Saturday afternoon and had a great table at the patio. The octopus is a must. Slow cook pork sandwich has a good lemony taste. Pork shoulder can use a little more flavoring. It was better when we ate it with cilantro source.

w7PT1CGdwiGOewGngXL3PQ.text: How glad I am to have spent my Valentine's Day lunch here at Kid Cashew. :)  First off, interesting name! I wonder why they named the restaurant this. I would have never guessed that they served Mediterranean and BBQ but hey- I"m not complaining.  The menu is pretty simple. They have small plates, salads (you can add protein), sandwiches, from the farmer and from the butcher. We decided to get something from the farm. I was so torn between the brussels sprouts and the mac n cheese. I am SO happy that we decided to get mac n cheese because it was the best mac n cheese I have ever had. That is coming from a girl who doesn't even like that dish that much to begin with. I would eat that everyday.   As far as entrees, they do primarily family style. I love that because I can have a little bit of everything. My friend and I decided on a half chicken ($9) and 1/2 lb pork shoulder ($12.50). I don't say this about chicken often, but it was cooked perfectly! Same with the pork shoulder. It had the perfect ratio of fat to meat and cutting it was like cutting into butter. My favorite part of the meal was the sauces. We were able to choose 2 sauces because we ordered 2 different proteins. We got the cilantro (something) and harissa.  I don't know why I'm blanking right now but both were GREAT!  I feel like I'm blabbing because I blab when I'm excited. This place may be new but it is definitely worth trying. They know what's up. I forgot the name of my server, but he was great. He gave great recommendations and knew how to talk to customers. The people up at the front were incredible as well. I can't wait to come back here to try other dishes.   --End of blabbing.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 chicken, 1/2 lb pork shoulder
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac n Cheese

jEofs5zuI7FEvUy7hMchbA.text: Yum! I went here for my birthday and it was delicious! The place is adorable and the food is amazing! Try the lamb burger & pistachio dessert!! They are both sooo good!!

rGbjqxcXhEE8ftO4nKdWnQ.text: Came in for dinner with my family and I was not disappointed. Super cute restaurant, very open,  kind of felt like someones home with the decor. Surprisingly packed for a Tuesday and a rainy one at that.  We made reservations because we were a large group and the service was quick and pleasant.   Started with meatballs and the pita with spinach dip (yummy!).  I had the chicken and avocado sandwich which was great! Someone else had a burger and another had the portobello sandwich, both were happy. Those who had the salmon liked it, and even the steak (although they complained the portions were a bit small).  Overall the food tasted very fresh and I like that they use local ingredients. Will definitely be back, would love to sit on the patio next time though!

njwktmLRAVMGuhZLF4FKYg.text: I loved the food and prices are very reasonable. They have 1/2 price wine bottles on Tuesday.

q-ex5GgILK8Xj699kl8Z6w.text: What an awesome experience!!! This cute and cozy atmosphere was just what we needed on this past cold, rainy Saturday. The food was delicious. You must try the grilled octopus and MAC + cheese. Our server was awesome and although we had to wait, it was well worth it. The drinks were made with care as well. We sat at the high top tables near the bar and we were well taken care of. Awesome everything. Can't wait to try the gelato

S0oQpjn6Djzb7rxy8HesBw.text: Best new place in Charlotte.  Very nice feeling when you walk inside.  The food is delicious.  The Mac and Cheese is a must. The cauliflower mashed potatoes are amazing.  If you don't like cauliflower you would love this dish.  The chicken is nice a tender and juicy. I will be back.   I understand that they also have a Sunday brunch.

40g0VrtnK55i988nsEJJ7Q.text: This place has been 17 places but I think the Kid is here to stay.   Quite a refreshing change form the last place which I never actually went to. I do know this place is brighter and has way more character than anything in this place before. Ample outdoor dining places as well. There are no freezers in the restaurant. Everything is fresh and there is no hot plate. When it's done it will come to your table. They timed our lunch well. We started with the dip trio of hummus, tasziki, and a spicy feta which has feta whipped with jalapeno. This was really tasty on the toast and pita wedges.   For lunch I had the half chicken which I really had to order after watching 6 of them spinning on the rotisserie looking scrumptious. It was juicy and delicious with nice spice on the skin. I was told I had to try the Brussels sprouts and I was not disappointed as they were roasted to perfection with a nice crispness.   Looked like they had small few nice wine choices as well. Maybe on my next visit. Which will be soon.

P66MIAWrB9amIS_mVYAl_Q.text: What a great addition to this area!  I have to admit I wasn't feeling the overall decor when I walked in but....we arrived just after 5 pm on a Sunday evening with a party of 5. Very few tables were filled but by 6:30, the place was absolutely packed. The setup of the restaurant is conducive to sharing and family style eating. We ordered a bunch of items. Smoked trout-liked by everyone at the table but it wasn't for me, just not my thing. We had the Forbidden Rice, Brussels Sprouts, Roasted Beets, Shrimp App, the Smashed Potatoes and a whole chicken, the lamb and pork shoulder from the Butcher. (Geez that's a lot to type and yes, it was a lot of food).  Make sure you select one of the sauces offered-they were delicious. Everything was delightful with the exception of the potatoes. They were just ok. We shared everything and everyone had plenty to eat with lots of leftovers.  For dessert, we had the baklava and vanilla gelato.  The place is kid friendly which adds to the loudness of the place. Definitely go with 4 or so people so that you can order a bunch of items and sample. They don't take reservations although there didn't seem to be much of a wait. Outdoor patio looks great for when it warms up.  I would recommend this place and would return to try some other items and some of their specialty cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vanilla gelato
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baklava
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted beets

5paWBwoHN7UT-6Rq6jAJDA.text: This restaurant is definitely more on the upscale side. While, I thought the food was decent, it was overpriced for what the menu offered. I was also upset to hear that they do not have ketchup. While no, I did not need ketchup on this adventure, some of the little children in my party did. This place is not suitable for children. Definitely a place to go for cocktails, not necessarily the food.

7MII_BTeT87EAzQg2LbZow.text: Really good food. The portions are definitely stingy. At least they were for brunch when I went. I loved the Shrimp and grits I ordered but it was kind of pricey and I only got 4 shrimp. When I order the same dish at other locations in town I usually have enough for lunch the next day. And the price is usually cheaper. The drink specials are good! Not stingy there. The atmosphere is also really enjoyable and relaxing.

sW-C2QDe617B2ayR1JPCxA.text: Following a pleasant visit to Freedom Park my wife and I decided to try Kid Cashew. I called and was told they would be happy to accommodate our small Chihuahua family member on the outside seating area. We are very happy that we went. The food is delicious, the service was fantastic, and the luncheon menu is very reasonably priced. I completely enjoyed the roast lamb with a side of Mac & cheese, with a local craft brew draft, and my bride chose the arugula red & gold salad with sliced roast lamb. We are in the area dodging Hurricane Florence and if they are open again before we leave for home we will certainly return for their dinner menu. This is certainly among the top two or three dining experiences we have enjoyed in at least the last several years. Highly recommended by two who know good food and great service.

4Kvy4nE1Kpqs-waBYZEFag.text: Let me start of by saying I would come back here for the pita alone. Chewy, doughy and smoky like they'd been toasted over wood fire - yum. We had an early dinner on a Monday and we were joking we were early birds. The restaurant was empty aside from one other couple at 4pm. Yikes. We had our doubts but the food was great! Our server was really engaging and gave us great recommendations. We split the trio of dips - if you order just one, get the feta. I liked the feta the most, the tzatziki second best and the hummus the least. The hummus is made with a black chickpea with a thicker husk so it is chunky. Good as a spread, but not your traditional smooth hummus I've come to expect. We split the pulled chicken sandwich and the white beans for our meal. I want to know where they get their breads b/c they're so good. The sandwich is big and definitely enough to share. The white beans come warm in a tomato sauce that you will finish to the last drop; it's that good. For drinks, I tried the mule with fig - super sweet; I wouldn't order this again and I love sweets. Next time, I'm going to try the cucumber cocktail. Parking wasn't an issue because we came at a slow time but they only have a small lot next door. Overall, I would come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Trio of dips and pita

WIjNYg_bTsS5KaOV420dQA.text: I was so impressed with their Easter brunch buffet, I can not wait to go back. The food was amazing and prices are more than reasonable. The only thing I would suggest is a little bit more attentiveness from the servers but a great place nonetheless.

LXJjUF7A8GWDoVNZW9sPyQ.text: One of my all time favorite restaurants! I loved everything I tried. I recommend going with a big group and ordering a ton of stuff to try. Someone told me to order the Goat's Breast Milk drink and I have to be honest, I didn't LOVE it (tastes like liquorish) but I can tell it was made well! The food was incredible. My boyfriend and I were seated at a two-top the last time we went and it was a little uncomfortable being so close to the couple beside us but the amazing food and service made up for it :)

QDNSjauHZtOIoEJK3AEgwA.text: I went to Kid Cashew over the weekend and was delightfully surprised. This east blvd spot has been a hard location for restaurants to stick, but I have a feeling that Kid Cashew is here to stay. Coming from NYC, I had a strict loyalty to Pio Pio because of my love for Peruvian chicken. After trying the chicken from Kid Cashew, it is safe to say I have officially jumped ship. The chicken was tender and juicy. The avocado quinoa chicken salad was to die for. I literally could eat that every day! Although intrigued by the lamb burger and tapas, we kept it pretty low key with the signature dishes that our server recommended.  Which only means, I'll be back to try everything. Although it was a weirdly warm January night, it's not warm enough to go outside. I cannot wait for the weather to change and check out the outdoor space. This Mediterranean menu seems like the perfect compliment to an outdoor eating fare. I would recommend this place for a casual night with friends, a date, or a great spot to show the family some of the new exciting places Charlotte has to offer. Favorite Drink: Strawberry Basil-super fresh and dangerous (doesn't taste like one drop of alcohol is in it)

8NbO5sQwH0r_IM7XXQk4MQ.text: Amazing service. Great food can't wait to try again !!!! The octopus was so on point !!!!!!

9ZpN1d65DiMh1I_-23zpvg.text: Great wait staff- very attentive and knowledgeable. We had the pork shoulder, lamb burger, Brussel sprouts, and Mac'n'cheese. All were incredible. Tapas menu is limited to four different dips so I definitely wouldn't call it a Tapas place. Highly recommend though!

l45fGpCaPFubapbFAI4Lbg.text: New favorite restaurant! We went for lunch and it was packed but they were managing it well. The chicken was AMAZING! As well as the Brussels sprouts and Mac au gratin. Service was excellent as well. Can't wait to go back for dinner! So glad to have a good Mediterranean spot in Charlotte finally!

6F91XlfxSUZyONhFyVtB6w.text: never got far enough to eat.  excited to go and try it with a table for four at 6:30 today.  sat down near the front with no wait and water right away.  it was all downhill from there.  over 10 minutes later no waiter as they were all busy talking and walking around not looking very interested.  even the hostess just shrugged her shoulders when we said we were leaving.  sorry but i don't ask for my waiter as this is supposed to be a service business..  we left and walked right across to the summit room which is always great.  service like this when they're not full doesn't bode well.

GiBGH-HGDeq_6qU_aWK2kQ.text: All the food we ordered was delicious, albeit pricey -- beets, brussels sprouts, garden salad, trout fillet, and mac & cheese.  My martini was average and on the smallish side, and they forgot to bring the feta-cheese stuffed olives which the waiter had specifically mentioned.  The place is crazy noisy but the vibe is fun and the atmosphere quaint and cozy.  I won't run back but hopefully once the initial opening craze dies down it will settle into a nice neighborhood joint to venture into on occasion.

NgIvMuG5z1jTCej4kDfr4A.text: Wife & split the chicken, brussel sprouts and the Greek salad along with a couple of very refreshing cocktails.  Food was awesome and service was top notch. Looking forward to returning

KEJcecBZa4XMOsZ6PevHtw.text: I went with a group of girls, and the ambiance was really nice. The food was also really good, and different. We all shared the dip trio and a few sandwiches and salads, and were very pleased with our choices! The one negative is that they charged $1 for extra bread/pita, and the pita to dip ratio was way off. I feel like Charlotte doesn't necessarily have the best restaurant scene yet, and love when new, unique restaurants open here. I would definitely recommend trying this restaurant! It's great for a date night, or a group dinner with friends.

SfOBINvLZGC_bofZRjD2sQ.text: This place is around the corner from my house so we went in to check it out and just have afternoon cocktails. We got a seat right away at the bar. The bartender was mixing a drink at the same place we sat. He never said hi, never made eye contact or said anything like I'll be right w you. He was not in the weeds bc the place only had about 5 tables and about 3 people at the bar. We walked after 5 mins.

7hFmsQMLtJSpXVSAGaRF-g.text: I Wish I knew of this restaurant earlier, the food here was an absolute delight. The place is having ample parking and during peak times might demand some waiting. Had indoor/outdoor dining, weather being nice we preferred sitting outside and was called in when the table was ready. The outdoor tables and chairs are comfortable and the menu is self explanatory. The service is awesome with the staff taking care of us well. The staff is very knowledgeable in terms of the food or drinks being served. Don't miss their featured drink, the goats breast milk, it's worth the try. From the small plates , the 3 dip with bread is ok. Nothing amazing but will recommend a try. The feta and baked spinach is definitely recommended. From the sandwiches the lemon-oregano chicken is a treat to the taste buds and so is the from the butcher half chicken. These two are amazingly tasty. The Brussels sprouts from the farmers were good and should be tried though the wood fried portobello mushroom could be given a miss. The deserts baklava and sundae were very tasty as well. All in all a must go restaurant.

OWqisGdOWYGrWSHq-h4Tyg.text: This place has a nice cozy "farm to table" feel to it with its reclaimed wood tables, bearded and tattooed bartenders, etc. But let's pull back the hipster facade to examine what really matters...service and food. Our server was actually quite good explaining the menu, being attentive as much as possible. Yes there were lulls in the service but I would attribute that to overall staffing levels. If you want your own personal entree to come at the same time.. forget it. Your side will come and then your protein will come 10 min later. And this varies for each person at the table. The food reviews at the table were also mixed. After I received the salmon for the second time (first time rushed from the kitchen and undercooked) it was good but nothing special. The trout was also dull. The whole chicken & lamb burger received thumbs up. Brussels, mac & cheese - although good, nothing special. Conclusion: Like any "Kid" this one has some maturing to do.

JCgK1GrYiXBbHCbI6WNImg.text: Awesome food!   Very friendly.  Loved the octopus, trout and salmon with quinoa.   Highly recommend this place!

QMqKvEvOsusNcrtVZeb5yQ.text: If you want to get a table even on a week night I suggest going around 6. At about 6:30 the place had really started to fill up and a wait started. Our server was great and was super helpful with describing the menu. Everything is family style so my friend and I decided to each get our own small plate and then split a second small plate. I got the Chargrilled Spanish Octopus. It came cut up unlike some of the pictures i had seen on here. It also did not have the crispy garlic or gigantic beans that were listed with it on the menu. This was highly disappointing because while the octopus alone was good I would have liked that have something else on the plate as well. The octopus was cooked almost to perfection. I loved the smoky flavor, but it was covered a bit too much oil for my taste. My friend got the Wild-Gulf Shrimp. The garlic butter that it comes in is delicious. She seemed very happy with how the shrimp were cooked. Once done with the shrimp our waitress asked if we would like some pita to dip in the garlic butter. We obviously said yes. I could have eaten a pound of the warm pita with the garlic butter but I had some self control to stop. Lastly we split the Mac & Five-Cheese Gratin with leeks and shallots. I don't know if the leeks and shallots weren't in there or i just didn't notice them but this Mac and cheese was amazing. I love Mac and Cheese that has been broiled and has a nice crispy top. It was a large bowl so i was happy that we split this. All and all this is a cool spot that has good food. My only real complaint is that my octopus didn't come with everything listed which i've seen other reviews have issues with as well. My advice is go in and split stuff so you can try a bunch of things. That's what this restaurant was made for.

p0KqF2ZxfoP3Lb3G_AJ6HQ.text: The food is fabulous.  However it is very loud.  The fish dip and the trout are unbelievable.  Really great service ask for JJ

MMETc6SXT6_YdteO4B4Mlg.text: First off, great location & loved the shabby chic decor. Now I know this place just opened and I'm not one to complain about noise, but it was so freaking loud my ears were ringing & I could barely even here what the waiter was saying. Anywayyyy I really wanted this place to be good, the menu looks creative but all together it's all bland. The chargrilled octupus was dry overcooked and lacked any flavor. I dont understand the fingerling potatoes, all it is is little baked potatoes chopped up dry Bacon and served with an egg on top. The brussel sprouts we're yummy. The grilled shrimp was the best of the meal we used the sauce that came with it and dipped the octupus and potatoes in it since they were so bland. The salmon was grilled to perfection but it's served with bland Cold quinoa. Overall the Brussels,shrimp and salmon were tasty. The restaurant did not offer that one really good item that hit the stop that would make you want to come back.

NCuyaSh9pbyVDvz_cCw6Yg.text: This place was fantastic. Great food and friendly staff. I definitely recommend this pace and will be going back soon.

aaxQ2hsY4P3dyOASxr-c-g.text: I don't know where to start! Everything from our cocktails, salads and entrees were terrific. I got a martini but my friend was the winner with his Rosemary cocktail. The dishes are served tapas style; they come out as done and are made to share. We got the beet and arugula salad and Greek salad. Both were hearty and refreshing. Who knew beets could be so good? For entrees the Chicken was super moist and flavorful. We also got the trout- it was slightly overdone but still delicious. All in all really enjoyed it and can't wait to come back.

LxycEhKfWDZ_ZGqbReADhg.text: Went for brunch- was super excited for the drinks, food, and kids eat free! We ordered the 3 dips with pita bread but got a plate of pita chips instead. I asked about the pita bread but was told they have changed the menu and now only serve pita chips (even though they didn't actually change the menu or tell us this when we ordered it). My son won't eat the chips so I asked for a piece of pita bread since the kids pizza is pita bread pizza. The waitress refused so I asked to see the manager who said no problem and brought us pita. The waitress could have fixed the problem easily but instead made it awkward and uncomfortable. My daughter's pizza came out without tomatoes and when I asked about that the waitress says it was because I ordered "plain" as opposed to the chicken pizza... after we were finished eating lunch she didn't clear our plates and brought the ice cream to our table full of dirty plates and cutlery. Waters were never once filled. My husband was hoping to order a beer but she never came around to take more orders. I got the avocado toast and the the egg was cold and hard on top. Really not a pleasant experience - especially as this was Father's Day! Won't be coming back.

0Vwm4pj6aY82MTpLVEGG4A.text: Mediterranean? Who are they Kid-ding? Unless you count pulled pork sandwiches and mac and cheese as Mediterranean. It's more like Southern cooking with some Mediterranean flare. The atmosphere is fun and some dishes decent, but it's a complete misrepresentation that they bill themselves as Mediterranean. Alas, most new "ethic" restaurants opening in Charlotte offer only whitewashed cuisines, but become popular anyway because of a fun atmosphere (I'm looking at you CO). I think Charlotteans should be given more credit for their ability to embrace a bit more authenticity.

kHYYRftu_dBa-C-X88aapw.text: I've eaten here several times, and I have yet to leave unhappy. Everything from the ambiance of the restaurant, to the food (AMAZE!)to the super friendly and attentive wait staff - just excellent! Meats are delicious and well seasoned, Mac n cheese is a MUST, and I crave the super grains salad about every week! It's not cheap eatery, but on par with the location, and definitely the quality of food. Truly, Kid Cashew is a Fantastic spot for lunch!

nYd0cmPWPx5JHTCbyFmXXQ.text: Visited Kid Cashew on soft opening. It was very good!! The octopus was delicious!! My husband got the lamb burger and loved it! Also their baklava is amazing. We will definitely be going back very soon! Great atmosphere, great staff and great food! Highly recommend!

F0XaluNLWwTqn7dOIr8ibA.text: I am a "vegetarian light" if you will, and I absolutely adored this menu. The food was delicious, the drinks were divine and the patio was wonderful. The service could have been a little bit better, but not a deal breaker by any means. I would go back in a heartbeat. Definite try if you haven't.

cr0Rs4Kgy-bjUi4fxeXvXQ.text: Very loud and very crowded. Constantly being bumped even when sitting at the table.  Server was very overwhelmed and didn't seem knowledgeable about the menu.  The drinks were delicious, even though we had to remind several servers that we ordered them and they took a long time to arrive.  We ordered several food items and we never received 2 of them.  The food was just okay to good; as expected.  They do not provide serving utensils; which makes no sense since this is a tapas/family style restaurant.  The tables do not provide enough room for the plates/drinks.  They would not let us keep a copy of the menu; therefore we felt obligated to keep with our original drink order for the refills and couldn't review the menu for more food selections/reviewing what we ordered.  Every time one of us got up to use the restroom, someone would come by trying to take the empty chair.  We got the pork and it was very fatty.  The greek salad was good.  The octopus was not the best.    Overall, they have some work to do before we will return; but with all the other restaurants in Charlotte, the likelihood of us returning is very very low.  The atmosphere/decor is very nice.

vExY2L2lLQbivIPX-FDH_w.text: Went in with a group of friends on a Friday night for tapas & drinks. I used to go to this place when it was a Spanish restaurant back in the day. I was excited someone finally re did the place. The inside is eclectic, funky, & rustic. I loved the long farm table we sat at in the front next to the door. The lighting was kinda too bright or maybe I'm just used to eating in the dark at other places. The drinks are delicious and a good price. I had a Rosemary which was basically a Moscow mule with rosemary but so good! My friend had an actual Moscow mule - still good. And my other girl friend had the basil - also yummy. The drinks were pretty strong because i caught a buzz after just one. I ordered the mac & cheese which was good because of the burnt cheese on top. My gf ordered a half chicken which was juicy but flavor was okay. My other gf ordered the eggplant something which was also good! Overall a nice place for drinks !

tDZvM4Dhmc4QT6BusBcRzA.text: I was very disappointed by my trip here. I had only heard great things, and was excited to go. To start we got the triple dip appetizer -hummus, tzatiki, and feta. All were good not great, but didn't bring nearly enough bread. Then it was an extra $2 for more bread. Not a bid deal, but definitely a little tacky. I got pork with a side of Brussels sprouts, my wife got a gyro. Pork was good not great, but the sprouts were horribly undercooked. Really disappointed because they really aren't that hard to prepare and are amazing when done well. We didn't think the Gyro was lamb... tasted like pork and unlike any Gyro we had ever had. Very little flavor. Overall all the prices were a la cart and overpriced. If it was $12 s plate I would have said I liked it. But for $20+ per plate, to get a subpar meal.. I do not recommend. I was also charged 25% more than I should have been for my whiskey as the bartender or waitress did not understand my order, but didn't care to complain and just wanted to go.

kvSt_tdoaZzN0NubWXFVAw.text: We absolutely LOVE Kid Cashew. As frequent bar patrons, we have developed a great relationship with lead bartender, Josh. He is extremely nice, professional and knowledgeable about great food and drink pairings. It's nice to be remembered when you walk in the door. There is great confidence that this of all places that have tried, will make it! Great drinks, food and atmosphere!

r6bRvXJlDCsONSmLe99gVA.text: So I left an awesome review a couple of weeks ago, and after my second visit, we won't be back. My first visit was awesome!!  Pork shoulder, Brussel sprouts and service were amazing!   I went back for a repeat and it was a nightmare. I ordered the pork shoulder and sprouts again. I was advised since it was Sunday, I could only order potato chips as a side with the pork shoulder!?  Random, but I agreed. Our meal came and I was served a pork sandwich with crumbs of potato chips. It was ONLY AFTER the food arrived the server told me the shoulder wasn't avail and no longer on the menu.  She said it's "been removed from the menu,  so I shouldn't have ordered it."  She offered to remove the pork from the bill. Didn't offer anything else.  I said, "I'm gonna need a menu since I came for lunch and my husband is eating."  5 mins later she brings a menu. I pick something else and I waited 25 more minutes for mediocre, cold shrimp and grits. My husband finished his meal before my second meal arrived. We were charged for all of it. A manager never came by. Needless to say, we won't be back. Terrible service. Terrible menu.

wZaPeNGYHE5F3zirekvDVg.text: Excellent food and ambience. Sat near the bar on a high top table and had a great time. We ordered the lamb, salmon, and two drinks (thyme & goats milk). Can't wait to come again.

vnvusxUdAwAm6Qtu9WY87g.text: Great place, excellent food. Try their pork panini - great Cuban sandwich. They have a nice selection of beer and their outside seating on a mild Spring day makes for a perfect break in your day. It is a step above your average Charlotte pub/restaurant.

NGy9iSW5lg-KXSR4kfQuXw.text: Best Mac in cheese in town. Cool spot. Good service. Lamb burger and pulled pork Reuben were on point

7MW2kFHrRC7BvYisV0BGiQ.text: I've only been once, last week, and I will be back soon! It was a great atmosphere. I had the greek salad and the tzatziki sauce. Both were so fresh and good. I love the salad with no lettuce ... I ate every bite (well, except for the tomatoes, I'm not a huge fan so they need to be in smaller pieces for me to force them down!). The parking was awful but I'm still giving it 5 stars because it was worth the 80 mile walk to get there. I can't wait to go back and check out more of their menu!

VD5QWvx1RsBJ2n-Nw523HA.text: Nice Sunday evening dining experience.   Walked in and was seated quickly on the outside patio...place was busy.   Food was ok, waiter was attentive...nice location.

3D_bxYWh2wxHpA_Vp5aOCw.text: Finally got to check out Kid Cashew. Not sure how I feel. I really wanna go 2.5 stars, but there wasn't enough wow to round up to that third one.   Cool vibe. Nice decor. Comfy patio seating.   We decided to check it out, because Yelp said they're dog friendly. We got a lot of bizarre and irritated looks from the staff by bringing our pups on the patio. So I'd leave your furry friends at home for this one.   Food was pretty good. Nothing that really made me go "Oooh" but not a bad meal. The menu definitely pumped me up. We tried the octopus (a bit too chewy to eat), the Brussel sprouts (pretty good!), the Greek salad (lots of onions...but okay to share), the potato gratin (definitely again, too many onions. Maybe 3 fingerlings in a bowl of cheesy onions), the open face chicken sandwich (our server told us it's more of a chicken salad - and it was- so don't expect a breast of chicken or normal sandwich) and a gelato sundae (really disappointing.. they must have forgotten it because it came out melted and the server kinda shrugged it off when we asked).   Drinks? Skip. We tried three (Rosemary, basil, and goat breast milk) - they all were just different variations of each other. Shoulda gone with wine - the list was pretty good.   Service was mediocre and slow. Kinda careless. water refills were pretty scarce (maybe why similar hip restaurants leave bottles on the table?). Drinks took a while to get out. Server messed up a few of our orders and kinda questioned us on it. Oh well. Maybe it's just an off night. Might go back to try the butcher meat - but would probably just order it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our melted dessert. Disappointing. the candy bar in the bottom was yummy once you pushed the melty off.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat milk. Deja vu.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Basil? Compare to goat milk.

PDNtCglaus_XTlgi1DlCbg.text: Ordered the half chicken with Taziki sauce on the side and it was awesome! It isn't your normal rotisserie chicken. They don't have a large menu but will come back to try something else.

09fmMxhsctaT-3BU-j_pAA.text: Lets start off with the fact that they did a fairly good job making the space cozy.  The patio is ideal. More importantly, our server had all of the patio tables on her own, was very attentive, knew how to explain all of the dishes well and all the while had a pleasant smile on her face.   For a cocktail I ordered the Fig Mule, it was so disappointing. I wanted to like but ended up not even finishing it. The food, was a underwhelming. The roasted beets, were good but seriously the smallest portion of tapas I have ever seen. The Forbidden Rice was definitely my favorite. It was warm, earthy and savory - well done. We also ordered the lamb, which is what our server suggested given our other items (initially we were going to get the roasted chicken). I am glad that we got the lamb. All the flavors worked well but I wasn't "wowed". We then ordered the sundae and it was also just OK. I thought it was a bit tart but my friend loved it, he finished it on his own.   All in all, I don't think I would return until I know they have newer seasonal items but they don't give me the impression they will do that.

Qg89cLoa4lXDeBhPCTaTpw.text: The ambience can't be beat, but the food just really isn't that good. And it's overpriced

M9qC_8-OpqWCWkqlmKEgXQ.text: Wonderful experience for brunch. Their brunch menu is pretty small, but delicious. They have a bigger lunch and dinner menu. Kid cashew also makes their own in house humans/spreads. I suggest getting the trio so you can try more than one. They bring out fresh pita which is to die for and you can get carrots and celery to go with it. I ordered the beef hash which was onions, peppers, potatoes, beef and an easy egg. I love a good hash and this is definitely one of my top favorites. There is also a lunch menu that you can choose from. My boyfriend got the lamb gyro which was also delicious and a top favorite menu item of mine. The staff is also very prompt and attentive. Always checking up on us and making sure drinks are filled (which is one of my pet peeves when the service staff doesn't). The restaurant itself is very eclectic and such a fun atmosphere. Definitely take the time to go for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

JoKwQidBko-P0e3XJqjj_A.text: This Mediterranean restaurant has an amazing atmosphere, great food, and great service.  Great for all ages and any outing engagement.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Avocado Sandwich
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb Gyro

gGLuC2CXOhFbc1PXFSq8mA.text: Always good food. Vote from me for more crafty cocktail options with vodka or gin. Otherwise several great food options and past experiences at KC!

tgz0OF3FiNeoRGd6gaMmZg.text: Love the bar ambiance & the vibe! The pros are the yummy drink--goat's breast milk--funny to order & delicious to drink!  The drink is basically ouzo, amaretto, mint and some sort of lemon mixer, in a word succulent and perfect for summer. I tried the lamb burger entree and it was filling for 12.50. The lamb had a savory taste with the onion jam but was a little too full of onion. Next time i would say pass on onions, but then again I am not a fan of that veggie. The fingerling potato side was very good. We shared Brussels sprouts which were good with a nutty taste. I think the only reason I dropped a star is the lack of parking situation. I had to go over to a neighborhood and walk back to kid cashew.

yN_1JkJCSwduE1yx2ezSUw.text: I visited this place last week around 4pm on a Sat. And may I say perfect timing. Nice day outside. So the patio was perfect.. Our waitress was tentative and beautiful.. We decided to order a few things from the small plates menu.. The Brussels sprout, the shrimps and black rice paella w/o the mushrooms. I'm fond of everything except the black rice. First time I ever have black rice.. But I love anything that have the word paella in it. So I figure it's worth a try.. But it's just have a bitter taste to it. Funny I tripping about the bitterness of it yet I'm ok with the Brussels sprout. I'm freak when it comes to the sprouts. And it's on point here. Have a hint of lemon to it. Cook to perfection.. The shrimps sits in a nice, light cream sauce. Love it. And I order the "basil" drink. Not sure what's in it. But I'm a fan. I'm coming back..

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. The basil and rosemary? Don&#39;t quote me on that. It&#39;s just yummy
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp in cream sauce with their Brussels sprouts
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black rice paella

B-62quOuR_X0UKOQqWk9hA.text: Came in on a Thursday evening as a party of two. We were greeted by a friendly hostess and seated at an outdoor table on the patio as requested. The inside was packed and the noise level was extremely high, a level that would make it nearly impossible to have a conversation without yelling. Decor was adorable and unique. A friendly gentleman promptly came to our table to fill our water glasses and had a brief conversation with us.   Shortly after our waitress arrived to discuss the drink menu, advised us that she was extremely knowledgable about wine if we needed suggestions and told us what her favorites were. She then departed and stated she would return take our drink order. About ten minutes passed until she came back. Then another fifteen before we received them by another waitress. This was the 25 minute mark before even getting drinks, which I will say the Rosemary cocktail was delicious.   Then skip to around 45-50 minutes after being seated...this was when our order was finally taken. The waitress passed by our table multiple times to remove plates, take orders, bring new drinks, place/pick-up checks, have lengthy conversations, etc. at every other table around us. The waitress never once apologized for not coming to check in or to inform us she would be with us shortly. I understand tapas and the timeline is normally a little extended in between dishes so you can enjoy your food, etc. which is fine. What is not fine is when you never even get to place an order for nearly an hour.   We were frustrated by the time the waitress came for our orders so we only ended up ordering three small plates. Spinach and feta, hummus, and octopus. All were mediocre and unfortunately not worth the wasted time. I still much prefer Dandelion Market in the area for tapas. This was such a horrible customer service experience that we will not be returning to try again. There is no reason to have such an extended period of time for people to wait, especially without notification of a possible reason why. If this is a staffing issue, I suggest management bulks up the employee count or at least train them to be communicative. We've dined in many restaurants in many cities that have consistently packed dining rooms and never experienced timelines like this. Hate to have to give a poor review, we really wanted to like this place!

0HBykj8nKg3tbQvxlQ0ZKg.text: I realllly hate to admit it, but the fella was right - this is a 2-star place.   I went back with a girlfriend for drinks/apps after work on a Tuesday. We wanted to sit at the bar, but the staff was hanging out there, so the hostess told us she'd have to see if they would move. Sorry to put you out!   The staff moved, but the entire time we were there, they were moving chairs and tables around us, and there was a loud banging sound coming from the back. Also, the bar had a chunk out of it that my friend kept scraping her skin on, so she had to keep adjusting how she sat.  The food was okay. We got the octopus and, at the bartender's strong suggestion, the spinach and feta dip. Both were just fair.  Two strikes and you're out... I'm just not drinking the Kool-Aid with this place.

GEX-iIi90hfBAd77RaQk_Q.text: Love the patio and the rustic decor of the interior. I got the panini and a side of beets with goat cheese. I smothered the panini with tzatziki sauce because it needed it. Not much flavor and a bit dry. The side was a teeny tiny portion and it was pretty bland. We also got the octopus as an appetizer and it was very tough. We each had a bite and didn't want anymore. Luckily the server was nice enough and comped it. Overall the food wasn't anything spectacular but the atmosphere was great. This is between 3 and 4 stars.

BlzK9vb1xWdXThoKAyvJtg.text: Fire roasted beets and trout were excellent, meatball appetizer was really good, my wife loved meatballs and Mac n cheese, she ordered lamb and was ok but said it wasn't her favorite, but I tried it and next time I'm getting the lamb. Drinks were good, not extensive beer list but they have OMB I like there copper. All good.

OOG7KdcKOsGZq0fdGke1rA.text: This restaurant has a wood fired grill inspired by farmers and butchers, with a menu featuring Mediterranean cuisine. All food is family style tapas, which are great for sharing. Each dish is jam packed with fresh, flavorful ingredients as well as unique, super tasty cocktails! The service is amazing here. The doctor is really trendy, with a beautiful rustic interior and a great patio space outside. My favorite cocktail is the Blueberry cocktail, made with vodka, rosemary, lemon zest and soda. My favorite appetizer style tapa is the Mac N Cheese Gratin, a savory five-cheese blend mixed with shallots and leeks = explosion of goodness in your mouth. The cheese is still bubbling in the skillet when they serve it to you! And my favorite dessert here is the Vanilla Gelato Sundae, with chocolate and caramel sauce, pistachios, and Heath crumbles -- this is what heaven tastes like, surely!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. This Blueberry cocktail is delicious and infused with rosemary so it is super refreshing!

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vanilla Gelato Sundae. A MUST get!

ycVKNa0JZjnQ705byPv2_Q.text: Great location nice outdoor seating area.  Tasty menu items and perfect portions.  Nice place for a business lunch or a day date!

QJ1IGDkWSeGf0YPxID0-dw.text: Service has always been good. The avocado chicken sandwich is amazing! Mimosas were good. Would recommend this for a first date or even just a casual dinner

NblIfLXfmRuEsPDML_yOPA.text: The Brussel Sprouts are awesome. A definite must try. The mac & cheese was creamy and flavorful. I had the beef burger, it was well cooked and the bun was great. My SIL said his lamb burger was good and my daughter had the salmon. Hers was perfectly cooked. The only disappointment was the cocktails. They were weak with not much flavor.  We will definitely be back to try other dishes.

wy0CDPk5g44Bb5PFNpQitg.text: Unfortunately, this place didn't quite live up to all the hype for me in terms of food. The atmosphere is top notch - with beautiful wooden tables, a well decorated bar and chandeliers on the inside, and a wide, expansive wooden patio outside, which will be a hit come summer.  Our server wasn't all that great and there were some mishaps which contributed to a not stellar all around experience. Maybe I'll give it another try in a few months. My husband and I both had the goat's breastmilk to start, which was really good. The licorice flavored liquor with a touch of honey is genius. We were sitting out on the beautiful patio on a Friday afternoon, enjoying the warm spring air. For food, we started with the mac n' cheese, beets, and eggplant dip with pita bread. We disclosed to the waiter that I'm allergic to nuts, so we were able to get the beets without pistachios. However, there was no mentioning of pine nuts being in the eggplant dip, and I guess he wasn't thinking and brought out the eggplant dip. Luckily, I spotted them before eating it so we were able to switch it to tzatziki but it would have been nice if the waiter knew the menu a little better and would have known not to bring out the eggplant dip in the first place. The tzatziki was a little too oily. The mac n cheese was very good, probably my favorite of the three. The beets were just okay - pretty plain and not a big serving for $7. The most disappointing though, was the lamb burger, which we were really looking forward to because we were getting really hungry after these smaller bites. The burger comes out pretty impressive looking - two patties with caramelized onions on top. However, when we cut in, the meat almost looked raw - definitely not cooked enough. We weren't asked how we wanted it cooked, and I think the waiter could have said "It's usually cooked medium, is that okay with you?" Although, this one was more medium rare. We sent it back and got our check. So unfortunately, didn't get to try the lamb burger!
