7mPmR62AY7W5Q4GI2u6JCQ.text: The atmosphere and service was great! Beautiful restaurant. Unique. The cilantro cocktail was tasty. The grains salad was very fresh tasting and a hit.  The trio of dips was on everyone's table but they were very bleh. Little flavor.  I would go back and try other stuff

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grain salad was great!

oycEA6-uf_VzOxMYJqAl2g.text: This was my favorite place I ate at during my week in Charlotte!   The food is so yummy and fresh! Sometimes restaurants like this can seem intimidating to picky eaters or people that are scared of health foods. I genuinely think that everyone will find something here that they love!   I had the super grain and avocado salad. So yummy and fresh! Loved the combination of flavors. Others hits at our table were the chicken avocado sandwich and stuffed avocado. (I guess we really like avocado? Haha. Don't worry. They have plenty of other stuff too!) The environment is also so cute and fun!  I would have loved it if our food came out faster. And I was usually in need of more water. But if they can tweak a few things like that, this place is well on its way to 5 stars!

PriPBqGPGhJViAxQxd-YoA.text: Really can't decide between 3 and 4 stars here. I wish there was a 3.5!  I really liked the atmosphere-- It's a cute restaurant with a lot of good food on the menu. I loved that they have a lunch option where you can pick 2 items--it allowed me to try multiple things which was great. I picked the Quinoa stuffed acocado and chicken avocado sandwich! The stuffed avocado was good, but actually not as good as I was hoping for. I got tired of it quick and it was spicier than I expected. I've had better stuffed avocados elsewhere. I really liked the chicken avocado sandwich though! The bread was SO good--seemed like fresh homemade multi-grain. Between my 2 items, I'd definitely go with the sandwich!   The service here was a bit slow and any meat addition to a salad was an extra $5 which seems like a lot to me. You quickly pay for a $16 salad instead of $11 which I personally don't think is worth it. I wish a choice of meat would just be included. Aside from that, this can be a fun place to stop if you're looking for fresh food in a cute atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quinoa Stuffed Avocado and Chicken Avocado Sandwich (Lunch Pick-2)

UcBiD83VRgQ1C5yZZkBnnQ.text: We just keep coming back because this place never disappoints!!!  Drinks are amazing, their grilled octopus is OMG!  I always get the half chicken with their quinoa stuffed avocado. My husband loves the fillet and the salad. Service is great and again, the food is amazing. I just love to see how a place like this keeps quality and innovation through time :)  Also, I'm coming back for my frose real soon!

Tkxq278Th3btTBRaVuVVDQ.text: We came here as a party of three on a Sunday for a brunch/lunch option, and although it was pretty crowded we were able to be seated right away.  We ended up sitting inside which has a very open, flat layout--this lends itself to a lot of background noise especially if there are louder/larger tables present. If the weather is agreeable, I'd recommend giving their outdoor seating a try.  I ended up getting their version of the 'Big Mac' burger which was very good, although we were disappointed not to find any french fries on the menu at all, because what's a great burger without some french fries? The potato chips that come with the burger are solid, but incomparable to some fresh, hearty french fries.

NOluoZEtNJzkZP3Rzosf8A.text: Was crowded and hot but let me tell you 100% worth it. Our waiter was clearly busy and was doing 10 different things but still gave us the best service for a Sunday afternoon busy lunch rush. The food was amazing! The chicken skewers were awesome as well as the kale quinoa salad (I don't even like kale). 11/10 would come again

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and polenta

xB3HEXPgqe2u7nvJmsUluQ.text: I'm back to continue raving about what is my favorite regular spot in the QC! Their menu is constantly rotating and always fresh. The number of vegan and vegetarian options is always high and easy to discern on the menu. This spot is perfect for date night, a group dinner, or brunch. Anything, really! It's big enough that you don't really need a reservation either (there's always the bar if it's too busy). Their waiters are very kind and fun to interact with. I highly recommend exploring their cocktail menus and also their desserts (that sundae, though...).

1roFPNJCdO0Ej1o7HCawdg.text: I've been here a couple times, but unfortunately this review is based off the most recent time. Will elaborate pros and cons.  Pros - half off bottle of wine on Tuesdays, yes please.   Ease of getting a table, never had an issue with this as they have lots inside and outside. As it's February, there was one couple enjoying the heated outdoor patio, but no one else was brave enough. They were probably visiting from the North. ;)  Ambiance and decor - super cute, homey, rustic, clean and charming. Even the patio is cute, which is part of why I loved coming here.  Cons - food quality. It's really gone downhill (in the past maybe year?). It used to seem as if it was fresh, but now it seems it's from Sysco, yes I said it. This is not what happened around a year and a half ago when it all seemed like it was fresh.  Octopus - probably the worst I've ever had, and I love octopus. It was so overcooked it was like rubber to chew. And it was cold. Maybe the waitress let it sit too long? It was actually terrible and we couldn't even finish it.  Meatballs - great flavor with a stroganoff type sauce, but they didn't seem fresh and my partner could only stomach one (and he usually loves meatballs, so that was weird). We ended up taking 3 home, they might be better round 2.  Lamb burger - good flavor in the lamb, but it's not exactly a lamb patty. I think it's the traditional lamb you get by shaving off the rotisserie, but it was two large chunks. I guess I expected them to make the patties by hand as most nice restaurants that serve this dish, but not so much. The meat flavor was just as you'd expect from a Greek restaurant - just served in a different way than in pita etc. There was also much too much tzatziki sauce so the patties kept slipping off with each bite. It was a sandwich that you constantly move the insides around to make sure each bite is flavorful and then at the end you've got a whole lot of some things and none of the other ie: bread to meat ratio.   Beat shared plate (same as salad minus arugula) - they just tasted old, and not fresh. I knew the mandarin oranges would be from a can because that's how they come, but with the old beets I just wasn't into it. It seemed like it had been sitting in my frig for 4 days and I was just getting to it. The cheese and nuts were oversold on the menu too, as it was a dab of cheese and a few sprinkled nuts. I feel like I ordered this dish in 2016 and it wow'd me and the other night it was just a chore to eat. We only finished it because I swear I could hear my mom saying, "finish your veggies."   Half avocado in quinoa - Ok this dish was worth it! It was a $3 up-charge with the lamb burger. I honestly should have gotten the full and not everything else. Fortunately with a "half avocado" they can't give you a low budget alternative, and it showed. Yum, and thank you. Great sauce and flavor, even if it was basic shredded lettuce.  *My rating is not based on how terrible the service was, the food earned all 3 stars and nothing more. Here we go. Service - where to begin? This is a long story so just give up now if you have somewhere to be and skip Kid Cashew...  Firstly, my partner was literally flying in this night as we'd been across the country from one another the past few days so we decided to meet and have a date. He landed at 7 so we decided to meet at 7:30 knowing he'd be later so I could order and have it ready when we arrived. We were both starving anyway. So I arrive, waitress tells me about the half off wine, and then says "I see your other person isn't here so I'll be back when they are to get your order." I think, OK well surely she'll swing back by after 10 mins of me sitting here alone with my water and ask if I'm ready anyway. Nope. I basically wave at her from across the room (she is literally just standing around talking to another staff member bc she thinks she has nothing to do). She comes over and I tell her I'd like to order. Surprised she gets out the notepad.  I order the lamb burger, ask if I can get asparagus as the side. "No." Um, no? Like not even for an up-charge? Not even, "no I'm sorry we can't?" "No, just the sides listed." Ok, well then I'll get the avocado (thank goodness I did). She then closes her notebook and says, "you want me to pick up these dishes since this person isn't coming?" What?! No, firstly, I'm not done ordering and secondly they are coming! She looks at me like I'm crazy and opens her notebook again so I order the rest. Well that was awkward. He finally arrives, a few minutes before the food arrives, but the waitress doesn't come back. She finally comes with the food and drops is. Not even an acknowledgement to him to say "hi, welcome" etc anything. She never asks if we want wine or any drinks besides water (or before) and just drops the food and heads back off.  In total, I saw her 4 times total and it wasn't pleasant.   Given the experience, we probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Even the sauce with the meatballs looks like it had been sitting to long.

qvcubN2YFObEHEq9mjsCcg.text: I finally made it over to try Kid Cashew! Parking was decent for the area but I could see the lot filling up quickly during busy times so plan ahead. It was a beautiful day so we just sat on the patio which was nice. If you're looking for a lamb burger in Charlotte this is the place to be. The burger is not just one of the best lamb burgers in Charlotte, it's one of the the best burgers in general so I'd go back just to get it. I also got some mac and cheese which was just ok. All in all I'd visit again for the burger.

oJVavf02vKrS7hFgpnNDrw.text: We've been wanting to try Kid Cashew for a while,  and finally decided to go Saturday for a late lunch. Craft cocktails are around $13, the grill items are around $17, most burgers/sandwiches are around $11, and the "small plates" (which are each the equivalent of a small appetizer for two people) run from $6 to $12 (pricey for portions on those). I originally thought of getting a few small plates to make up my lunch but decided for the price I was better off just getting a main dish.  We ended up getting two small plates (the Cast Iron Mac & Cheese and the Grilled Beets), the Lamb Burger (with kettle chips), the Lamb Gyro (upgraded the side to a quinoa stuffed half avocado for $3) and we shared a Big Fig Newton craft cocktail. We saw some neighboring tables order a few items we had considered.   Honestly, nothing blew us away. In fact, we both agreed that every item we tried, we had other places in mind (locally) that made something similar that we enjoyed better (sometimes for better prices too).   Service was friendly and attentive, but at the end of the day we both agreed we were glad we tried it but we didn't feel like we would likely return. There's just too many great food places in Charlotte to settle for average.

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flame-Grilled Domestic Lamb Burger with kettle chips - strong red wine vinegar flavor to meat.

nwxTAc73QIq9bF4SIgEqzw.text: Great location and atmosphere!  Hostess and waitress were attentive and fun.  Everything we tried was really good, especially the lamb burger.  Only minor complaint is the beer (NoDa HopDrop) was served a bit on the warm side - get the draft beer instead.  I'll come back!

hT141GOIC3639cYoilNAKg.text: I've actually been really bad about going to try new places since moving to Charlotte in 2017. Kid Cashew is a place that had been on my list ever since seeing the name on the sign when I was headed to Lebowski's for trivia.  Kid Cashew. First, I thought it sounded like an Asian restaurant, not Mediterranean. I guess because of the cashew? I don't know. Second, I was 99% sure that was the name of a rapper. Both guesses were incorrect, but finally getting to Kid Cashew was the correct decision.  We went on a really nice Friday evening and were able to sit outside and enjoy the weather. We ordered a nice crisp bottle of Sauvignon Blanc - Brancott Estate (NZ) to start. Hadn't ever had that before but it fit the low 80's and sunny weather perfectly. Not super sweet, but enough to party.  We started off with a few dishes - the spicy feta and hummus, wood fire grilled octopus, and the meatball au poivre.   First, the spicy feta was IN.CRE.DI.BLE. I figured it would just be feta with a little flair of spice. Nope. There was some serious kick in there. Like if you ate 5 consecutive bites you would actually start to feel some burn. Loved it. I'm not a huge hummus fan, but my girlfriend seemed to enjoy that as well. They had no problem reloading us with pita when we ran out, and it came out hot and fresh.   The meatball au poivre with the cognac peppercorn gravy. Yum. I've always said gravy is one of my favorite food groups and this gravy delivered in a big way. The meatballs were moist and tender and gave you more of a subtle au poivre feel as opposed to the peppercorns forming a crust. Damn good, though.  I had heard a ton about the octopus at Kid Cashew so we obviously had to get it. I thought the octopus was pretty good. I don't know what it is, but something is sort of offputting by laying a protein (or anything, really) into a pool of olive oil. I get it's pretty, but I'm just not a huge fan. Also, they did give us a lemon slice but it could have taken another hit of acid before getting to the table. I'd probably give it 3.5/5.  On to the mains. I can't speak to the fish my girlfriend got as her entree, but the quinoa under it was the best I've ever had.   I was struggling between the lamb burger and the Big Mac Daddy, but eventually went with the latter. Now, I've definitely had my fair share of big mac's, and I've had a couple big mac impersonators at various restaurants. Some are pretty good, some are meh, and some are fantastic like the one at Kid Cashew. This is something I'd struggle to not get whenever going back to KC. The burger was seasoned and cooked to perfection, and it had char and grill marks to give it a little extra zing. The sauce was spot on, and I'm not sure what could have made this particular burger better. I can't recommend it enough.  Since we were already there, we obviously had to get some baklava. Very good way to round out the evening with some sweet. I'd it was "good." I've had better, but still something I would encourage ordering, especially if you are in the mood.  Besides the above, the menu isn't huge, but there were a lot of things I was back and forth on. I will 100% be back and am looking forward to it.

RE2Sx12wrYlWvk1LfGUOMQ.text: Awesome patio for a group or date. Nice mix of young, old and families.   Cheeseburger was the perfect hangover cure. The sauce is messy so ask for extra napkins! The Bloody Mary had good flavor and a reasonable price.   If you're not starving, it looks like there are a decent number of shareable side items you can get to make a meal.  Can't wait to come back and try the Brussels and lamb burger.

xRyw0JpBWpnQWiwfe2x1xQ.text: Very impressed with the food and service. We had the octopus, chicken skewers, asparagus, beet salad, stuffed avocado the trout entree and my daughter got the kids Salmon. wY8jpc-s3F_6Wy7Q8DzaPw.text: The trout was salty. Entrees don't come with sides and you have to pay extra for them. Not at all appealing. I wouldn't recommend.

42PPicsDKNMvC4SmvI3PKg.text: This food is extremely overpriced. I ordered chicken for $11 and it didn't come with any sides, you have to order more. The chicken was covered in oil without any type of sides which is a little intense for $11. The waitress was nice, it's the only reason I am giving it 2 stars. Since the menu is geared toward conscious individuals (vegans, gluten free options), it would be nice if the restaurant worked to be more allergy conscious.

sfy24XewaHYJQCdCYPxTxg.text: $6 small plates weekdays from 3-6pm.  $6 martinis on mondays. $6 craft cocktails on thursdays!!

ZWvKt_2dgWZldudzbwLHLw.text: Since I lived in Texas for 7 years I know spicy food but the sauce on the avocado stuffed with quinoa was too much and I could not finish it.  The appetizers were good though, Brussel sprouts and macaroni and cheese. We had an appropriate Marbec wine. Service was good and fast. This is a popular spot filled with people at lunch.

__-p-mRcsGWqZOlSbXj-jw.text: Farm to table at its best! We love this place. My favorite is the brussel sprouts! Nice staff, pet friendly with a great menu. Every item from the menu that I have tried has been wonderful.  The outdoor space displays fresh potted herbs. Great ambience! A must try.

vFutaORdm19Y6VvjQN0_RA.text: I don't know what the actual menu item is but they have a replica Big Mac and DANG it's good!! I eat a lot of burgers so I consider myself pretty well versed  but this is a great.

kfjSB32fecPeMP0FjMRW9w.text: We literally just left this place for lunch. I was not impressed at all! Don't get me wrong the inside is beautiful but the food not so much. I had the chicken gyro so did my aunt. Mine had no sauce on it and the chicken was dry my aunts was under cooked. We were not told about any food specials  which they had. It's not our job to ask!  My fault for not telling the sever about our lunch disappointment.But when we walked in, now keep in mind the place had 4 people seated. The server was slow and they acted like we were bothering them.   I live in the area and I'm always on East this will be a place I will just keep driving by. Oh, this was our first time there sad we won't be back.

Az6Ufa39khjfOoUeWUKgZQ.text: My husband and I went here after wanting to go for a while. We shared a bunch of small plates and the food was just okay. For the money I think there are better restaurants in CLT.

FjoRI54T08JzKBPIwThHlA.text: Easily one of the most unique places I have been in Charlotte. Incredibly well executed food. My suggestion is order one protein for two and order multiple sides. I was lucky enough to have the half roasted chicken and it was sensational. The other interesting dish was the stuffed avocado. We split the half order and it was plenty. The reason we loved this was it was light. Eating here doesn't require you have massive plates of food. You feel great leaving after you eat. I would highly recommend a visit as this is a great atmosphere and overall solid experience.

-5IPmzrvhDrk1yfco9KyWg.text: Kid Cashew gets 5 stars anytime we can eat outdoors. The food is excellent. We've tried almost everything on the menu, most recently the grilled trout for me and the beans and sausage for my husband who hails from NOLA. But the atmosphere inside during the winter is horrible. On our most recent visit during the cold spell, we entered at 6:00, had a drink, ate our meal, and were out the door in 30 minutes. The noise level was unbelievable, more like a sports bar or a pizza place. Never again will we go there unless we can be outside.

LmoBFlJfVXb32l1aAIXLhw.text: So good! You can tell everything is made fresh! Gluten free friendly too! Lots of vegan options as well. I had the grilled octopus, brussel sprouts, and lamb. So good, lots of flavor!

g2gdhTnREkd1k-ELYNySnw.text: Simply great! Each time has been an equally pleasant experience. They also have lunch specials that are well priced and give you a considerable portion of food. Whether it's their sandwiches or their entrees, Kid Cashew delivers quality food each and every visit. I could go on, but I'll leave it at this: go visit!

OZZm31JHJ0LPzRc_frTvKA.text: I have been wanting to come here for like a year because I always drive by it leaving from work, and I've always thought the outdoor patio looked so cute. Finally went for brunch on a Sunday a few weeks ago. Outdoor seating is beautiful, indoor is super cute as well! I got the shrimp and grits and I could have licked the plate. So good! Service was good as well. Will definitely be back!!

ZwfY-xqthAU0nz3IA1Dwdw.text: Had a great meal of small plates, Brussels sprouts, Mac-n-cheese, shrimp and polenta (what's the difference between grits and polenta? About $10 per bowl) and a couple others. Everything was good. Thought I saw somewhere that this was G. Bakasias restaurant?

hZB6nbKF-4b6o_p9MqscQQ.text: The only thing worth mentioning is the grilled octopus. The rest of the different plates we ordered were plain, dry and very bland.  The Tzatziki was literally plain sour cream or yogurt. No salt, onion, garlic or lemon juice. Plain!    No self respecting Greek person will call that Tzatziki sauce lol. The chicken was dry and tasteless.  UPDATE:  so i did come back with a fellow foodie friend.  We ordered the octopus which was fabulous again. We got the drink specials of the night which were tasty but very watered down- not a lot of tequila in them but still tasty. My friend loved the steak she ordered.  I ordered a greek salad and again. Very very bland for greek food. So the bottom line is-- the food is good quality and I must say our server was awesome but this is not True Greek food. Just expect very plain versions with no garlic or flavor.   The salad had no vinegar or lemon juice. The chicken had zero flavor or spices on it. Very strange but I did change my rating to 4 stars just because at least the food is good quality and the service was nice.

60VwVMOdqIEezXTMf4NBwg.text: Good, not great. I would go again if someone wanted to, but wouldn't chose it myself. The food was quick, hot, and decent. I thought the tzatziki lacked flavor and the lamb burger sounded better than it was. It was decent, but not outstanding as it had been hyped to be.

IGHmr61wjMZBAMw-lgX1Mw.text: Absolute worst decision to celebrate my birthday with friends here. After dinner and drinks I decided to ride with one of the others and leave my car parked in their lot only to return a few hours later and find my car booted! I called the number on the receipt and paid the $125 fine because I had no time to waste and I had no receipt to prove I'd been there earlier in the day because my lunch was paid for. I did some digging and found out that they regularly have cars booted daily and they actually have someone watch the parking lot to make sure people aren't parking and going to neighboring bars and restaurants. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! The food and drinks  were ok but the service was slow and after reading previous yelp reviews and responses, I understand why. It's hard to be attentive to your customers if you're watching the parking lot and battling negative PR the whole time. Notice not one response is apologetic or an attempt to solve any issues. They flatly deny that any problems exist which is proposterous even for the best restaurants! There are no cameras watching the lot, a physical human being is being paid to do that and apparsntly respond to negative reviews! Maybe if they put that same amount money and effort into their food and service, people wouldn't just want the parking spaces, they'd want to eat and drink too and there wouldn't be a need to monitor empty parking spaces. Why would anyone patronize such a ridiculous establishment? I know I never will again.

0OLCHFEB6UyLLwBVHTGUSg.text: Great place - recently been there twice. Love the outdoor seating ... roasted Octopus, hummus is great + Beet Salad with Fire roasted Salmon was amazing.  Inside looks cool too. We'll be back again soon!

ihAzUr8p_yk_bXc6qKlXMg.text: This place never disappoints! Other than the fact that it gets a little loud around lunch - so don't go here and expect to have a quiet discussion around the hustle and bustle of lunchtime. The hosts and servers are consistently attentive and courteous - for both eat in and take out. The food is consistently fresh and delicious. The super grains salad is a perfect combination of lettuces, grains, avocado, nuts, dressing and if you add a meat, it's even better!  The grilled octopus is cooked and seasoned wonderfully. The lamb burger is truly their masterpiece!!! Servings are plentiful and although not cheap, I believe worth the quality! Whether you are looking for lunch, dinner or a take out experience, Kid Cashew will do you right!!

ow3m9AHI6PXlDRiplIOjyQ.text: Took a couple girlfriends out Friday night for their joint birthdays. The restaurant itself has a cool vibe, and service was mostly on point, which counts for a lot in my book!  When I say we almost ordered everything on the menu, that's no lie!  We were feeling celebratory.   The apps and salads were really nice. The spinach and feta dip, beet salad, and grilled octopus were my faves. Greek salad was also decent. The mac and cheese was ok, but a little dry.  Definitely not a creamy mac and cheese. I had one of the specialty cocktails...the fig mule was ok, but was too sweet for my tastes, so didn't enjoy that cocktail. Wine is always a winner :)  For the main course, we ordered brussel sprouts, eggplant, forbidden rice, fingerling potatoes au gratin, 1/2 lb salmon, 1/2 lb lamb, and 1/2 lb pork.  Again, the sides were good (forbidden rice was delish!), but the meats were disappointing. Out of the three, the salmon was the table favorite. All meats were seasoned identically, with the same sauce on the side, so not a lot of variation here. All were under-seasoned, and the lamb was not tender.  In other reviews, the lamb looked like a winner, so maybe we just had a bad serving?  Who knows...  One thing that bugged me a little was at no point were we provided with clean plates or utensils. I had olive pits hanging out on my plate from the Greek salad through the entire meal. When you order so much, it would have definitely been appreciated to have a clean plate at some point.   All in all, not a total fail. I'd go back for apps and maybe to try a different cocktail, but will likely not be back for dinner.

MFaOPPCqhqCcZ6qUPRSfrg.text: Been here twice and sat at the bar both times. Great service and the bartender was more than happy to make recommendations for both cocktails and food. The octopus is awesome, shrimp and polenta was my wife's favorite, and we both enjoyed the beets with goat cheese. We brought another couple for our second visit and once again, the octopus and shrimp over polenta were a hit. I tried the burger and I am still thinking about it.

eRCehcQWfdUFFIyS-ozV5w.text: Loved this place. Fun vibe , Great waiter and delicious food.  I had the salmon which was incredible and cooked perfectly.  I could literally eat it everyday!  The gyra was fabulous and the beets, and octopus were great too. Absolutely going back.

tPr7tSozIfL1Hzb9NlNP6g.text: Food and ambiance was great! Only turn off is the curtains at the entrance. They should be taken down or at least cleaned. Also front entrance rug was very dirty.

3BgbYO020H5kXg95uJ6WaA.text: I was very excited to try this place.  The atmosphere was wonderful!  I love how it is decorated and the cozy feel it gives off.  The waitress was not very attentive, which always ruins things a little.  She didn't do much explaining of the menu.  I really enjoyed the three dips and pita, but they do not serve enough pita and when you are out but have a large amount of dip left-they charge you extra for more.  I got a pork sandwich, which I won't have again: it was very greasy.  Overall, I like the idea of this place, there are other things on the menu I would like to try, and will give it a second chance.  Maybe try a cocktail or two because they looked fabulous!

N1zS16MINcDmQJDyufYuOw.text: I really enjoyed our visit to Kid Cashew. The ONLY complaint..is that it IS really really loud...like..yelling across the table to each other. Other than that, the service, food..even the decor was top notch .  Whole Mountain trout, Wild-gulf shrimp and mac and cheese were very yummy! photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whole Mountain Trout, Wild-gulf Shrimp, mac/cheese and brussel sprouts!

HrKwu3YjS1uZPxRxBfIwKQ.text: Went a couple of weeks ago on a Sunday for lunch for the first time. Since I've been in Charlotte, this place has been more restaurants at this location than I can count... (yes, I can only count to three).  The ambiance is great, on a sunny day you get light coming in and it's very casual chic. The service was good, they explained everything on the menu well and we had a pretty good idea of what to order. We started out with the octopus and roasted beets. The octopus was tender, well made and had good flavor overall. You can't go wrong with roasted local organic beets, ever. The roasted chicken was also very good. Nothing to write home about, but well executed.   I think the highlight for me was their infamous cocktail, the goat's breastmilk. I know some people don't like licorice, but I was a big, big fan... especially of the carafe :)

G-LQn1BvvaGDCJVWk6Uhyg.text: This place was a great find will definitely return  Stuffed avocado was super yummy Was nice to sit outside and relax with a cocktail  Don't miss out ! You must try this place

mPwSG20RiU-cJGM8u9rnFw.text: I've been in here a few times and usually the food is good & I don't have any issues. Today I went in with my boyfriend for brunch (on his birthday) and I ordered a portobello mushroom sandwich with a quinoa stuffed avocado as a side. No issues. My boyfriend got two sides, brussel sprouts & Mac and cheese. No one came by to check on us until we were done with our meals. His brussels were good but the Mac and cheese were watery. He sent it back but it wasn't taken off of the bill. He didn't tell me until after we left, or I would've asked to speak with a manager while we were there.   Decent food most of the time, but customer service is lacking. Disappointing experience.

2rIHr_iI85YNoyCkjcln8w.text: We decided to try something new and liked all the good reviews. We were a party of six and the hostess got us seated right away. The ambience puts you in the mind of a southern kitchen.   Our waitress was very informative and answered all of our questions about the menu. I was so indecisive and wanted to try many different options. If your vegan there are many different options for you on the menu as well.   We ended up picking the 2 sharables: 5 cheese mac and cheese, spinach and feta dip. 3 Big Mac Daddy burgers, 1 lamb burger and salmon. The food came out very quickly, it was a fair amount of people dining in. We enjoyed every bite of everything and look forward to visiting again.

_X8KUGRHL5zqHi14IFkBAA.text: Just go to Kid Cashew. Stop reading the rave reviews, flipping through photos, comparing menus. Just... go to Kid Cashew.     The ambiance is warm and inviting, the staff is attentive without being intrusive, and the food is varied and delicious. At this point, I've eaten my way through a good portion of it -- all the hummus spreads, the lamb leg and gyro, the rotisserie chicken, and multiple salads. Now I mostly prefer to order the small plates so I can enjoy a little bit of a lot of dishes. my favorites are the cilantro chicken skewers; greens, grains, and avocado salad; and wood-fired asparagus and grilled beets. Even after ordering from just the vegan side of the menu, I leave full and extremely satisfied with my meals.   When the weather's nice, I prefer to sit outside and add a beer or cocktail to my meal. Since I don't get them back home, I typically opt for a NoDa bottle of crafty goodness or Legion draft, but the lavender lemonade and cucumber basil mule also are refreshing. When the evening temps are cooler, I prefer a hot tea and desert (the key lime. OMG, the key lime...).  I'm in town a lot on business, so often I'm a party of one. I understand it's not ideal for a server to have a single person taking up a four-top in their section, but I've never felt rushed or ignored by the wait staff here, as I've experienced at other restaurants in the area. From the hostess to the table bussers, everyone I've encountered has been pleasant.  I'll be back in town later this month and already am looking forward to introducing a few of my coworkers to one of my new favorite Queen City spots.

huvy_EXkc0S-N0JokEFWiQ.text: So yummy. Maybe the yummiest.  Something for everybody - families, work meetings, couples.  I love the menu & the cozy bustle of this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon and quinoa salad.  Perfect.

4uPpHf-08rs1_oLmOcndlg.text: Not seeing Mediterranean except for the cucumber, vinegar tomato medley.. perhaps it was just a bad day for us or the chef.   We had ordered a chicken skewer tapas (meh), leg of lamb 16.95, and mountain trout 16.75?.95?     On a positive note let me start by saying the interior was warm and visually inviting, the cocktails were on point and the Malbec was an excellent choice to carry our evening forward.  5 stars easily for the drinks.   On the other hand, the lady (growing up in a country where goat and lamb are staple) couldn't stomach the lamb, it was very beef life in texture and tough.   We have yet to send food back but in this case could not eat it.  Not to mention side dishes were never suggested to us assuming we'd get at least one of the delicious looking options.   I had ordered the mountain trout, flavor was very basic and it was overdone as well. The tomato and cucumber garnish was pleasant to look at and we ended splitting it, perhaps sitting on a bed of plain quinoa caused to the flavors to lack a bit but either way.  It was just edible at best. I'd be willing to give it a second shot for a salad or the chicken... but she wasn't happy

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb???

i5TzADv5Ym6otMhE186iIw.text: Kid Cashew is a cozy and pretty little spot on Dilworth's Main Street, East Boulevard, with a great vibe especially for lunch or brunch. The decor is extremely pretty and the patio is a great spot to spend a Sunday afternoon at for some Mediterranean food. The four stars here instead of five mostly relates to the menu, which at first glance seems great and diverse but lacks a lot of "home run" options. The citrus quinoa salad will have you feeling healthy and refreshed and the quinoa stuffed avocado is a great plate that manages to be more filling than you'd think. $6 cocktails on Thursdays is also a great deal for grabbing drinks before or after dinner.  If you're looking for a fun lunch spot, it's a great option but there are probably better dinner places out there if you want more elevated food.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

-cdzH2VMnZJDLaXo0oOImQ.text: Excellent atmosphere and ambiance! You are left in awe until you settle in. It's surprising how unanimous the ambiance feels, nothing looks out of place - the couches, the art on the wall, the color palette - this is definitely going down in my list as one of the better looking restaurants in Charlotte.  The menu is simple to choose from - starters, small plates, entrees - sandwiches and burgers and finally the most coveted vegan option. I wasn't eating healthy that day but pleasantly surprised at the number of options you could get if you are on a diet - look around and the crowd speaks for itself - lot of healthy individuals on diet! The other side of the menu is filled with lots of wines, beers and other cocktail drinks.  We got Mac n cheese which was well roasted on the outside it and tasted alright. The burger was alright too. The salmon however looked pathetic and definitely not photogenic so I avoided taking a picture of it- it was too thin like a filet of tilapia, not something we expected. All of the food tasted okay and standard. The chips on the side was a good change from regular restaurant but wished something more substantial would have helped as a side.  On the whole, great restaurant, wonderful atmosphere and ambiance, you won't be disappointed by the food and lots of wines to taste from. Improvement areas - food tastes standard and not really sticks to your memory as the restaurant does!

9R-aQCpaafan_zT7s4kxCw.text: Second time at Kid Cashew. The truth is..."I'm just here for the lamb", as they have some of the best grilled lamb around for a fast casual spot. With the addition of $3 mimosas, you can't go wrong with Kid Cashew for brunch...for the most part.   Here's why...  The brunch menu is limited but I appreciate the variety of options for Keto or Vegetarians. Everyone in my party enjoyed their meal and mentioned that they would return.  The customer service was average. We had a large party and our waitress seemed to be a bit rushed. We ordered our food but were not asked at any point during our meal if we wanted refills or if we cared for dessert (it's brunch...I get it but still ask). Suddenly our checks appeared and our party certainly perceived it as a cue to hurry our meal. Most of the party had practically full plates when the checks arrived.  So, the food was good the jury is still out on the customer service. I had a similar experience on my previous visit.

RMLIHw-_-gBkAUZcW81xlw.text: I returned to Charlotte for a weekend and met my friend at Kid Cashew. Silly name, but serious cuisine! My friend ordered the quinoa stuffed avocado. It arrived on a bed of shredded lettuce with s yummy, spicy sauce drizzled over it. I ordered the best spinach-feta dip ever. It was warm, gooey pleasure with plentiful chips for dipping.  We sat on their cozy outdoor patio and had the best and friendliest service.  Cheers for Kid Cashew!

pS697K15bjO0h1BWZtLQqg.text: Went to Kid Cashew for happy hour because of the 1/2 off apps. It was pretty quiet and I was able to grab a seat on the patio. While I wasn't crazy about most of the things I ordered, the octopus and shrimp were really good. I'd definitely go back just for the octopus.

4i-KDArkheeqGqcZYqUKFQ.text: Everyone seems to love this place, but I'm not sure I get the hype. I got avocado toast with a poached egg - it was fine. It tasted just okay and was definitely overpriced. My husband got a salad which again, tasted okay but was a pretty small portion for the price. They also don't have bacon which, for a brunch spot seems odd.

DXthKs5lZl3hjdFCc3NXlg.text: The decoration and feel to this place was great.  Large outdoor seating area but a little to chill today.  Pretty noisy on the inside, a lot of people chattering.  So if your looking for a quiet spot this is not it.   The food was good. We ordered the lamb gyro, octopus, sausage and white beans and the Mac and cheese.   The sausage with white beans, Mac and cheese was very good and would highly recommend. The octopus was tasty but I know that is not for everyone.  The lamb gyro was just disappointing.  Fatty meat and just did not taste as good as it should have.    Pricing was reasonable and the service was excellent.

UAKn1gfzIHv1gE5P9dk6Gw.text: I can never say enough about this place. The atmosphere is so nice and relaxed. Love when you sit at the bar that you can see the chefs cook! The menu is so open to options, and shows specifically if you want vegan or vegetarian or just meat!  The bartenders and servers are so kind. They truly go out of their way to make it a great experience! The food is SOOO good! The mac and cheese, Brussels sprouts and the kale salads are some of my favs. The gyros are also super good.   I highly recommend this place for lunch, brunch or dinner!

VNyVSIWtypVz2sMziV7dWA.text: Kid Cashew is the best "bang for your buck" restaurant I have found in Charlotte! The top-notch service, amazing dish quality, and tasteful atmosphere really makes you feel like you are getting a great value.   They have a well decorated indoor and outdoor seating area with an overall classy but rustic feel. Kid Cashew has a great variety of unique and well priced items on the menu including a handful of options from their wood fire grill. The service was great and all of our items came out exceptionally fast.

IXozTOV641uyaVly6SPRhA.text: Let me get the cons out of way.   I'm not a big fan of being served cool to room temp water with no ice. I know ice machines are a pain to keep clean in restaurants but let me have a choice.   When I asked for a straw, its brought to me unwrapped with bare hands. And almost placed on table. Could have been a better way.  Silverware was placed bare on table. Please place on plates or napkins.   House drink Goats Breastmilk was inconsistent. Glasses tasted different. Wish they all tasted as good as some we received.  Now to the great.  Grilled Octopus upon quinoa was very tasty. Could of been served a little warmer but cooked and seasoned very well.  Grilled Asparagus was very good.  Surprised to see lamb burger was 2 patties. Cooked medium well as requested. Chips were tasty.   Nice liquor cabinet and good price on mimosas.   Hopefully will return to try other things. Maybe on a Wednesday to take on the drink specials.

5jqopQHMztCKTrZxyG7a-w.text: Food was okay .. you get a small portion for the cost.. we tried their mimosas they have on special for brunch on saturdays.. the drink was so small and not worth the price.

rlzb-10emv0D6Mism9w2Mw.text: Kid Cashew is a FANTASTIC place to eat.  Simply put, every time I come here the food is fantastic and the environment is modern day farmhouse.  This week was their burger week, so I decided to come in for a break during my driving shifts.  6$ for a delicious lamb burger.  It was a tough decision between their version of a Big Mac and the lamb burger.  Served with chips, this burger is everything you could expect for a meaty Mediterranean mouthful.  Lander (no s) you lead me down the right path and I appreciate you.  Came for burger night, but would gladly pay full price for that treat!

RzEE-ifAySq-PB1b1T5FHQ.text: I went to take advantage of the $6 CLT Burger Week experience and was so glad I did. The lamb burger was amazing along with the brussel sprouts and basil mule I had. On top of that, service was amazing. I believe Jake was tending to my every whim and he made me feel so welcomed. I will be back for sure!!

5O0RssC3z--ZOLVjuuUKrw.text: OBSESSED! I went here to meet up with a friend I was chatting with on BumbleBFF and we sat at the bar for drinks and shared an appetizer. Being new to Charlotte I was kinda nervous about meeting a stranger but the atmosphere was perfect and love the vibe. Also their menu is incredible - we shared the octopus (which is a fave for sure) and we have been back many times since!

E8BCI2mDZ3qmIqY4k99X4A.text: We were really looking forward to brunch at Kid Cashew as our first visit there was awesome. My hubby ordered the beef hash and loved it. I ordered  the quiche and wasn't quite as pleased. It definitely was a frozen product that was thawed and put under a broiler or in the oven to brown the top. On a positive note the mimosa was stellar. Service was good.

AMxmSKT01wnwx_4R8wqIdw.text: Food is on point with generous portions. Drinks are great. It can be really loud in the dining room. It's just the way the sound travels in the room. Great patio. Love it here.

MkApykETsuLt_W7yojqgtw.text: Although the initial hype of Kid Cashew has calmed down a bit, the quality of the restaurant has stayed and it's as good as ever. Dinner party reservation for one of my best friends, and even though the place was slammed, the reservation was honored and we had a table waiting for us. Little things like this bring Kid Cashew from 4 to 5 stars.  I went in with 2 other people and split: A Full Chicken, Pork, Acorn Squash, and Mac and Cheese. Full Chicken was enough so that each of us could have a breast and a wing, pork was 2 pieces that we kind of split up, acorn squash was demolished by forks, and mac and cheese was fought over just to see who could have the crispy bits. Everything here in slammed with mediterranean flavor, whether it was it the herb rubbed skin on the chicken, the awesome citrus sauce of the pork (not anything sweet), or the balance of sweet and savory brought out in the charred squash by a little sugar and fresh herbs.  Like my first time here with the yelp crew, I ordered the Goat's Breast Milk because I'm a creature of habit and also a creature of if-the-menu-puts-an-item-in-it's-own-bubble-it-must-be-worth-it-ism. A mojito with a little bit of an anise flavor from ouzo, I adore this. Not everyone will.   Kid Cashew's environment is True family style, and a cozy family at that. It was such a pleasure being able to share the night with a bunch of friends, and this restaurant really helps propagate those memories.

4MBdeC3KBB8Ty5FJRmT4_A.text: I can already tell that this place is going to become my new restaurant obsession.  After walking by this place for the last few months while it was under construction, I finally made it into Kid Cashew.  The decor is totally rustic.  Love.  The food was also rustic and delicious.  Love.  The staff was so friendly and provided great recommendations.  Love.  I'm totally digging the menu.  Simple, yet inventive.  I started out with the Goat's Breast Milk Cocktail.  It was so fresh and well balanced.  Their cocktails are named after the fresh herbs they put in their drinks, so you definitely know what you're getting!  I had an assortment of food.  Chicken is a MUST GET.  It's a simple preparation with a great seasoning on the skin, and every bit is juicy.  The trout was light and not too fishy.  Brussels were good but the winner was by far the Mac & five Cheese Gratin.  I could seriously see myself having a late night binge with a large pot of that Mac & Cheese, and waking up on the couch the next day with a stomach ache from eating too much.  Yum.  This place has a lot of tables that accommodate larger parties.  If my bday dinner wasn't already planned, I would make a reservation here.  Fun atmosphere.  Simple, shareable, delicious food.  Mac & Cheese Gratin to die for.  Thank you, Kid Cashew for opening up down the street from me.  My friends and I will see you often and look forward to putting your kids through college.

Mmx3Jphk5VkChnewfw7-gQ.text: I have been wanting to come here for a while and I am so glad I made it. I ate here Monday afternoon. It was a gorgeous sunny day and I got to sit outside on their fairly good sized patio. Their menu is small-ish but definitely could please everyone. Vegan and gluten free friendly. There were MANY items that I wanted to try but went with the lunch combo of quinoa stuffed 1/2 avocado and Mac and cheese. It may be one of the best lunches I've ever had. Will definitely return with friends and family.

BWysbNS_DdUYviWWpmWZmA.text: Delicious dinner and excellent service!  Crafty drinks with engaging bartender, so many tasty options on the menu at reasonable prices. Lamb burger and beet salad and Brussels sprouts came out quickly and were delicious as was the key lime pie.  We will be back!  Only slight downside is the noise level, warm weather and outside seating maybe next time!

HHcWHIFKn4o4Zr5qbsXaZg.text: Very impressed. Wife, 2-year-old and I tried this on a whim and were very surprised. Food was on point and it was kid friendly. I had the special of the day croquet-madam, wife had the chicken skewers and salad, and our vegan toddler had the avocado and quinoa. All was great and well worth the price. We shall return!

lEK05TwwZB6WecsB70ZoXQ.text: We visited for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We waited about 20 minutes for a table outside.   A fun hybrid of American / Mediterranean food. Service was great. Food came quickly. I ordered the Greek Salad with chicken added to it. Not your typical salad. It didn't have lettuce in it at all- which came as a surprise. It was a plate of fresh veggies, mostly cukes and tomatoes with bits of feta cheese. I think it was around $4 to add chicken to the salad, but it was a descent sized portion of chicken. I left satisfied.   Our daughter ordered the mac and cheese from the kids menu. It comes with onions cooked into it...which she turned her nose up to at first, but ended up loving it in the end. I nabbed a bite of the mac and cheese when she wasn't looking it was was really good!

l-HGbjQnoJLApRDUB2t5YA.text: The first thing I noticed was that parking was free. Thats always a plus uptown. I walked inside and its a very quaint and cute restaurant. The staff was extremely polite. I got the shrimp appetizer and mac and cheese side. The shrimp was really big and tasty but not the best Ive ever had. It came with a starch underneath the gravy and shrimp.  The mac and cheese was good. I would definitely order that again. Overall it was a very pleasurable experience.

XcJF-dkBeXYFDW3wPD6tlA.text: Love this spot! Unique menu that has something for everyone and the food is fresh, authentic farm to table. The vibe and design are gorgeous - highly recommend for both lunch and dinner!

KVGqyJS-tEs2jhAY8BRHkw.text: The octopus--oh my. My daughter said it was better than what she had in Madrid. We've been here a few times (for the octopus) and I've decided that the apps and sides are the menu highlights. Mac and cheese and Brussels were especially good as were the meatballs and did I mention the octopus.

wP9t1-RozVKwJL9qYemI8g.text: Man, this is literally the best food I have had at a restaurant in a long long time. My taste buds were just overwhelmed, everything was so delicious; from The martinis to the salad, to the appetizer, the entree and dessert. The martinis were rich and flavorful, and had just the right amount of alcohol. The staff was very friendly and gave a girl next-door vibe. The manager was very friendly as well. and came and chatted with us for a little while. My date admitted that he owned a restaurant and not even his food is that that good lol. I give this restaurant a 10 and would recommend any and everyone to dine there. I was there on a Monday, and they had $6 martinis, which they apparently have on Mondays. The manager did tell us that on Tuesdays an entire bottle of wine is half price, and they have great wines, which I do not doubt considering the precedence they have set with delicious food. I will definitely be going back there as frequently as I can and taking my friends along with me.

XBwF1oiOr_4940x2HEStjg.text: Went for a Saturday brunch, and although it was packed, they had tons of seating and we got seated outside immediately. Our server was friendly and joked around with us. The food came quickly too! I thought their mimosas were really good and the vegan options were definitely a plus. We had hummus and veggies and i enjoyed some sort of pita sandwich. I would definitely eat there again and try more.

W0LmLmSHRHQrsTRPFNDJzw.text: Went for a friends birthday dinner, granted it was a large party of 12 and I would be more understanding of the awful service if the restaurant was busy... but it wasn't. There was maybe 10 others inside and out. The staff couldn't get our orders right, food was mediocre and lacked a lot of flavor. We witnessed the chef and so-called-manager argue as it is an open kitchen concept and they had no shame in showing how frustrated they were. Not once did either come by to check on our group or apologize for the lack of... if any one of them had even tried just a tad bit to be the slightest accommodating, maybe we would've given them another chance  Our foodie group have no plans to revisit again

xn0L-nyuaah54wDullqqIw.text: Just had a great evening with family here. Nick the manager is also a very good bartender. Food was tasty and our service was on point. Strongly recommend.

vVrMigYyfYGHraCHT5zuxg.text: I was hesitant to try Kid Cashew but ended up really enjoying it! They have a good selection to chose from and great wine. I got the super grain and avocado salad and it was delicious, fresh and light. The service was a bit slow and despite a decent amount of open tables my friend and I were sat by the bus station outside but those minor issues wouldn't keep me from going back. I'm excited to try more from their menu!

RRKIa7ZL8YyNhjWZEHKtSQ.text: I am visiting from out of town and my friend brought me here for brunch. The food is delicious! The drinks are great! Jaime (spelling) the bartender was awesome. The atmosphere is very laid back and feels like home and family but you can easily see the staff hustling around getting things done. They are very friendly and attentive. Highly recommend!!

8c1ARqJUM-reRnGKVFuXKA.text: My husband and I stumbled across this restaurant on a Saturday afternoon, and I'm so glad we did!!! Their food is so fresh and delicious! Everything from the Greek salad, sandwiches and back lava we had was amazing!!!

zpZ0SsIW6EvCnq0310D-Ig.text: Kid Cashew is located in a seemingly cursed restaurant space on East Boulevard that's been home to at least three different restaurants in the five years that I've been in Charlotte. That being said, after my experience last night, I think Kid Cashew is finally going to be the restaurant that has the draw and staying power to buck the location's odds.   There were very few negatives in my experience, so I'll get them out of the way first: 1) parking was a total nightmare! The next time I go to Kid Cashew I will be ubering because ain't nobody got time to be searching for a parking spot for 20+ minutes. 2) Kid Cashew does not accept reservations, so we had to wait for 1.5 hours to get dinner and I was straight up HANGRY by the time we were seated. I would gladly pay a reservation fee, but please don't make me wait! 3) The place was very noisy, I felt like I was shouting the entire evening and left hoarse... the place was bustling, which is a good thing, but they need to do something with the acoustics because the noise levels were a bit out of control.  Okay, on to the positives of my experience: 1) the bar had a pretty great selection of beer, wine, and cocktails at reasonable prices. I stuck to the house Cab Sav, which was affordable and pretty great. The two men in our dinner party had Sycamore IPAs and, despite the bar being completely slammed, we were pleased with how attentive the bartenders were. We had plenty to drink while we waited to be seated. 2) The octopus appetizer was surprisingly good. I was a bit skeptical when our friends ordered it because I've had some pretty chewy octopus in my day, but Kid Cashew's octopus was very citrusy, tasty, and not chewy in the least! 3) Our server was very knowledgable, friendly, and managed a very busy section with ease. 4) Everyone in our dinner party was pleased with their large plates and left full and pleasantly surprised with the generous portions and reasonable prices. 5) The mac and cheese changed my life! Seriously, it was hands down the best that I've ever had... It was crunchy without being too dry, it was cheesy without being too gooey, and it was perfectly sized for me to share and still have my fill.   I'll definitely return to Kid Cashew, but may wait a few months until it's (hopefully) a little less slammed. I can't wait to try to patio (last night it was simply too cold to enjoy the outdoors), and will definitely uber my way there to avoid the chaotic parking situation. Definitely give it a try, you'll likely have to wait a long time for a table and may leave hoarse with ringing ears, but the food and service is totally worth it!

33VAlRhjV8iyTlSUTbvPOQ.text: We were excited to try this restaurant close to our house.  We were thrilled to get a table quickly inside....should have known!  The food started out on a high note with the trio of dips.  Then we didn't see a server again for 25 minutes.  We finally flagged down a server (not our server) to place our order.  We ordered drinks- they never came.  We had to inquire and they claimed they didn't have the liquor we ordered, even though it was listed on the menu.  The food came- half of it was cold and majority was bland.  Our server never checked in with us- we had to resort to ordering drinks directly from the bartender.  We had an issue trying to pay our bill.  The whole night was a huge debacle.  #wontbeback

F-oOc23y4atDE5GO2Wf5ng.text: Great atmosphere, perfect location with easy parking, excellent staff, average prices.   Won't go back again, but glad we tried it out.  Recommend for anyone looking for a farm to table type of experience.

TMNVmZnpEmpxjMaadyxjLQ.text: I reviewed one year ago - still truly great. A very welcome addition to the neighborhood. Love the cocktail specials. Food is delicious, fresh and solid. Strange, no salt and pepper shakers - is this a trend? What's up with that?

xkRJ3igB8rsAylCIAODs2A.text: Great atmosphere, mediocre service (slow to get started)and mediocre food.... But I REALLY wanted to like this place! I kept trying to find a redeeming quality in the rare salmon ( ordered medium).... Over a beet salad that had 5 pieces of arugula ( isn't a salad supposed to have more than that for $17.00?).......Other salads need the lettuce cut up or come in a MUCH larger bowl.  Lamb burger was TOO salty!  It IS a la carte, which they didn't tell us .... Keep that in mind. They did have great iced tea, good Brussel Sprouts and server was pleasant. But Jenkie WON'T be back!!!!!

qf0wLGfBqtTcmvpH2PVs9g.text: The food was delicious! The main issue was with the kitchen. We had a group of 8 and the waitress mentioned that the food would come out depending on when the plates were ready. Since this restaurant is not a tapas bar I found that strange. The kitchen does not have heat lamps so our food came out at different times within an hour and a half time-frame, we were not able to all eat together. The waitress was aware that we were distressed and helped make the experience more enjoyable with complimentary appetizer/dessert. I will not come back with a large party until they have heat lamps and are able to serve the entire group their entrees at once.

6uDgv4Nv45Rl1dgRwUuFIA.text: Came here one evening with my mother and was so excited to try the food out since the ambiance is so super cute and wait staff was really friendly!   We ordered a salad, octopus, mushroom paella, and Brussel sprouts. First the salad came out and my gosh was it salty. Every other bite had a huge grain of salt that I bit into and was too salty to finish...how can a salad be too salty to eat?! And it wasn't even the dressing!! It seemed like whoever made it sprinkled it with way too much salt on top!! Next came our Brussel sprouts and SAME THING! Brussel sprouts is one of my favorite dishes to order when I eat out but this time, waaaaayyy too salty! The portion was so small but we couldn't even finish it because it was way too salty!  Next came the mushroom paella and then octopus. At this point, our tongues were numb from eating chunks of salt. We were scared to bite into the mushroom dish and sure enough, SALT salt and more salt! The mushroom paella was the worst one of all! You couldn't taste anything but salt! It was SO salty that my mother called one of the wait staff over to tell the chef that it's wayyyyy too salty to eat. The waitress came back and said the chef will gladly remake the dish for us. The octopus was the only thing that wasn't overly salted but it was just okay. The mushroom dish was bought back to us and it was a lot less saltier but still way too salty.   My mother and I both went home with numb mouths and lips. My mother's roof of the mouth started peeling at the end of the meal because of all the salt! (No exaggeration here!)   Overall we were very disappointed with the food. I can't believe everything is SO salty!! I know the restaurant is new so I would love to give it another chance but I really think you should go easy on the salt.

HaK1GSVPnUyx6G6azUVHQg.text: Very anxious to try a  new Mediterranean place...this did not float my boat. It did have a darling interior...Wait staff was very nice...very  informative..but the food..was UNSEASONED! Ordered the Tzatziki dip and rustic Bread, also the Eggplant Caponeta with Bread, And the Grain salad. My Friend ordered the Infused Vodka Cilantro Drink.  I was so disappointed with the Bread served with both dips... The waiter was right..You could share them ...if you wanted to. The tzatziki dip was nothing more than Fage Yogurt...with a tiny bit of Cucumber Skin micro planned over it. No lemon, No garlic..nothing ..NO SALT... The Eggplant Caponata was squares of eggplant ..cold...not seasoned. Tasted like it was made a couple of days ago. The bread, which was pita bread tasted flat..not grilled or warmed up. The Salad was attractive looking, it was Quinoa, Barley, Frissee Lettuce with Raisins and a couple of orange slices and a half an avocado. Such an acidic dressing..no SALT and NO Pepper. I can't understand this...it was such a good idea but it just doesn't work here... Like I said...Good Service..informative waiter staff and cute interior...Food..Just Meh!

QYOADOJRC8SEa8pOvwiE4g.text: Went for a Saturday lunch, there was a good crowd. Beautiful rustic buildout, some communal tables and an open kitchen. Service was very good, attentive but laid back server which I enjoyed.  (There is a kids menu, bonus!) We ordered a Greek salad, not what I was expecting but very good- no lettuce, ha! Just veggies and olives in oil and vinegar with herbs and spices topped with feta. My husband had the lamb burger and I had the roasted pork sandwich.  Both very good. He ordered a side of brussels, I didn't order a side but mine came with the most delicious fingerling potatoes- roasted with herbs and drizzled with some lemon.  The real stand out of this meal was the gelato Sunday. Home made gelato with crunchy butterscotch pieces topped with caramel and chocolate sauces and finished with pistachio. Please save room for this!  We also had the baklava but it was not as crispy as I would have liked.

hjKR8k3nITMv0rls2kwgAw.text: Went in for lunch on a whim and glad we did! We started with some hummus, which was really tasty and was almost like having a little olive tapenade accents mixed into it. Served with pita and whole grain bread. Nice for two people. We had our 4 year old son with us and his Mac and cheese was amazing. The chef watched him from the open kitchen as he enjoyed bite after bite. Definitely made in house! We then ordered a super grains  salad with chicken which my wife said was delicious (looked great) and I had the gyro. This was not the gyro meat on the thing that spins with the heat lamp; this was leg of lamb sliced with pickled onion, fresh tomatoes and a cucumber sauce in a pita. Really tasty and a nice sized portion. They brought out some gelato for my son (also made in house!) and once my wife and I tasted it, it was everything we could do not to finish it ! Needless to say, he finished it all.  Nice place, great service and we will be back.

luUnbdXMcWAwqUMkRoF5wA.text: Today was my second dining experience at this restaurant. Both times the food was phenomenal and the items ordered were grilled and seasoned to perfection. I don't believe one could order anything off the menu that would disappoint.  Also, we had a very large party to accommodate this evening, 11 ladies, and the restaurant did an outstanding job preparing for our arrival. Our waitress JJ was superb and was very attentive!  My only suggestion is for the restaurant to improve on noise absorption/acoustics because it was very loud. However, don't let that deter you. I highly recommend trying this restaurant!

sn5qjrgfqg2Uuw-uF9azMg.text: Don't let anyone fool you - this place deserves AT LEAST one visit! The food menu is unique in its creativity, as well as its smaller selection. Nothing worse than going to a restaurant and having a novel for a menu (ask Gordon Ramsay). Anyway, the house drinks - "Living Libations" - have fresh herbs and are all delicious. The service has been on point every time I've been there. They're classified as Mediterranean but not in a traditional sense...and being a half-Greek who hates olives, I'm great with that! They're consistently busy for lunch and dinner; excellent patio - East Boulevard is great for people watching anyway! Long and short: grab some friends, order the hummus/tzatziki/eggplant caponata app and enjoy! You'll be happy you did.

li8s7pgHs4muewMIEiDEFw.text: The patio was pleasant to sit on,but our server ran over next door to the showmars for 15 minutes and returned reeking of smoke and with a large showmars cup in his hand. The food was fresh but not outstanding or flavorful. There are so many other delicious restaurants in this area I would rather go to instead of an overly priced, mediocre food experience with poor service.

nmymDoIEh1zJwEOjcpV-ug.text: Everything we ordered was great. Our service was really excellent by Kater -Tot.  Loved the cilantro cocktail. Can't wait to go back.

khvP0rGYBqYS2NMEr27vQw.text: We were driving down East Blvd trying to find some place to eat and we notice Kid Cashew and thought we would give it a try. I'm so glad we did.  The staff was friendly. The bartender can make an awesome drink. The food was incredible. Especially the Brussels spouts. So much food we couldn't finish eating it all. Then our server told us about dessert; we wanted to try some but too full. The next time we go back we're just going to try the desserts. I truly recommend this place to any one who love good food and a great atmosphere. Please go check it out.

8EP7swVwY8I4kNVs7QZ8uA.text: One of our favorite places in Charlotte. Small but imaginative menu, great drink selection, and friendly, prompt service. Try the mac and cheese - absolutely can't be beat! We return here again and again. Check out the cozy decor and original wooden floors. Indoor and outdoor seating.

ZGioC23nBptj4sFmThOPaw.text: Pro's:  Cute, a lot of space and good decor.  Good patio. I want to marry the Mac and Cheese. Beet Salad (cold) was delicious. Trio dips were awesome. Morgen (our server did great) with our table of 8.  Con's:  Sandwiches come with a small amount of potatoes (not listed on menu).  Had we known, we wouldn't have ordered the cheesy potatoes that basically were the same thing (and there was barely and cheese on the side order so really they were just fries). It took literally 25 minutes to get a drink!  We ordered them when the food arrived and got them when we were done.  I was scarfing down wine when we were done and full and no longer wanted it.  Not Morgen's fault, I saw her same frustration w the bartender. Not hard to pour wine. Cost of wine is ridiculous.  A glass is over $12.  Have more choices and a house wine that doesn't cost more than most of the food.   Would go back but I'm not running back.....

NRhbEBQw2dJJ6Xcpek2hQg.text: Loved the atmosphere and the food. The Super Grain Salad is a must try! I wanted to jump in the bowl! I also had the Cilantro drink was very good. I never had tequila mixed this way but I truly enjoyed it. I can't wait to take my friends and family back!

lzdqW2to0UxEzqp0EcATxQ.text: We found this new restaurant by reading about it in The Charlotte Agenda.  So glad to have a new Mediterranean restaurant in town.  Yesterday's late lunch was relaxing and each dish was prepared and presented in a very appetizing manner.  We appreciate the fact that no freezers or heat lamps are used, ensuring that the food is always fresh. Enjoyed the open-face chicken sandwich with a side of magic beans while my wife loved her Super Salad.   Take the time to find this place.  It adds a nice bit of variety to what Charlotte already boasts as great food!

fyTwMoSkIzlne-vCMqFBEg.text: Went to kid cashew after seeing their food on charlotteagenda's instagram (drool!) and have been coming back since- mainly for lunch. Very casual interior with that hipster rustic look, but not like overdone garage sale rustic. My pork panini tasted so good it almost felt healthy for me! Pork was chopped up and melted in my mouth. Another sandwich I really liked was the mushroom burger. Didnt miss the meat. They use their dipping sauces to add punch of flavor. It was filling but again fresh and light. The grilled bun was really tasty on its own-smoky, a lil sweet and buttery. Really like that after I eat here I still feel satisfied, feel like Im doing my body good (short of going to the gym) but No food coma and feeling like I have to nap.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great bar scene!

ktgLYz-CH9U6xjU0OwVRTQ.text: This place is doing great for the first year.   Excited to see how this restaurant matures.   Good food, good ingredients.   Check them out.

YtfwI2_HlS7IWBIyRF0A9A.text: Went on Saturday night; thought it would be a great place to bring out of town guests. We got there around 8:15 and were seated right away. My biggest complaint is that our food and appetizers all came at the same time.  We ordered 3 apps and 3 main dishes so when it all appeared at once, the waiter was almost annoyed that he didn't have enough room on our table to place the dishes. I made a (funnyish) comment on how we didn't expect to receive everything at once, and he was unapologetic. Just waited for us to move our glasses around to fit everything.  Next thing we knew we got the check. Nobody asked if we wanted another drink or dessert. We did, but after feeling so rushed, we just paid and went somewhere else for dessert and drinks.  The food was ok. The lamb, which is what they're supposed to be known for, was just ok. Nothing worth coming back for.

RzZvoApYfOcqHLgMbfCYRQ.text: Great food, great service, great cocktails, great patio and parking!!! Finally something that will last at this great East Blvd location. Have been several times and it has always been spot on with both 2 of us and a large group! Please keep it up!!!

ad6ZZlGZe7iu6i2B3DbHQg.text: We visited on a soft opening night and everything we tried was delicious. Out of everything we ordered, the Beef Short Ribs stood out because they were absolutely stellar. They were charred on the outside and tender in the inside. I highly recommend this dish off the "From the Butcher" section of the menu. The Mac and cheese was also delicious. For drinks, I ordered the Basil cocktail and it was amazing (this is coming from a non-cocktail person). The extremely friendly staff and overall service paired with the delicious food is the reason for my rating. I will definitely visit again soon!

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Leg of Lamb was very good. 8oz pictured.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked NC Trout small plate is a dip

bX4qkGAAJJssh5nSs1X4Bw.text: I thought this place was expensive for lunch and just ok. Worth a second try though. Will update my review after I try again.

pR80kjQ75TbJGJK9xISu-w.text: Loved! Great food. Great atmosphere and incredible service. My husband is super picky and he even gave this place 5 stars!

MwfogT4IsSH1SncTjrwvYQ.text: I couldn't have been more disappointed in this restaurant.  I've wanted to go for awhile.  Picked it Sunday for an early dinner. Drinks were good, so at least we had that.  Hummus and pita arrived with burnt pitas.  The manager apologized and took them off the bill.  Octopus was tasty but room temperature. We had to ask for more pitas so not to waste the hummus. The panini wasn't a panini but BBQ on toasted bread with so much mustard it was overpowering, and a skimpy portion of meat.  Lamb gyros were just ok. Beet salad was very good. Chips that came with sandwiches were not.  Water was refilled 4 times before I got ice.  Guess they had pitchers filled and it all melted.  For the price of the meal, a 2 star rating is generous.  Expensive for the quality.  I won't be a repeat customer.  We went to Amalie's for dessert because we couldn't wait to leave.

v2oQy5rVUgRSpsiW04sD3w.text: Dog Friendly, great food, down the street from Freedom Park.   Take your dog there first, then visit this restaurant.   At first we were going to visit The Summit Room across the street, but they had a 45 minute wait, so we came here and it was great.    Super Grains Salad, Forbidden Rice, and Brussels Sprouts.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Super Grains
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Main Sign
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Forbidden Rice

lSPqegVmNklRzGmAice_vA.text: Found this place via the app Offline (if you don't have it, get it. It's an amazing app for finding foodie gems.) Really cool atmosphere here and the food was delicious too. Only downside was that everything came out at once...it must have been pre cooked. We had ordered a bottle of wine and finished eating way before we were halfway through the bottle. As long as the food is good, I don't really mind if it's pre cooked, but having it served all at once really rushed the experience of having a nice night out.

PXs4yeX4TJh9QfGWGnH_bw.text: It was ok. Lamb burger is too much lamb. Mac and cheese is decent. Not a top restaurant but not a bad one. Lunch menu is limited... would I go back? Maybe not. Too many other restaurants to try.

T4tsn94-wT4JgfgN0LOeMQ.text: I went to kid cashew when they first opened and I was disappointed by the quality of food. I tried them again last night and  the quality is a lot better. The beef skewers for the appetizers came into two skewers and they were flavorful but a bit chewy. The shrimp appetizers came in 4 large pieces of shrimp in cauliflower mashed potatoes and they were excellent,  again cooked a little bit too long for me. The flavors on both were still great. I order the classic burger they had on the menu came with two patties it was very mediocre for a burger but I didn't expect much. It's suited my expectations I was just craving a burger. On Thursdays however the first four cocktails are only $5 which was an awesome deal. I got the cilantro which consists of cilantro and tequila and some other stuff which were awesome. I also tried the honey bourbon which consisted of Honey and bourbon LOL. I believe on Monday or Tuesdays they have half off Brown liquor and another special another on another day. I went there late so service was fast prompt and not very busy i would try them again another day.

ToiYKZwT7z__7LhssfmAEQ.text: Visited this place in the first week it was open and got to have dinner with some good friends from church.  The food was good and fresh, and the service was average. Really enjoyed chatting with the general manager about his visions for the place (This restaurant is his second - first was in Davidson - and the chef he hired is from San Francisco).  Food we tried was as follows:  (Starter) Spreads Trio [$12.00] - Hummus, an eggplant spread, and a white sauce with some pita and rustic breads.  Good taste to all the spreads, but amount of bread was lacking AND they charged us $2 for extra bread (without telling us!).  (Meat) Mountain Trout [16.50 per 8 oz] - Well cooked except for the blackened skin which just tasted burnt.  Good-size portion for three.  (Meat) Chicken [$17.00 for whole] - Nice and tender, and quite large (we took half home).  Tasty  - not quite Viva Chicken good, but solid.  (Veggies) Sauteed Greens & Brussel Sprouts [$7.00 each] - Nicely done, though a bit more oily than expected.    Overall, we had a good experience and would return.  Total bill for three was $70.36 (no alcohol, before tip).  Solid food a bit overpriced, but a nice addition to East.  Patio looks awesome for warmer weather!

7aWUblX6YGXqvYMztu09mA.text: Have been here a few times over the past year and am continually impressed.  Eclectic menu but delicious flavors and fabulous cocktails!  I've never eaten inside,  their patio is too nice not to!  My favorite is beet salad and their version of Moscow mule!

D7lAl9G1StaGk6wgP9tMCw.text: Kid Cashew is in a great location and has a cute inside vibe that is sort of french farmhouse meets someone's dining room. The drinks and service were great, the food is meh. Octopus and shrimp appetizer were tasty.  We had the risotto which was WAY overdone and gyro which was nothing special. Have been a couple times and the food is just okay. There are a number of vegan/vegetarian options if someone in your group is looking for that. No reservations, nice patio & easy parking in a lot next door.

vgoAupfOzmyfhUnj9VaoWQ.text: Excellent service, excellent cocktails and mostly excellent food! We were seated immediately upon arrival which was nice (5:45p on a Saturday is a good time apparently!) and was greeted right away by the table attendant who was super friendly. Our server then followed guiding us to the perfect cocktails. We chose the Basil and the Rosemary and they were delish!! We started with the spinach and feta small plate and it did not disappoint! So tasty!! Following that was the mac & cheese and and was equally as yummy! I had the pork panini and my friends had the lamb burger and the portobello mushroom sandwich. They both stated theirs was out of this world. Mine was ok but the overwhelming taste of spicy brown mustard was too much. Maybe a little less of that and the panini would have been great but I couldn't taste anything more than the mustard unfortunately. We had the Brussels sprouts to accompany our meals and they were ok. For dessert we had the salted caramel gelato sundae and it was OMG amazing!!! I'll let the picture speak for itself!   I will definitely be going back to try one of their salads for lunch and another cocktail for sure!! Go try the place out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salted Caramel gelato sundae OMG Amazingggg!!!
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach and feta small plate. So good!!
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Basil and Rosemary cocktails! Both were sooooo good!!

04h-WGlxre7CuCd9ULdE8w.text: I instantly got excited the second I walk through the door as the atmosphere was so lively and I could smell a hint of truffle so I knew I was in for a great dining experience. Of course, the first thing I did when I sat down was skim the menu for the truffle. Found it! Hidden in the forbidden rice you will find will find wild mushroom truffle oil aromatic broth. Very Nice Dish. I ordered the NC Mountain Trout was cooked nicely, I appreciate this restaurant because not only do I find it fun yet charming, overall, the food is very good. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the Lamb Gyro. It just wasn't good enough compared to the rest of the dining experience. Recommendations: Forbidden Rice, Spanish Octopus, NC Mountain Trout.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry Basil- Very Tasty!
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spanish Octopus

ewy3U5jQJhN8iFSm0O0BCg.text: Location 5 stars, ambience 5 stars, service 5 stars... however food was a solid 3. We did come during brunch time so menu was limited... perhaps this is why. Would consider coming back to try different menu items during the week. Giving 4 stars for the fast service as well as chill environment. Small beet salad with addition of chicken seemed overpriced at 13.50. Pita bread was on the hard side.
