Fe37G0SxGB24A4zsVgp8fQ.text: Wonderful waitress and food was Fabulous! Chicken avocado sandwich was superb along with gelato / pistachio sundae!!!

2RNPJ0pS0nX2eoeandJ8Sg.text: Overall great experience! Service staff was personable and attentive but not over bearing. Outdoor patio provides very relaxed environment. The food was excellent. Small menu with quality options and serving sizes. We ordered the Scottish Salmon accompanied by the Brussels Sprouts and the Avacado Chicken Sandwich.

dSM3qITtTll-wHWtfH146g.text: Short version: Had a great experience. Food was good, service was great, would definitely return and would recommend.  Long version: arrived early on a Saturday afternoon. The parking was pretty full but I was still able to find a spot easily. We ordered the brussels sprouts, vegan roasted beets, portobello mushroom sandwich, octopus appetizer, and shrimp appetizer. Everything was very well prepared and had really good flavor. In fact the shrimp was served over grits which were easily the best grits I'd ever had in my life. My party and I have some food in tolerances and our waiter did a great job of allowing us to customize our meals (ie. ordering something without the cheese/bun, or having something served warm instead of cold, etc.). It was pretty busy but the service was at a very good pace. We never had to ask our waiter for anything, he was very attentive with us. They have plenty of outdoor seating, indoor seating and a very large size bar as well. I love that it had plenty of gluten-free options as well as a nice selection of hot teas. Most definitely would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp appetizer served over the best grits &amp; Octopus appetizer. Perfectly cooked!

fmInPIuZU5vs07QtHmNvBg.text: BBQ sandwich for brunch?  We you may want to rethink that.   Red Slaw on a fresh bun with Carolina Smoked BBQ with kettle chips. Simple and honest flavor.   April had the eggs Benedict with Salmon. Anything with hollandaise will not cross my palette, but she was overly happy with her selection.  I do admit, it looks great on the plate.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

SVZmCzgl1Mo7_kFvA-drkw.text: Had lunch here today, and was very surprised with the quality of the food.  My wife had the marinated chicken sandwich, daughter had the macaroni and cheese with chicken, and I had the lamb gyro (no pita).  Our sides were the quinoa avocado.  Everything was very very good.  We look forward to coming back!

odaLPtWza2VFSdROUTgFxA.text: One of the best restaurants in Dilworth! Great healthy options and a trendy atmosphere. Can't go wrong with the hummus and kabobs. Perfect for patio seating on a beautiful evening.

ofEDpJXLkhP-yD65v49azQ.text: Wow Wee Wow! Lovin' everything about this place!! I need to make sure I never move into this neighborhood because I would be here every day!  Cute outside - signage is a wooded original and the patio area is a decent size. Don't be alarm when you walk in and there is a creepy/weird curtain thing  that closes off the restaurant from the "waiting area"... The inside has a cool feel. The lighting isn't too dim, but not too bright. There is music, but you can barely hear it because it's fairly noisy from everyone talking, which means people are truly enjoying their company.   They have a fairly limited menu, however they have perfected it and it is delicious. It's great for people on diets or not!   My friend and I started off with the feta and spinach dip w/ pita bread and celery... DELICIOUS!! I have a love for spinach dip and this would definitely be in my "final four" if there was a bracket. My friend went with the pork shoulder and it was amazing! Perfectly cooked, very tender and full of flavor. I went with the Mac & Cheese, because how could I not with all the mouthwatering pictures of it on Yelp?!? I love Mac & Cheese so it had a lot to live up to, but did it ever... 11 out of 10 stars!!! In my top two of Mac & Cheeses that I've ever had... and that says a lot. They waiter may say that you can share, but DON'T... just don't do it, you'll regret having to share! lol!   We did go on a Thursday night and they happen to have their cocktails for $5, so of course I figured I should try one. I narrowed my pick down to two, but went with the waiter's recommendation of the two. And boy am I glad I did... The Mint Cucumber Mule was TO DIE FOR!!! I can't tell you how delicious it was, it was perfectly concocted!! If you have the day or evening with no plans, BEWARE... those drinks can be dangerous as you could easily drink several and not feel like you're drinking, but will catch up quickly with you! Regardless, it's a must get, but remember it will be hard to have just one!!  I took a look at the brunch menu and it looks just as amazing as the dinner menu! I'm dying to go back (1) to try out brunch (2) to try some more cocktails and (3) to try out that patio!!! This restaurant is the start of a beautiful relationship here in Charlotte...

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

l8pMSlUIt70kxiJgKkMbkA.text: An eclectic atmosphere and menu. Great outdoor patio and craft cocktails. Unique approaches to familiar items set Kid Cashew apart, but sometimes the menu descriptions and what they present don't quite match up, so be sure to ask for a verbal description of your selections prior to ordering.   The grilled octopus is my favorite. A good friend raves about the lamb burger.

KdzmrLlS98gDENa0WbzYMQ.text: A friend and I ate here yesterday for lunch. We ordered from the lunch menu, 2 for $9.95 I believe. I ordered the Mac Daddy Burger and cast iron Mac & Cheese. Oh my word! Both were phenomenal! I felt like a food blogger as I paid attention to all the flavors. The toppings on the burger did not over power the wood fired flavor of the beef. The special sauce was tasty. The Mac & Cheese didn't disappoint. I was surprised to find leeks in it, a combination I never would have thought to try, but it paired well together. This was our first visit to Kid Cashew but won't be our last. Aside from the delicious food, the decor was awesome and the servers were friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. If you're looking for a local place to try you won't go wrong here.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States

jQyP8eJpF7ipHNTv3cNazw.text: With kind of a whimsical tavern atmosphere, this restaurant did not disappoint in the fun department.    The menu selections were good, especially for sandwich lovers.  I had a salad with pulled chicken and a great big avocado on top.  Avocados seem to be their thing as so many menu items included them.   What's up with the avocado?   Fun bar area.  Warm wood finishes and a very open and pleasant atmosphere.  My pet peeves include music that is too loud and tea that is too expensive.   They could have had the music just a notch down and it would have made for a better place to converse.   Likewise, charging $3.00 for a glass of tea seems steepingly steep.   All in all, it was a fun experience on East Blvd. I will remember the fun and the avocado.

F6ow9eg4wSLVhiYE0RlSVg.text: Love Love Love this place.  I used to frequent their sister restaurant - Georges Brasserie. I attended the Grand Opening and have been back to dine several times.  I have introduced several friends to this venue.  I have since relocated but I have to say on some of my visits back to Charlotte I will be stopping by. One of my favs - the squid. YUMMY

3NvIE6vAHBLVCkIegcod0Q.text: The restaurant has beautiful decor. It was very peaceful and a great place for our guest.   Our must gets next time for brunch are: Mac & Cheese: this was my favorite by far but I maybe biased because I love Mac and Cheese. This dish came out sizzling. Imagine 5 cheese all melted together in a hot skillet topped with crispy cheese on top.  Lamb Burger: I am not a big fan of lamb but the burger was very refreshing and tasty. There wasn't a game-y flavor which made it perfect. Not to mention it's a double decker so the portion is huge!  $5 Bloody Mary's: the mix was just right! & need I say more - it was only 5 dollars!  Spicy Feta Spread: the spicy flavors and oils from this dish bring out all the incredible flavors. Topped with warm pita is the perfect combo.   We also ordered: Avocado Toast: This Toast was huge! There was avocado spread with small chucks of cucumber and tomato and the toast was topped with an egg.   Beef Hash: This beef Hash is different from your usual. There were slices of peppers and onions and chunks of meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Hash - not your typical. It has red peppers &amp; onion slices in it.
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. The avocado toast was huge!

4sTfdM_HK7JQUEValI0w9Q.text: Wonderful meal! We stopped by on our way to the airport and ordered 3 small plates - spicy feta (delicious, surprisingly spicy!), chicken skewers, and beans and sausage. All were delicious. The service was friendly and very fast, and our waiter CeCe was charming. Can't wait to go back.

_A8nmlfdtBwa1Wf-i_3MwA.text: Food tasted fresh and was very good. I enjoyed the servers recommendation to try the avocado with quinoa- it was delish! The outside chairs were not comfortable, however, that is my only complaint. Good service.

FaTeMBj2lx9FNH5e3kzYnQ.text: Cilantro drink nasty unless you like the taste of jalapenos in your tequila mcdaddy burger good but I've never been to a place that doesn't offer fries as a side I won't come here again the shrimp and grits ( polenta ) was only bright spot maybe should be priced at 8$ instead of 12$

GKEYtwoJNVcx0ZO0Idx-fA.text: Nice restaurant! Beautifully decorated inside. We were immediately sat and taken care of by a gentleman named Casey (sp). The shrimp starter was amazing! The burger was very good as well as the chips that come along side it. The chicken avocado sandwich wasn't my favorite, but the cauliflower mash and Mac and cheese were really good! They had a nice craft beer selection as well. I would like to go back for more food and a cocktail. I hear brunch is good too!  Though we were there late at night, I would suggest employee conversations be held more quietly or elsewhere. Probably shouldn't be able to tell who the lead server is on the floor. And someone stole food while we were there? Definitely want to return for a more normal evening!

H8WTcZ-lg_KtP64QARjzbA.text: Really nice evening at Kid Cashew. We tried a bunch of stuff and it was all very good. Server was friendly and helpful as well. And she was our bartender. The house special cocktail , Goat's Breast Milk, is not only a great name, it's also very tasty and made with ouzo. Of particular note: Brussel sprouts- cooked perfect and delicious Beets- sweet like candy White Beans- simple dish and addicting Trout- nice crispy skin and light flaky fish was excellent Nice atmosphere. m_difXz0xxoJIb2KXl0u0w.text: Best chicken skewers I've probably ever had. Seasoned and flavored perfectly.  Beet and arugula salad was terrific. The best may have been the decaf blueberry tea served hot with lemon & organic honey. Wow.

F7CtAQCLg5fU2C-x2kJSbg.text: It's always so delicious here and a fun shareable small plate spot.  The wood-fired octopus is wonderful, wood-fires beets with pistachio and mandarin oranges so good, the meatballs are tasty, and on and on...friendly people and they now offer a tart in-house key lime pie with a delightful crust.  The food and ambience are all quality.

SnWrDAth-9aCIk-nqXVNMw.text: Dog Friendly! They brought my best friend water right away. That was awesome!  Food is good! I particularly love the decor. They have half off wine on Tuesday.

HwCOaAHY_hw1xtvW0zrL2w.text: Not sure why I haven't reviewed Kid Cashew while they were still considered the new "kid" in town, but  glad to see it's still here and doing pretty well.  I've passed by many a Sunday to see people sitting on the patio for brunch.  Kid Cashew really stresses farm to table or butcher to table to eliminate the middle men and provide the community with delicious Mediterranean inspired dishes.  The vibe inside is unique and warm with the open kitchen and stylish decor... really neat space to have a restaurant in.  Decided to go here on a Friday for lunch around 12:30... so peak lunch time.  Our server seemed very off her game, but we later found out she was having a really bad day and apologized to us... I actually didn't get her name cause she didn't even introduce herself... totally get having a bad day but it does show you how much service can really make an impact on your dining experience.  Had a light lunch of the beet and tomato salad, roasted brussel sprouts, and house tazeki sauce.  Sadly the gelato machine has been broken, but we got a slice of the baklava which was amazing.  Our water glasses were always full even though we did have a bit of a "lazy lunch" since our server disappeared for some time.  Service aside, I'm glad Kid Cashew is still in the neighborhood.  Once the gelato machine is functioning again, I will have to come back and get their salted caramel gelato sundae.

y6thkaAxFYyoatio3vYG6A.text: Stopped into Kid Cashew for an early evening dinner.   Had been wanting to try this restaurant for some time.   Kid Cashew did not disappoint.  Everything was on point.    Service - Our waiter was top notch.  He was very personable, attentive but not over bearing.   Seemed like you were hanging out with a good friend.  He was very helpful especially because we had some food restrictions.  He helped us navigate easily through the menu based on our requests.     Atmosphere- The restaurant has a great vibe.  We sat outside as it was a beautiful night.  Very relaxing  and would enjoy having out during the daytime.    Food -  The food was REALLY good.  We started with the Spanish Octopus appetizer which was done very well.  It was light but had just enough to satisfy the craving.   We moved onto the Leg of Lamb , Scottish Salmon accompanied by the Brussels Sprouts.  The Lamb again was very simple but had a good flavor.  I didn't have any of the side dipping sauce and was happy with the dish.  My wife had the Salmon (minus quinoa).  Again she really enjoyed the dish as it was prepared well.  Finally the Brussell Sprouts.  Let me first say that I am not a big fan of Brussell Sprouts but I really enjoyed them.    They were just a tad salty but that can be easily adjusted.    Overall it was a great experience.  I would repeat and plan to come back and experience the other options.

gGLARTp27t54MWpgbyiH9g.text: My Wife and I went to Kid Cashew with another couple last weekend, for the first time (for my Wife and I).  We were so pleased with the food, staff and atmosphere.  They have some very good choices, including Vegan.  Everything we had was delicious, and we will definitely be back.

Mx9XOJBSAtL4BXjWNWQ-Pw.text: Love this place. We come here now and then and every time we love it. Great vibe and really great patio. They're dog friendly and we love that. The staff is always kind courteous and knowledgeable. Our server today is Janelle and she is wonderful. We again are leaving very happy thank you Janelle and all the staff we will be back.

Gq-w1tf9y9zDYh5wRQY5yw.text: Everything we had was delicious we had nothing that was nasty. I went to lunch with some friends and I got the lamb burger which came with homemade chips and the lamb was absolutely delicious, it was so juicy and flavorful. My friends got the pick two, which are popular for lunch. Though the food was good I had some drawbacks from the place. One was that the staff wasn't too friendly and wasn't very helpful. Secondly, my friend ordered a martini took a few sips and felt sick the rest of the day from it, I don't know what that was about but it wasn't normal. My friend has been drinking for yeaarss and can handle her drinks so I don't know what happened. Either way because of those drawbacks I probably won't be back despite the food being good.

YMQsTA9X485uVnQZZLwqWA.text: Second time visiting this place and I am still IN LOVE. Cute bohemian atmosphere. Great drinks. Great food. Outstanding service. This place is sooo consistant. Highly recommend. Great place to bring out of town guests and SUPER affordable. Sat outside on the patio today and it was absolutely beautiful out. Manager was also super friendly. Wish I knew everyone's names because the service was so good! Will DEFINITELY be back!

_cavLPKUa2MmDAA2uo0lPw.text: Average food, tasty drink. Ordered the Cilantro drink and very much enjoyed it. The rest of table did as well and the cilantro pieces in the drinks varied drastically since it was probably all made in one batch. I wish I had more cilantro, but still good. Would order again. Chicken sandwich was decent but lacking in flavor. Once i got extra yogurt sauce on side, it was much better. Chips were flavorful and cooked right. I would Go back and try something different.

-Op7G9bnLDq_sSOs_xCDnQ.text: The Mediterranean flare is definitely seen through the menu, but almost mixed with comfort food. Immediately walking in, I was drawn by the design of the space - from the lighting to mixed chairs and even the tableware, it felt very homey and comforting. They have a good variety on the menu, especially for vegetarians and vegans. My friends and I got the hummus starter. I myself got the stuffed avocado, which had some spice, and the Mac and cheese, which was bomb. The only downfall was that for any entree options, you could only get kettle chips - if you wanted Brussel sprouts, Mac & cheese or any other side, you had to just buy the whole side (which $6-9ish dollars was a little pricier than I liked) other than that, good food and service. I'll definitely go back to try other options. The lamb was low key calling my name! Ha

7GaBpHOkXQ2sbPQ9cPERew.text: Absolutely adore this place- the atmosphere and food are phenomenal and the ambiance is fantastic!

C5Ij-VfYLp5cByAdGi-xMQ.text: Sat outside for drinks and apps and was not disappointed! I got a mule to drink which was delicious and then the meatballs, quinoa stuffed avocado, and dip sampler. It was the perfect amount of food and I loved all three. I would definitely recommend starting with the dips no matter what you get!

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dip sampler and drinks

Fjn-ymDaOeQbncxHUtUbPw.text: I came to Kid Cashew for brunch. The pineapple mimosas were light and refreshing. We started our meal with the spicy feta dip served with grilled pitas, which was quite tasty, although I expected it to be warm, and it is served cold. It had just the right amount of spice, and I'd get it again.   For my entree, I got the shrimp and grits and the French toast with a strawberry cheesecake filling. While hearty, I found the unexpected taste of the shrimp and grits (I felt like I tasted a lot of dill) a bit off-putting. Not bad, but not a dish I'd get again. I strongly suggest you get additonal sides with your entree to make sure you're full.  I ordered the brussel sprouts and macaroni and cheese to go, and found both to be just okay.   The service was excellent from the staff at the front door, to the manager that came by to authorize our restaurant week discount.  Although I would come back to Kid Cashew to give some of the other dishes that caught my eye a try, I'm in no rush to return.

7jPddFCjhDcUNhksdyyuVA.text: This might become one of favorite regulars!!!!   Trendy but casual upbeat energetic spot in Dilworth area of Charlotte!!   Our server Matt was super friendly knowledgeable attentive and made excellent suggestions since we were first timers!   We started with a pour of a red blend from Spain  (forget the name) for me and a hoppy IPA for the hubster!   Since they focus on shareable sized tapas plates we ordered 2 appetizers n a salad to share.   We finished off the meal with the most delectable vanilla  gelato I've had!   Our food choices were -   Spinach Feta dip with toasted pita bread - deliciously creamy with leeks and garlic some of my favorite ingredients   Roasted Brussel Sprouts - with garlic and sea salt with a light crunch! If I had to make a suggestion kick it up a notch with a drizzle of honey  or balsamic vinegar to add a pinch of sweetness.   Arugula and Beet Salad with wait for it whipped goat  cheese  - LOVED IT! Gold and Red beets, arugula, cheese lightly tossed with lemon  vinegar n EVOO   Bottom line we will be back!

Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach and Feta with leeks n garlic - yummage on a plate
Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beet n Arugula Salad

kyIqpZMcW_9YzNS4UmdyGg.text: Had an early dinner with friends. Everyone enjoyed their meal. I had a lamb burger. It was delish!! I will definitely go back.

FtXGJSG5E7mLNWH4vP52oQ.text: After hearing so many great things about Kid Cashew, we were excited to try it for a Sunday lunch. It was a beautiful day, so patio seating was ideal. We were sat and given menus and waters and told our server would be right with us. But he wasn't - in our time waiting for our server (over 10 minutes), we watched another group that got sat after us leave and we contemplated doing the same. Once our server came, we ordered our entrees and an order of hummus to munch on in preparation for another long wait.  The hummus came quickly. The pita was tasty, perfectly grilled. The hummus wasn't like any hummus I'd had before - yes, it had chickpeas, but it was more of a thick bean dip. It didn't taste like hummus and you had to use a knife to spread it on the pita in order to eat it. Not impressed.  When our food came, my husband had the     slow-cooked pork panini with "spicy mustard". The spicy mustard had SO much horseradish that you couldn't taste anything else on the sandwich - in a blind taste test, I never would have noticed the pork, Gouda, picked mushrooms or bread. And it came with a side of roasted baby potatoes - he got two, cut in half. Is that a side or an afterthought?  I ordered the lamb gyro. Again, the pita was great. Fluffy, seasoned right and not too thick. The tzatziki was good, although a bit on the sour side and thinly spread, leaving only every other bite with any sauce. The insufficient amount of tzatziki further emphasized how dry the lamb was. The gyro had all the right components, but wasn't tasty enough to finish. Thank goodness I got a bit more potatoes than my husband to make up for it.  The meal ended with another wait - we had to flag the waiter down to get the check and waited another 10 minutes for him to reappear to run our card. Groan. He wasn't that busy - he had one other table who we watched him individually carry out 4 glasses of tea during our wait to have our card run.   Overall, the pros are: great patio, good pita, great service from waiter assistants (our water glasses stayed full).  Cons: while the restaurant is farm to table and doesn't use friers, heat lamps, etc, we found the flavor lacking and food not well prepared. The service was slow... annoyingly slow.

vXy7HY5lbjNjlianAgktLg.text: Cool atmosphere with farm to table style food. Nice patio area with outside seating in a trendy part of the Charlotte area. Would definitely recommend at least trying once. The Brussel sprouts were tasty.

lHYca22XxmeTmXPVFXNyIw.text: Amazing menu, incredible food, wonderful service. This is a great location and the restaurant is beautiful. Absolute perfection, I will definitely be back.

KCHjzTMZLA77Vif0d1RaWw.text: It was amazing hubby and I stumbled upon it yesterday and everything we ordered was delicious right down to the vodka Rosemary drinks!!!! So tummy! If you order the half chicken you certainly can share it with another person, maybe even 3! Moist delicious perfectly seasoned chicken with every bite! Great prices! Will be frequently dropping in on this place for sure. The staff is amazing!!!

Ri5fa5XxqgZw7TRgtkGxhQ.text: Ever since my birthday dinner, this restaurant is by far the best restaurant I've ever been to in Charlotte. Every food I've had so far is full of flavor and has the perfect balance in its seasoning in the food. Here's a list of food that I've had. (All are really great choices!)  Drink: Strawberry Basil  Appetizer:  Spanish Octopus, Smoked NC Mountain Trout, Wild Gulf Shrimp, Mac & 5-Cheese Gratin, forbidden rice  Salad -Super Grains  From the Farmer: Brussels Sprouts, Potato Gratin.

XnAAuLwBZkEdQksd1phU7g.text: Went there for the first time. Great ambience, and courteous service. I had the lamb burger- their signature dish. It was delicious. The Mimosa was great and we enjoyed the Hummus as well. Will visit again.

OeamRV28vPo8YvTJoxa6GQ.text: Food is excellent and service is warm, friendly and casual. The drinks are amazing.   Restaurant is a bit loud so be prepared.    Worth the trip!

McYDG8zv_aq5RG3ErcumfQ.text: Showed up around 4:15 pm on a Saturday, and the place was 1/4 full.  Yet, the hostess wanted to sandwich in our party of two between two other tables when a plentiful amount of tables were open.  Gosh, I hate it when they try to do that.  We refused and asked to be seated at a table in the middle where no one else was sitting.   The service by Joshua was awesome.  He's the reason this rating is a 3 instead of a 2.  The food was "meh."  The baked spinach and feta was ok, and the Brussels Sprouts were ok.  The super grain salad was very good, the Chardonnay was ok, and the Pomegranate drink was extremely good.  The "gyro" which had"ok" lamb was just ok.    The price for baked spinach (small dish), a salad, a side of Brussels Sprouts, a side "gyro", two house Chardonnays and a mixed drink was $63.87.  A seemingly high price for "ok," average, run-of-the-mill  food on a Saturday before the dinner crowd arrived.  Just ok.  Won't bother to go back.

sEhHd_ZvkB3JXYRZaim9Yw.text: I love this farm to table restaurant!  Their menu is set up in the family style which is awesome because you can mix and match various dishes to come up with a perfect spread. Mac and cheese is to die for. Lamb and chicken are delicious!

wMXZx8qazVQrNJiCjE8ukQ.text: This review is mostly based on service. Walked up to the restaurant. Has a great patio and inside is charming as well. Hostess seated us within a few min. Took at least 15 min for our waitress to show up. Finally we ordered our food. We got food before our drinks. Got all small places within 15 min but then took an additional 20 to get entree. Our server was not around most of the meal. Took forever to leave. Tasty food but not worth the bad service.

photos.caption: Photo of Kid Cashew - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor patio

WzMMcUsSoTkPVGVGqSVuXQ.text: Very fun place and interesting, thoughtful food preparation. Nice mix of herbs and spices makes you feel like you're on a villa in the Mediterranean

hQZs7WKHQgQFmAjhduAA_A.text: I went here expecting to be impressed with good food. The atmosphere was great. The wine good. However my lamb burger was just fair. I was not blown away with their food. I felt that my waiter rushed me to finish my meal. I wouldn't say don't go here, but for me it's not like i have to go back anytime soon.

whxkC_FsqvhtD4QQlBr22w.text: Came here on a Wednesday night with 3 girlfriends. At 6:30, there wasn't quite a crowd yet buy within an hour it became quite busy and LOUD. Hey loud can be good, people were enjoying themselves and the place was packed!    Our waiter (Matt?? He sings), was adorable, a lil sassy but a good waiter. He had plenty of suggestions and both for food and beverages. The waitstaff was good about collecting plates and bring our food out without a long period of time passing.    I ordered the Mac n cheese (yum) and lamb burger (eh...was a bit bland). The cilantro drink was great!  Also the octopus app was pretty good!    I wanted to LOVE this place. I won't be back but it's not for poor service or ambiance but rather the menu didn't do anything for me.

CPk_LuA48HR4hQoXANml3w.text: Since we now live in Concord we don't often get deep into Charlotte. With no particular plan we drove by this restaurant and looked at Yelp for quick reviews. We agree, it was a pleasant choice. The staff was helpful, friendly and attentive. We shared 3 brunch items and commented to each other this resturant really cares about presenting quality foods. Only suggestion would be to cut back on the sugar in the sweet tea. We look forward to a return for dinner to try the lamb and some cocktails.

c2KmIFOAvOjLgG-0ItX7oQ.text: I was excited to feed into all the hype around Kid Cashew when a group of 4 of us went on a Saturday evening for a friend's birthday. I arrived early and sat at the bar where I had the Goats Breast Milk - delicious! Once a couple of us arrived, we ordered the hummus, spicy feta, and tzatziki trio which was absolutely delicious minus the fact that we had to place TWO extra orders of pita to have enough. That turned it into an extremely expensive side for what it was.  Once we were finally seated, about 20 mins after our table was supposed to be ready, we continued to sit for another 10-15 until we got service. The waitress was sweet but she stopped by our table maybe 3-4 times the entire night so we felt we were asking for a lot every time she decided to stop by (drinks, silverware, even the basics). We really loved the half chicken and pork shoulder...the flavors were outstanding. My friend was not so lucky with the lamb - it looked like something i would give my dog it was so dry and overcooked. The beet side was excellent. Unfortunately, the mac n cheese and potato gratin were both extremely dry, bland, and disappointing which left me and my friend with a meat-only meal.  When the time came for dessert, we let the waitress know it was our friends birthday and she informed us that "Kid Cashew doesn't do anything for birthdays" but she could bring us a candle if we wanted. Really?!?! After spending $75 on a hit and miss meal you can't even give a girl a dessert? After debating taking the candle and sticking it in the potato gratin of Death Valley, we sucked it up and ordered the heath bar chocolate gelato which helped sweeten our bitterness over the lack of service and dry food.  All in all, I would try Kid Cashew again but between the service and the hit and miss food, I am moving some other new restaurants higher on the priority list to try.

IONntHsVsjgBIwmjESRYPQ.text: I had a great time at Kid Cashew! First of walking in and getting one of my favorite bartenders in Charlotte was a plus. Matt is awesome. On top of making some fine cocktails he told us the best things to try on the menu.  Starting off we had the calamari which was amazing, no complaints there. For my main dish I had the lamb burger which was perfect. I had it medium rare, and it still wasn't gamey tasting which it can make it or break it. Defiantly an awesome choice. My friend had the chicken, which honestly I was against since common I can make chicken at home and it comes out pretty decent. I must say that chicken was hella good. It was at that fall of the bone juicy stage, perfect  (yeah, my chicken isn't like that at home...). For sides we went with the wild rice- yummmm, and then the white beans -ehhh. So probably my fault on the white beans, I was picturing white string beans for some reason and these were white bean beans which I don't like. For being beans they weren't half bad but honestly it's a texture thing. For dessert we knocked back a bottle of wine. Perfect way to end the evening. Must say I will definitely be back!

1QnERXOpzMzkRXv8giy31Q.text: My husband and I went for the first time and just enjoyed cocktails and appetizers at a hi-top bar table.  Excellent service and loved the decor.  Great drinks and we enjoyed every bit of our food.  We will definitely be back for a full meal!

Oo_i-O-E8MI93ThOn4tBjg.text: Annoyed by frequent menu changes that don't have anything to do with the seasons (removing feta dip as an example)   The ambiance is perfect for a date, a meeting or a girls night out-the decor is lovely.  The food is decent, it's close to where I work which makes it convenient.  Not eating beef, pork or lamb makes it a really condensed menu for me but the super grains salad is my favorite.  I do think it is outrageous to change $6 for a 3 shrimp add on and $5.5 for a ramekin of dry hummus isn't okay.  Their hummus should be smooth and creamy.  This is more like a mashed bean/mashed potato consistency.  Would like to try brunch!

T2zYtQfaZyv1QiE7Gcq_5g.text: Adore this Noda hot spot . Loved my meal the lovely waiter and the outdoor seating. I do wish they took reservations for small tables but that's ok !

jjSASxX4Vul0v1oBSRY_pQ.text: Kid Cashew is definitely a unique find in Charlotte.  I had their Avocado Chicken sandwich, it was good but I could have probably made it at home with little effort.  The restaurant has very low ceilings so it is very loud inside, but the outside seating area is nice.  The menu is relatively small so I would recommend glancing at it before you go.

oEXaLMzg19wq6Je3kAyd8Q.text: Cool, hip spot on East Blvd. The menu is eclectic. Farm style...meaning they bring out your food as soon as its ready so if you go with a party your food will more than likely come out at different times depending on what you order. Its not that big of a deal IMO but definitely different. Try the goats breast milk(don't be turned off by the name) its really good.

nfJDxPzT8ejRMqV8chnuGQ.text: I had been dying to try Kid Cashew after the rave reviews I have seen on social media! We had a friend meet us here for an early happy hour dinner. The restaurant has a great cozy vibe.   We came at 5:30pm on a weekday so the place was not crowded at all. But I could see how a weekend evening might be packed. The craft cocktails are the bomb! I had cucumber mule and it was fantastic! I ordered the wood fired beets and the wild gulf shrimp- both were fantastic! The butter sauce that the shrimp came in was amazing! I used bread to sop it up and get every last bit! The farm to table take on Mediterranean was executed flawlessly! If you are into craft cocktails and fresh food check Kid Cashew out!!!

De_H5OAlp7KMU-t7P2MoFg.text: The host at a restaurant should be the most pleasant person that you encounter. It was obvious that the host had to force a smile upon greeting us, and she was very snotty to us when we requested to be seated on the patio, which had ample seating on a very pleasant, sunny Saturday afternoon. We were given the choice to sit at a high-top inside, or wait at least 30 minutes or more. We decided to leave and literally were pulling out of the drive, to watch her seat another couple, on the patio!! Great food, pretentious attitude!!

KzOT75HbdQ7jXVzehnN4ug.text: I really want to like this place - wish I could have given it 3.5 stars. The staff is great - very professional and friendly. I gave it three stars because there is an over-abundance of lemon on two of the dishes we tried. We ordered the octopus, which was a little tough and tasted like lemon and oregano. Then we got brussels sprouts as a side - also drowning in lemon. It just overpowered both dishes. The lamb burger and eggplant burger we got were both very good. I may give them a try again, but steer clear of the octopus and brussels sprouts!

s1VezVjbQWEvkMcq1_z3uw.text: Love their $5 craft cocktails on Thursdays!! The cucumber basil is refreshing and delicious!

f3J6Es-JgVTbxm--8lwWSA.text: Went with five other people and we ended up ordering all the small plates and sharing. Definitely enough food for sharing between the six of us! The smoked trout dip was amazing! It does get loud and hot inside when the place gets full, but the food and drinks are great!

wkTEvXourLR2q8PkbbNQJg.text: This is another place that I had been wanting to try for a while and the stars just never aligned.   Finally we went there and it was excellent.  Even though I feel I ordered wrong but not getting the meats with the dipping sauces my Gyro was fantastic so I only feel a little regret.  I had not had a quality gyro in quite some time and it really hit the spot.   While we were there the place was serving a party of about thirty but we still got excellent service!  It was impressive to watch them take care of a big group and still be able to help us.  I would highly recommend this to anyone and will definitely try the meat plate next time.

ZqExBQONtY54St3TgIGJXA.text: Amazing food! Loved the atmosphere! The staff was helpful :) which is a plus for me .. my coworker and I couldn't believe we have this gem in Charlotte ! Thank you guys !

PqVpeKvX2uyZwIBaRfhz-Q.text: Really liked the interior of the place, has the hipster vibe to match the neighborhood it's in. The staff was friendly and we were seated fast. Had the trio of dips as an appetizer, it was solid, but next time I'd go with only the eggplant hummus, it was the best one of the three. Very good coffee, which is fairly unusual for a food spot. My husband had shrimp and grits as his main course, no complains there. My daughter had the chicken pizza of the kids menu - lots of chicken, looked delicious, she could only eat half, very generous portion. I had the lamb burger, and it might've been the best lamb burger I've had in years, cooked just right, juicy patties, amazing flavor with the bun, onion jam, the mint and arugula. I'll be coming back just for that. Split French toast for dessert, could've easily skipped that, nothing special.  Minus one star for slow service and the way the food came out - three of us had our entrees with 5 minute increments, so by the time I got my food, my husband was almost done eating. The amazing burger would've made me overlook way worse service though. It was that good.

c3FjxIZuyAmmHG5nWaTr2w.text: It's a beautiful place. The custom cocktails, could have been better for the price. The Brussels, tasted like they had been soaked in lemon juice overnight and were very mushy. We ordered the tzaiki  it was great, however all of the bread was burnt and we were charged to receive bread that wasn't burnt.

Yn5Gsqypu11eCzyuhmLqcQ.text: The lamb burger is absolutely amazing! My wife and I eat here all the time and I always order the same things; lamb burger with a side of the Mac and Cheese (second best thing on the menu). So glad we found this spot.

gEp5ZL8qf2ZfSsdrpTbdLg.text: Absolutly love this place!! I was given a gift card so decided to check it out and ever since then I am hooked. The food is fresh and delicious. The environment is hip/relaxed and fun. The best part has to be Fideo. He is so welcoming and always has a smile on his face. Great vibe to wrap up a great meal at a great place!

Bas3dIN-VND7he4ikb89zQ.text: Good food but slow service, even at 230 on a Sunday. Very different and thick hummus but the pits was delicious. octopus was overlooked with too much carmelization, same for Brussels sprouts  but the trout was great as was the ice cream. Worth one visit if your not in a hurry,

_quhxEmKxGT2nJ344kgDUQ.text: Bland and greasy food. Showmars next door does Greek better. Wait staff was pleasant but not all that attentive. We won't be going back.

yOmOUCxWzZ5XVW7AMTZVMw.text: Very cute decor/atmosphere, mediocre food, poor service.  A group of 8 of us came to eat Sunday night and we're excited to try this place, but we were overall disappointed.   They were extremely understaffed. No one came to the table for at least 8-10 min after we were seated. Someone eventually came & got our drink orders and then 5 minutes later our assigned server came to greet us. She let us know it would be tapas style and food would come out as it was prepared which is fine, we love tapas style! Problem was that plates they serve are not truly tapas (we ordered salsa and sandwiches for the most part). They aren't very shareable. Half of the table got their food in about 30 minutes while the second half waited an additional 25-30 minutes for their food (the first half was finished before the second half's food even made it to the table). Everyone at our table agreed the food was mediocre, nothing special.  They realized the service was horrible so did bring a dip trio to the half of the table that had no food for the first hour we were there and they also brought us dessert on the house.  Overall I would probably not go back.

6JNaxHafDeh2EFZsiUjP5A.text: We were SO excited to try Kid Cashew as we heard amazing reviews.   Atmosphere - loved the outside seating, perfect for the warm summer nights here in Charlotte   Food - we ordered the three plate app of hummus, tzatki, and eggplant - this was OK. I've had a lot better. My husband loves the Mac n cheese. We ordered a lamb burger too and after a half an hour they told us they were sold out. Loved their Brussels sprouts.   Service - our waiter returned maybe twice. He didn't bring us our second drink until we had to ask again, about an hour later. Two waiters mistakingly came to our table with plates that weren't our order. The fork was dirty so I had to request a clean set.   Overall, I don't think we'll be returning.

8soFZeLoIZ4rxa5fykSVaQ.text: I would give this restaurant higher stars if it wasn't SO loud. We went for a girls night to catch up, but we had to strain to hear each other. Our waitress even complained about the acoustics in the restaurant when she got our requests/orders wrong a few times because she couldn't hear us. The waitress said it was normally this loud- it wasn't just a loud night. I also wasn't blown away by my cocktail or my food.

ivNkHfl6sYN8sOsz30AzGQ.text: Super cute place. The inside looks great! They really need to have a sign out front that explains who is "KID CASHEW?" This place has a phenomenal patio and location. However.....the food. So-so food. I hate to say that because I really wanted to be impressed. We had to send back the Salmon, it was raw. Our waiter did not ask us how we wanted it prepared, so we assumed it would be Medium. It was raw. The trio app was disappointing, of the trio the Hummus was the best of the three options, and they can put the wheat bread away and just leave the pita wedges please. The grain salad has way too much dressing and was not that tasteful. All in all we were disappointed in our meal and will not go back to eat however we will definitely go back to drink a beer or have a glass of wine on the Patio.

fniezOF2bMAhehFuYY3crw.text: After reading all the really long reviews with a lot of praise, I had high expectations. I wish I could say that I was blown away, but really I was not. Lamb burger was decent but why put two tiny fingerling potatoes on the plate with it. Either serve a side or don't. Multigrain salad was good but didn't enjoy the shredded chicken on top. Wood fired beets took on the flavor of ash and were not enjoyed by my group. Wishing I had ordered the chicken and mac & cheese. Waiter was friendly and attentive but food was not timed appropriately as not everyone's order arrived at the table at the same time.
